loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and has five children. She is 52 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City. 

She earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She now has been in this business for about 30 years and is well known for the nice quality of services she offers.  

She has already purchased some new manicure sets and was able to save from it. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 5,000 per month.
  
Evangeline is seeking a PHP 50,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for her foot spa services. 

In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency. Evangeline is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy special items for her foot spa services.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina is a 43-year-old married woman, and a mother of five children from Iloilo, Philippines. Ma. Christina has earned a living through her fishing business, with her husband, for more than 18 years now. This is the source of their income. Aside from fishing, she also owned a Sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells basic household commodities like canned goods, candies, toiletries, seasoning and condiments.

Ma. Christina is asking for a loan to buy an engine, fishing nets, ropes, nylon, canned goods, chips, condiments and seasoning. 

With this, she will be able to improve her store. Ma. Christina believes that she will can improve her business and make it more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy an engine, fishing nets, ropes, nylon, canned goods, chips, condiments and seasoning

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Susan is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of tobacco to sell to customers.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her to sell in her store.

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory, 39, is a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dory has a manicure business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

Dory requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment.
 
In the future, Dory would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Sara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sara, ha tenido un impacto positivo en su tienda gracias a la inversión del préstamo anterior, comenta que sus ventas son mayores, está  generando mejores ingresos con los que puede cubrir el pago de los gastos de su hogar y las cuotas de la deuda.
Para la Sra.: Sara es importante mantener la fidelidad de sus clientes, por lo que opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar huevos, especias, aceite, bebidas, golosinas, pan y otros productos que son básicos para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: Sara has seen her previous loan have a positive impact on her store.  She says her sales were better, and the store is generating more income with which she can cover costs of her household and loan payments.   It's important for Sara to keep her customers loyal.  Because of this she is choosing to ask for a new loan to buy eggs, spices, oil, drinks, cookies, bread and other basic products to fill her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy eggs, spices, oil, drinks, cookies, bread and other basic products to fill her customers' needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete general renovations on her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the windows and doors in her house

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a clothing shop so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more clothes and goods such as handkerchiefs, shorts, short sleeved shirts and including goods stalls like cooking oil, water and other things to sell. She started this business in 2011 with her own working capital of $400. Florencia is earning a good income from selling clothes because many people are interested in her clothes and would like to buy them. She wants to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management of her business.

loans.use: To buy handkerchiefs, shorts, short sleeved shirts and including goods stalls like cooking oil, water and other things to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself as optimistic. 

Samson operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. He is located in a busy area, and his primary customers come from the general public. 

Samson describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a car within 5 years. Samson hopes that in the future he will have better living standards. 

Samson's previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 37 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Гульмиры - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы и 40 овец, а также 1,00 ГА собственного земельного надела, где Гульмира в основном выращивает арбузы и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистого скота. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на постройку большого сарая.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 37 and married with three children. She has a high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has four cows and 40 sheep as well as 1 hectare of her own land where she grows mostly watermelon and clover both for her own use and for sale. Her monthly income is 20,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulmira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase purebred livestock. She wants to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and plans to save toward building a bigger barn.

loans.use: to buy purebred livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано родилась в 1978 году. Она добрая женщина, любимая жена и заботливая мать. Рано имеет 3 детей. Ее муж преподаватель и получает маленькую зарплату, которая не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Рано уже более 5 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она покупает сухофрукты оптом и продает в розницу на местном рынке. Также она имеет 1 га земли, где она обрабатывает абрикосы, сушит и потом продает как сухофрукт. Ее муж помогает ей введение бизнеса. Они стараются получать больше дохода и предоставить хорошие условия жизни для своих детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Rano was born in 1978. She is a kind woman, [loving] wife and caring mother. Rano has three children. Her husband is a teacher and receives a small salary which is insufficient to provide for the family. For over five years, Rano has been running her own business. She buys dried fruits wholesale and sells them retail at the local market. She also has 1 ha [2.5 acres] of land, where she grows apricots, processes them and then sells them dried. Her husband helps her in her business. They make an effort to increase their revenue and provide a better life conditions for their families. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 7,500 TJS to buy dried fruits and increase her working capital. She is counting on your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits so as to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
43 year old Palestinian refugee, Hanaa was born and raised in a Palestinian refugee camp in North Lebanon. She lives with her husband and four children inside the camp where she and her husband work hard to provide their children with decent living conditions. Two of their children are still students whereas the others were employed together in a chocolate factory. Her husband, who is also Palestinian, uses his truck to sell fruits and vegetables in different areas of the camp. 

In order to support her husband and family, Hanaa started her home based business in 2004, where she provides her clients with all kinds of sewing services. With more than ten years of experience, she has gained the trust and loyalty of her clients who like her honest work and personality. Always looking to increase her income sources, Hanaa also has a part-time job as a cleaning officer in a local organization. 

Hanaa is asking for a 1,927,328 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from field partner Ibdaa. She is planning to use the loan to equip herself with a new and modern sewing machine. The investment will allow her to provide better services to her loyal customers which will also increase her income from her home-based business. As such, she will be able to continue providing her family with improved living conditions despite the unstable socio-economic environment in which her children are growing up.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ghazaleh

texts.en:
Ghazaleh is a 59 year old Palestinian refugee who lives with her husband in one of Lebanon's Palestinian refugee camps located in the North. She has been working hard on successfully establishing her own business especially that her husband has been unemployed for several years. 

Since January 2012, she owns a grocery shop located in one of the camp's busiest streets, which helped her gain a very good reputation as an honest and reliable merchant in the area. Ghazaleh also provides sewing services to her clients in order to maintain a solid source of income from her business.
  
Ghazaleh is asking for a 1,927,328 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from field partner Ibdaa which will allow her to buy merchandise and increase her shop's stock. It will also give her the ability to continue satisfying her loyal clients and maintain her reputation. In addition, this small expansion of her business will allow Ghazaleh to continue providing herself and her husband with decent living conditions despite the unstable socio-economic and security situation surrounding the camps.

loans.use: to increase her grocery shop's stock

loans.name: G.s. La Bendicion Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario La Bendición esta conformada por tres integrantes Martha Lorena, Juana del Carmen y Verónica del Carmen, todas mujeres responsables trabajadoras, con nueve hijos de los cuales cuatro están bajo sus responsabilidades originarias de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, todas con diferentes actividades económicas como: venta de nacatamales, fritanga y pulperia, ubicados en sus casas de habitación, el cual es su medio de trabajo para subsistir con sus hijos, apoyarlos y brindarles oportunidades de estudios, a pesar de las adversidades, los sacrificios que tengan que realizar en su día a día, Martha Lorena quien es la coordinadora del grupo es propietaria y administradora de una pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo diario en pequeñas cantidades como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, aceite, jabón, jugos, galletas, café, pan, Queso Fósforos, toallas sanitarias, tomates, cebollas, chiltomas, bolsitas de shampoo, avena, pinolillos, papel higiénicos, gaseosas entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados, distribuidoras y camiones distribuidores de esta misma localidad, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, uno de sus sueños es poder ver crecer mas su negocio y que sus hijos puedan realizarse en todos unos profesionales, El objetivo de este financiamiento es para  invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, productos congelados entre otros mas , para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
La Bendición Group has three members, Martha Lorena, Juana del Carmen, and Verónica del Carmen. All are responsible hardworking women with nine children between them, four of whom they still support. The women come from one of the municipalities of Chinandega which is located in the west part of the country. They run different businesses such as selling tamales, selling fried foods, and running a corner store, all from their homes. The money they earn is used to support themselves and their children and provide them with educational opportunities despite the problems and the sacrifices they have to make on a daily basis.

The coordinator of the group is Martha Lorena. She runs a corner store selling groceries in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, soap, juices, cookies, coffee, cheese, matches, sanitary napkins, tomatoes, onions, peppers, shampoo, oats, maize drinks, toilet paper, soft drinks etc. She buys the items on account in markets, from warehouses, and trucks that come around the neighbourhood.

Martha starts her day very early when she opens the doors to her store. She has regular customers as well as drop ins. One of her dreams is to see her business grow; another is to see all her children with good jobs.

The purpose of this loan is to enable her to buy more stock for her store such as rice, sugar, oil, frozen goods etc. so that in the near future she can earn more money.

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, oil, potatoes, frozen goods etc.

loans.name: Teresa  Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa de 47 años de edad desde hace 18 años se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón, las comercializa de forma ambulante por los mercados, tiene clientela establecida por la calidad y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas de marañón por mayor,  así como muestra en la fotografía,  para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
47- year old Teresa has earned her living selling cashew nuts for 18 years. She sells them by walking around the markets where she has regular customers because of the quality of the produce and the fair prices she charges. 

Teresa lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She is seeking a loan to buy cashews in bulk as can be seen in the photo. Then she will be able to continue her work which is her only source of income and increase the money she earns.

loans.use: Buy cashew nuts in bulk

loans.name: Las Estrellitas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
En una la localidad ubicada en la sierra se ha formado un grupo de préstamo integrado por 4 mujeres trabajadoras, responsables, solidarias y empáticas, cada una de ellas lucha día a día para poder ofrecer lo mejor a su familia. El grupo se llama Las Estrellitas, nombre que llevan desde el primer ciclo. Las integrantes se consideran una familia y siempre se apoyan, agradecen también la ayuda de VisionFund México por otorgarles un nuevo crédito para poder invertir en sus actividades.

La zona donde se encuentra el grupo es productora de caña en su mayoría, pero también se siembra café y árbol de hule.
Las integrantes del grupo son:
Isabel-Venta de Tacos
Margarita-Venta De Bisutería
Josefina-Venta De Ropa
Nallely-Venta De Toperware

Isabel se ha dedicado a vender tacos desde hace tres años, durante los fines de semana; ella es una persona alegre y muy amable. Durante 6 años vivió en Ciudad Juárez donde aprendió a cocinar la carne para los tacos de manera diferente logrando con ello atraer a los clientes que están acostumbrados a los tacos del lugar donde ahora vive. Doña Isabel también apoya a su esposo a trabajar en el campo pues son productores de caña y recientemente iniciaron a sembrar árbol de hule. Isabel utilizará su préstamo para comprar carne, manteles, sillas, servilletas, desechable y gas para continuar vendiendo tacos. Las ganancias las quiere invertir en su plantación de caña y pagar algunos gastos familiares.

*En la imagen: la señora Isabel lleva una bolsa azul.
texts.en:
In a town located in the mountains, a lending group was formed, comprised of four hard-working, responsible, caring, and empathetic women, who struggle each day to provide the best to their families. The group is called “Las Estrellitas” (The Little Stars). The members consider themselves as family, and are always there for each other. They are grateful for the support provided by VisionFund Mexico by granting them loans to invest in their businesses. 

The group is located in an area where the main industry is the production of sugar cane, but there is also coffee and rubber production (from tree resin). 

The group members and their businesses are as follows: 
Isabel – sells tacos
Margarita – sells Jewelry
Josefina – sells clothing 
Nallely – sells Tupperware 

Isabel has made a living selling tacos during the weekends for three years. She is a cheerful and kind person. She lived in Juarez for 6 years, where she learned to cook taco meat in a way unique to that area. Therefore, she currently has used this to attract the interest of customers who are accustomed to the types of tacos sold where she currently lives. Isabel also helps her husband by working in the field to produce sugar cane, and more recently, rubber trees. Isabel will use her loan to buy meat, tablecloths, chairs, napkins, disposable tableware, and gas, to continue selling tacos. She wants to use her earnings to invest in the planting of sugarcane, and to pay for some household expenses. 

* In the picture Isabel is carrying a blue bag.

loans.use: to buy meat, tablecloths, chairs, napkins, disposable tableware, and gas, for her taco stand.

loans.name: Los Palacios Group

texts.es:
Los Palacios es un grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socios laboriosos y coordinado por la señora Yacela, quien tiene la edad de 26 años, casada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 10 y 6 años, quienes son su mayor motivación para su superación, se dedica a la venta de especies en las calles de la capital, este negocio lo impulso hace ocho años con ayuda de su hermana, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de mostaza, canela, manzanilla, algodón, salsa inglesa, punto azul, etc., y es primer ciclo que solicita crédito a la institución. 
Otra integrante es la señora Irma quien tiene la edad de 32 años y comercializa especies en la capital desde hace tres años, y los jóvenes, Alexander de 20 años de edad, el cual se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde dos años, y Yerald quien tiene la edad de 23 años y su negocio es la venta de especies en las calles de Granada desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
“Los Palacios” (The Palaces) is a solidarity group that is composed of four working members. The coordinator is Sra. Yacela. She is 26 years old and married. Yacela has two children, ages 10 and 6, who are her greatest motivation for her to succeed. She sells spices on the streets of the capital. Yacela started this business eight years ago with the help of her sister. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy mustard, cinnamon, chamomile, cotton, Worcestershire sauce, “punto azul”, and other products. This is the first loan she is requesting from ADIM.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. Irma, age 32, has been selling spices in the capital for three years.
• Alexander is a young man who is 20 years of age. He has been buying and selling harvested crops at the municipal market for two years.
• Yerald is 23 years old and has a business of selling spices on the streets of Granada. He has been doing this for five years.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian, con la buena administración del crédito anterior, la rentabilidad de su negocio ha mejorado y es así como está saliendo adelante con sus diferentes compromisos. En el negocio sigue ofreciendo calzado, lácteos, bolsos y algunos productos de la canasta básica, en la actualidad ha incorporado la venta de ropa para mejorar las ofertas a sus clientes.
Con el inventario que cuenta no le es posible abastecer las demandas de sus clientes, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar chancletas, sandalias, bolsos, lácteos, nuevos estilos de ropa, etc., y así mantener bien surtido el negocio y continuar teniendo ingresos.
texts.en:
Because Lilian used her last loan wisely, her business became more profitable and she has been able to make progress in many ways. In her store she continues to offer footwear, milk products, bags, and other items that are eaten on a daily basis. Now she also sells clothing to better serve her customers.

With the inventory that she has on hand, Lilian is not able to meet her customers' needs so she has decided to seek another loan to buy flipflops, sandals, bags, milk products, and new styles of clothing. These purchases will enable her to have more stock and continue earning money.

loans.use: Buy flipflops, sandals, bags, milk products, and new styles of clothing

loans.name: Valeria Patricia

texts.es: Valeria es madre soltera, tiene 28 años y sus 2 hijos tiene 2 y3 años, Valeria vive en el campo y trabaja de vendedora en una panadería y también hace un año cria chanchos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos donde una hermana que le presta una chanchera para que crie estos animalitos y de las ganancias cubra los gastos de alimentación y vestido a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Valeria is a 28-year-old single mother with two children, ages 2 and 3. She lives in the country and works as a salesperson at a bakery. Valeria has also been raising pigs for the past year.

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. She will keep them at her sister’s place where she has a pig pen that she can use for housing the animals. The profit she earns will be used for expenses, such as food and clothing for her young children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seed, fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is a 26-year-old, unmarried woman with no children. She makes and sells chicken and meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Ruta needs a loan to buy meat, boneless chicken, salt, seasoning, a new oven and bags of flour. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses. Ruta has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy meat, boneless chicken, salt, seasoning, a new oven and bags of flour

loans.name: Moila

texts.en:
Moila is a 33-year-old, unmarried woman with two children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Moila needs a loan to buy fresh meat, cooking oil, yeast, bags of flour, salt and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Moila has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, cooking oil, yeast, bags of flour, salt and a new oven

loans.name: Cristy Lou

texts.en: Cristy Lou has been operating a general store for over five years and she earns well from this business. She had repaid her previous loan that she used to buy additional grocery goods to sell. Her aim is to develop her business, which is doing well. Her husband is earning well, too. To improve her business, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional products like rice and corn grits for her general store. She wants more improvements to her business and to be able to gain more profit to benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like rice and corn grits for her general store

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a single woman and has two children. She describes herself as self reliant. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, shoes, bags and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary clientele is small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more handbags and clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more handbags and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his motorbike

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: Edwina is a married woman. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will own a car. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as committed. 

Elizabeth operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a business with high returns within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a boutique. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sunui

texts.en: Sunui is a 41-year-old single mother of one child. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has two years of experience in this business. Sunui has requested a loan to buy rolls of material, a new sewing machine, thread, needles and a measuring tape. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, a new sewing machine, thread, needles and a measuring tape

loans.name: Dúo Amanecer De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Amanecer de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está formado por doña María Susana de 40 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de Zapatos y Joyas de oro y oro brasileño desde ya hace varios años, en su negocio ubicado en su domicilio Santo Tomas Milpas Altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de Joyas, ya que ya se acercan el tiempo de las graduaciones y fiestas patrias y quiere aprovechar esta temporada para poder surtir su negocio, su anhelo es seguir creciendo en el negocio y poder superarse cada día mas ella y su familia.
texts.en:
“Amanecer de Santo Tomas” Group

This group includes Doña María Susana. She is 40 years old and has been selling shoes, gold jewelry, and Brazilian gold for several years. Her business is in her home, which is located in Santo Tomas Milpas Altas.

María Susana is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of jewelry. With graduations and patron saint festivals approaching, she wants to take advantage of these opportunities to restock her business. Her wish is to keep growing her business so that she and her family can get better each day.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Jacquelyne

texts.en:
Jacquelyne is a female Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself as ambitious and honest. 

Jacquelyne operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of storage facilities. 

Jacquelyne will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy materials to construct a storage facility and also to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a storage facility and to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase spare parts and accessories for her jeepney. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs and the school needs of her children. 
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP, which she will use to pay for the repair and maintenance of her jeepney. It's very important that her jeepney is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service and income.  She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Rosana aims to buy another jeepney to improve her income. She dreams of giving her family a bright future through all her hard work. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: Joachim is a married father of two children, ages 3 and 8. He describes himself as persistent. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area that is growing and his primary customers are ladies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rainy weather, when the market becomes muddy. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to provide quality education for his kids. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. He will invest the anticipated profits back into his business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more tomatoes, onions, bananas, cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials for making jikos (charcoal stoves)

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 51 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. Бактыгул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес в 1991 году. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 19 овец и 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена для скота, что поможет получить весной здоровый приплод от скота. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 51 and married with four children. She works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started in 1991. Thanks to her hard work she currently has four cows, 19 sheep and one horse.

With the goal of further developing her business, Baktygul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase hay for her livestock, which will help them give birth to healthy babies in the spring. She plans to put profits from the business into further increasing her number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase hay for her livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married mother of five children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more groceries to sell. Her business goal is to own other businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will start a cereals business. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 39 years old and married with three children who are in school. Merlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Merlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, cigarettes, canned goods, shampoo etc..

Merlyn has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, cigarettes, canned goods, shampoo etc.

loans.name: Obenda

texts.en:
Obenda is 42 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Obenda has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lorine

texts.en:
Lorine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an environment conducive to business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. 

Her business goal is to employ other people within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a company. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 62 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Lilia has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending. Lilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.ru: Фаррух студент 2 курса. Ему 19 лет. Она холостой и живет с родителями. Фаррух учится в Таджикском Государственном Университете Коммерции. Он после окончания университета получить специальность программист-экономист. Фаррух учится упорно и верит, что после окончания университета он получит хорошую работу и развевать свои знания дальше. Его отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации, а мать работает бухгалтеров в организации. Он обратился в ИМОН с целью получения займа для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Farruh is a second-year student. He is 19 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. Farruh attends Tajikistan State Commerce University. He will be a programmer-economist upon graduating from the university. Farruh studies diligently and believes that he will get a good job after finishing the university and develop his knowledge further. His father is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, and mother works as an accountant at an organization. Farruh came to IMON to obtain a loan in order to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Dúo Rosario De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Rosario de San Mateo
Este dúo está formado por Doña María Priscila ella tiene 51 años de edad y se dedica desde ya hace varios años a la venta de desinfectante elaborados por ella misma, y venta de pollo destazado en su domicilio, ubicado en su aldea San Mateo Milpas Altas, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión de  material para hacer desinfectante, tambos, y la otra parte para la inversión de pollo y concentrado, su anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio y darse a conocer más en su aldea.
texts.en:
Duo Rosario San Mateo
 
Maria Priscila, a part of this duo, is 51 years old and has made her living for several years now selling disinfectant that she makes herself, and selling cut-up chickens from her home, which is located in the village of San Mateo Milpas Altas. 

She is requesting a loan to buy jugs and the ingredients to make disinfectant, and she will use the other part of the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. Her dream is to continue to grow her business and become better known in her village.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make disinfectants and to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and other items.

loans.name: Amelinda

texts.en:
Amelinda works hard to support her family. Amelinda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Amelinda has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en: Floriana is 48 years old and married. She runs a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of gasoline to sell. Floriana has been in this business for three years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 31 years old and married with 2 children. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Bernadette needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new spade, a wheelbarrow, gloves, a tiller, and a new watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

Bernadette will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new spade, a wheelbarrow, gloves, a tiller, and a new watering hose

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and other items.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 10 years. She describes herself as faithful and honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells soda and other drinks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area with a flow of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. Her business goal is to have a good business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks

loans.name: Blanca Elvira

texts.es: Blanca de 57 años de edad vive con sus tres nietos, ella posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente,  Blanca esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. todo por mayor y así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus cliente y tendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca is 57 years old and she lives with her three grandchildren. 

She has a clothing sales business that caters to different styles and all clients, ladies, gentlemen, boys and girls. The clothes are of very good quality and she sells them at accessible prices. This is why she has lately attracted many customers.

Blanca is requesting a loan from Integral to allow her to buy a variety of clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, suits, etc. all in bulk, so that she can always meet her clients' needs, thereby having a more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, suits, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Vitolina

texts.en:
Vitolina is 25 years old and unmarried with 1 child. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Vitolina needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, new gloves, a wheelbarrow, a tiller, a crowbar, and seedlings. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

Vitolina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, new gloves, a wheelbarrow, a tiller, a crowbar, and seedlings

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and married, with one child who is in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be faithful and honest. 

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area with plenty of customers and security, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

He will use the 60,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread and other items. His business goal is to open other branches within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a farm where he grows crops. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a solar energy system for home use. He hopes that, in the future, he will be stable. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a solar energy system

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be outgoing and social. He operates a farm where he grows crops. He describes his challenge to be lack of enough clean water. 

He will use the 40,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy gutters and a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and gutters

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be committed and  focused.  He operates a farm and also operates a motorbike transport business.  He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his challenge to be lack of access of water. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a water tank to store water for domestic use.  He hopes that in the future, he will improve his homestead appearance and have plenty of water. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for harvesting water

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 4 to 12 years old. He describes himself as determined. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are of all types. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 6. She describes herself to be easy going. She operates a beauty salon and a poultry farm. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in urban area and her primary customers are hotels and other institutions. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poultry diseases and expensive feeds.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more poultry. Her business goal is to be able to do large scale poultry farming within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children and enlarge her business.

This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more poultry.

loans.use: buy more poultry

loans.name: Chenita

texts.en:
Chenita is 62 years old and married with two children; she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries, etc. 

Chenita has been in this business for 10 years .

In the future Chenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 39-years-old with three children, two of whom are in school.  Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling personal collection products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 48 years old and married with one child. Celia works very hard to provide for her child, who is in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell, including canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

Celia has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell, including canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario, who is 43 years old, is married and a resident of Tigbawan, Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years.

Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. This past April, both Rosario and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail a loan; they wanted to buy fishing nets. Aside from financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the added benefits like insurance and savings.

Rosario has now applied for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband she will be a successful vendor someday and own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is from Tubod, San Juan, Siquijor, Philippines. She is 49 years of age, and has four school-age children. In the year 2011, she joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op. 

From her desire to help the family, she engages in selling fish in different barangays. Only her motorcycle was used as her source of transportation to reach the different barangays and sell fish. She has had this source of income for three years now. 

In need of additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of Php 50,000. She will use this to purchase more stock of fish to deliver in the market where she can fetch higher prices. 

Through this, she hopes to increase the income so she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is happy she can support the education of her children, which is her main priority and her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Adam has been engaged in the hog raising business to have additional income. He is 45 years old and has four schooling children. He aims to improve his business and make it profitable but he has limited capital. For this reason, he wants to avail himself of a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs. Having this financial assistance, Adam believes that he will be able to improve his business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman, and a mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. 

Aside from her project of constructing pig pens, Paulita is thinking of adding pigs for commercial sale. 

Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Her name is Jenifer, 33, resident of Coron, Palawan.  She is married to Arnold and still childless. She is a kind woman who helps support her nieces in their education.  Her earnings from her business are a great help in their daily needs and school needs of her nieces.

Jenifer is a dental technician by profession and she also sell seafood and hogs on the side. She earns 22,000 a month as a dental technician. Jennifer is a hardworking woman that she also sells crabs, lobsters and hogs. Coron does not only offer the best beaches but also offers the freshest seafood in the country.  Both local residents and tourists love to eat crabs and lobsters which she buys at a local fish port and sells them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every day.

To help continue and expand her business she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan for her business. She will use it to buy dozens of crabs, lobsters and a hog. Coron, Palawan is one of the best island in the Philippines.  Her earnings from her seafood business is a great help in meeting their everyday needs and for the schooling of her nieces.

Jenifer dreams for her business to flourish so she can afford to support her nieces until college. She also wants her family to lead a happy and quiet life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for crabs, lobsters and a hog to sell.

loans.name: Jermelyn

texts.en:
Jermelyn is 29, from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, She learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends.

She is getting ready for the next cropping season. She wants to especially prepare well the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. In the future, she hopes to save enough for the education of her children and a better living condition for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth always has enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Mahayag and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. She knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land  and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 51 years-old and three of her children are in school.

Leonarda has a Agua-based fishing business in the Philippines. Leonarda has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing supplies.

Leonarda has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, cigarettes, milk, etc.

Lolita has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, cigarettes, milk, etc.

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en:
Floramie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Floramie has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Floramie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 47 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Crispina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and chicken to raise.

Crispina has been raising chickens for four years, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and chicken

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is married and she has three children. She has a kiosk and she needs more money to buy more items to keep in her kiosk so she is taking a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy some additional items including biscuits, candy, instant noodles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, candles, slippers, eggs and other things to sell including soft drinks. She opened her kiosk in 2002 with a working capital of $700. And she is taking this loan because she wants her business to grow bigger in the future. She also raises animals in her place like cows, pigs and dogs.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, candy, instant noodles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, candles, slippers, eggs and other things to sell Including soft drinks.

loans.name: Ebet

texts.en:
Ebet, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for 18 years, and  has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

In the future, Ebet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Paese

texts.en:
Paese is a 57 year old, married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Paese needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, a large frying pan, a large gas burner and plastic bags. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also to help with the expansion of her business. Paese has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, a large frying pan, a large gas burner and plastic bags

loans.name: Hernalyn

texts.en:
Hernalyn was inspired to manage a sari-sari store business in their village. She is 39 years of age, married, and has two kids. Hernalyn started to put up a small sari-sari store two years ago. With her ambition to gain more than her usual income, she decided to expand her business stall. 

Hernalyn shares that she spent some of her capital in expanding her business site. In addition, she is requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy grocery items such as powdered juice, coffee, milk, canned goods, and many other things. 

Hernalyn hopes to gain higher income to be able to recover her expenditures in expanding her business stall.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as powdered juice, coffee, milk, canned goods, and many other things

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
This is Emelita, 58, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arjimmy, a farmer, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emelita operates a buying and selling business. What she basically does is buy biscuits from a wholesaler and then sell them to customers with a profit. She also manages their farming business and they earn additional profit through this. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales daily.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of biscuits to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Emelita hopes to grow her buying and selling business and farming business in the coming years and dreams of being able to refurnish and renovate their house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of biscuits needed in her business.

loans.name: Lulita

texts.en:
"Hardworking mother" best describes Lulita, who is 58 years old and resides in Tigbawan, Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines. Lulita has five children and is married to a carpenter. The wage that her husband earns isn’t enough to sustain the daily needs of their family, so Lulita started a food-vending business. She has been in the business for more than a year now.

Lulita wants to expand her food vending business. She wants to gain more profit and have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children. She would like to be able to send her son to college. In order for Lulita to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 4,000 additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy more raw ingredients, utensils, and other things needed. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients and supplies for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be optimistic. 

Maurice operates a retail business where he sells radio cassettes and compact discs. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of radio cassettes and music CDs. 

His business goal is to own a music store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a piece of land. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of radio cassettes and music CDs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is in school, Editha works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc

In the future Editha would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Elaina

texts.en:
Elaina is 41 years old and married. She has four children, who are in school. Elaina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business, buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase more stock of jewelry to sell.

In the future Elaina would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 35 years old and married. She has eight children, five of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena has been raising pigs for three years, and she earns additional income from a general store.


Elena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tacianita

texts.en:
Tacianita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has four children who are in school.

Tacianita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Tacianita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 48 years old, married, and has eight children who are in school.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional cow to raise.

Gemma has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to raise

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 59 years old and has five children, of whom one is in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Aurora requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aurora has been business for 20 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aurora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 52-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are in school. A very hardworking entrepreneur, she has operated a furniture-making business in the Philippines for six years. 

Elena has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her furniture business

loans.name: Janzen

texts.en:
Janzen is 29 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Janzen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Janzen has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Janzen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old and married with seven children. With one child currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as candies, snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent, soap, etc.

Teresita has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more of these items to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. Farming is the main source of their income, and PMPC came to the rescue of Elena by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has availed herself of another loan to pay for labor in seedbed preparation such as mounting of beds, seed sowing, and to buy farm inputs. Elena perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family. In the future, she wants to buy a hectare of land to expand her farming activities for possible business opportunities.

loans.use: To pay for labor in seedbed preparation such as mounting of beds, seed sowing, and to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa has mastered her hog raising business in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care of her hog raising business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 5,000 will help her to purchase bags of feed. In the future, Rosa wants to build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 49 years old. She is known in their neighborhood area for her rice production business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase construction materials for her house so that she can have enough space for the storage of her harvest. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house repair

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Monica is 37 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Monica has a business, offering repair and maintenance services for electronic devices, in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional electronics supply, for her business.

Monica has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Monica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional electronics supply for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm implements and a dairy cow

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 53 years old and married. She has six children. She earns a living by fattening pigs, in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for 25 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Felomina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Jersel

texts.en:
Jersel is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Jersel works very hard to provide for them.

Jersel runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Jersel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
A widowed parent of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling native mats.

Teresita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell to her customers through her buy-and-sell ready-to wear business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 42 years old and has two children in school. She owns and manages a retail store within the local community, to generate income. She aims to further improve her business and increase her income, to help her husband in sustaining their necessities and financing the education of her children. She wants to acquire more grocery items to sell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she wants to borrow additional capital of PHP 15,000.00. She will use the loan to buy more stock to resell, including soft drinks, grocery items, frozen foods, fruits and vegetables. She is hoping that someday, she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell, including frozen foods, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is 32 years old and she is happily married to Robert. God has blessed them with three children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Rowena owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, aPhp5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other things. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby, and the people in the community. She earns Php 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting Php 8,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Rowena desires to expand her variety store someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can get financial assistance for her farming activities, which is her only means of income. 

Josefina has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed a loan to buy farm inputs and pay for labor for plowing, mounting and sowing of seeds. This will help give her farming income a big boost. 

Josefina wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labor for plowing, mounting, and sowing of seeds

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with five children. She is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Gemma is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Gemma has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell. 

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 11 years, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Salie

texts.en:
Salie is 46 years old and has three children, all of whom are in school.

Salie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Salie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Salie has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Salie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 54 years old, is married and a resident of Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

She joined Paglaum MPC to obtain a loan because she wanted to buy fishing nets.  She has now applied for a loan of 45,000 PHP to buy her fish for resale. 

She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with patience and the diligence of her husband, she can look forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale and increase sales

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, age 45, is happy tending her little store. She is a single parent, who is bravely raising her son. The store is her means of earning a living to support her son. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising daily sales. Helen keeps on running the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. Helen believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain the store's business and beat the competition.

Helen has reached her fourth year being a member of PMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She is confident that she can maintain the designation, "member in good standing." She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store, and from there, she could afford a good education for her son.

loans.use: to restock inventory for her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 21 years old and married. She was blessed with two children and they live happily in a rural community. She owns and manages a small retail store to help her husband in gaining income. She aims to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to obtain an additional PHP 10,000 to buy more bread, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soaps, shampoos, assorted candies, beverages and seasonings to resell. With this financial assistance, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more bread, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soaps, shampoos, assorted candies, beverages and seasonings to resell.

loans.name: Claire
