texts.en: Claire, a 37-year-old, is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and earns a living through rice farming. Claire thinks that she landed at the right place for her needed working capital when she joined PMPC. PMPC to Claire came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most and she obtained another loan. Claire perseveres to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family. In the future, she wants to buy a hectare of land to expand her rice farming activities and hopes to become a supplier of rice in town.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer to increase the harvest on her rice farm.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: In 2011, Pablita applied for her membership in PMPC and she was given financial assistance to start up a business. Pablita tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Pablita borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost to increase the crop yield on her rice farm for the next cropping. This will give her farming income a big boost. Pablita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost to increase the crop yield on the farm.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42 years old and single.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Sarah is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

Sarah has been farming vegetables for 15 years and also earns additional income from a house for rent.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 38 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school. Jean works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

In the future Jean would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is 48 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Restituta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Restituta has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy works hard to support her family. Ivy is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Ivy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Ivy has been in this business for 2 years now.

Ivy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional linen and spare parts for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional linen and spare parts for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Ma. Fatima

texts.en:
Ma. Fatima is 61 years old and married with two children. Ma. Fatima works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Fatima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Ma. Fatima has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, bread, canned goods, noodles, etc. 

Ma. Fatima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old and married to a farmer, and they have five children. Farming is the main source of their income,

As a farmer, she always experienced hardships like plowing the rice field and planting vegetables and other agricultural commodities to sufficiently provide for her family. When she joined PMPC, Teresita landed at just the right place to find the working capital she needed.

Now, she has availed herself of a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase farm inputs and pay for land and seedbed preparation. This will help give her farming income a big boost.

Teresita is always looking forward to better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a widow with five children who are all in their adult age. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already obtained loans previously to purchase additional stocks and now she is reapplying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for the store which will increase sales to support her needs and help her granchildren.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a married woman, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has a food-vending business, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Aurelia requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy additional ingredients for preparing the foods, for her food-vending business.

In the future, Aurelia would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for preparing the foods she will sell

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is 51 years old, a married woman with two grown-up children residing in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She and the two children are workers at a sugar cane plantation located in the province. Her husband is a 66-year-old farmer. All of them can earn approximately $17 a day. 

Now Keo would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her daughter, who is selling sugar cane juice in the nearby neighborhoods. This loan will help her family have an additional business to improve the family’s finances. 

In the future, she is going to buy farmland to cultivate rice and will build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her daughter, who is selling sugar cane juice in the nearby neighborhoods.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda is a 23-year-old staff person at a company, where he has worked since 2013, earning $7 daily. He lives with his parents in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. 

Because he lacks financial support, Chenda would like to request a loan to pay for his first year tuition fee. This loan will help him to go through his first year and achieve his goals. In the future, he is going to find a better job.

loans.use: to pay for his first year tuition fee

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 47 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Celerina has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling ready to wear.

Celerina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en:
Eladia is 55 years old and married with three children, of whom one is in school.  Eladia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, groceries, etc..

Eladia has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Eladia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 38 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Rosemarie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosemarie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is 60 years old and widowed with four children.

She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Vida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional cow to raise.

Vida has been raising cows for 28 years, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le h pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una venta de ropa de segunda mano y tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente, vive en casa propia con sus padres, el joven  está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. todo por mayor para tener mejores ingresos y seguir  ayudando en su hogar.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has a second-hand clothing stand and has different styles for everybody: women, men, boys and girls. The clothes he sells are high-quality and he sells them at good prices, which is why he has made a lot of customers recently. He lives in his parents' home. He is requesting a loan that would allow him to buy a variety of clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, suits, etc. He would buy everything in bulk to have a better income and continue helping with his home expenses.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, suits, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban, who is 35 years old, is married and has five children (four sons and one daughter) who are at school. He is a businessman running several projects for six years now.

Shaban runs a "genge duka" (small grocery shop) selling fruits, vegetables, rice, beans, maize and baking flour, cooking oils, and other items. He also manages a general store, working from 6:00 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. per working day, and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

Shaban is now requesting his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Shaban used his previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, to restock his genge duka with foods, fruits, and vegetables. He also bought inventory for his general store. In the coming years, Shaban would like to sell his general store items at wholesale prices.

He plans to invest his new credit in a new venture selling ladies clothes and to buy stock for his genge duka (rice, fruits and vegetables, beans etc.). He will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling ladies' clothes and to buy stock (rice, fruits and vegetables, beans, etc.) for his "genge duka" (small grocery shop)

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: From his furniture business, Peter is able to provide for his eight children’s basic needs. According to him, he is willing to accept all his customers’ orders and work overtime, just to give his children necessities and send them to school. Five of his children are attending school; three are in college level of education and two are in high school. Peter is making chairs, tables, and cabinets. Sometimes he cannot accept some of his customers’ orders because he doesn’t have enough capital to sustain it. Because of this connection, Peter is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy woods and varnish for his business. He believes by borrowing the loan he can now accept all of his customers’ orders. At the same time, he will increase his profits that will be used for the education of his children

loans.use: to buy woods and varnish for his business.

loans.name: Deliwinda

texts.en:
Deliwinda is 26 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Deliwinda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, coffee, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Deliwinda has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles, coffee, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, coffee, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a married woman with three children. She is 25 years old and has two children currently in school.

Jinky is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Jinky would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida  y su hija; Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene 10 años con este trabajo y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener los mejores resultados, su  negocio está ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y frecuentada por las personas de la comunidad,  en estos últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar su inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano, etc.  para continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 46 years old and lives with her husband and daughter. She has been selling tortillas for 10 years. She has a lot of experience which enables her to have great results. Her business is located in a very strategic location and is frequented by people in her community. Over the past few months demand for her tortillas has increased and she wants to take advantage to increase her business but she doesn't have enough capital. Therefore she asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will enable her to buy corn at wholesale, propane gas, etc. to continue with her work and have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Elba Maria

texts.es: Elba Maria, mayor de edad soltera con dos hijos menores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, y la producción de la caña, el ron y la azúcar, Elba es una microempresaria administradora de su propio negocio el cual consiste en un mini pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar en pequeñas cantidades como: bolsitas de avena, pinolillo, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, bolsas de azúcar, arroz, aceite, papel higiénicos, entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados distribuidoras de esta localidad, sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio con fondos propios productos de su trabajo anterior y logro ver que esta era una opción para seguir trabajando y lograr estabilizarse económicamente y brindarles una mayor seguridad a sus hijos, su jornada diaria inicia desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio y que sus hijos puedan ser todos unos profesionales, no es primer crédito con león 2000, ha venido incrementando su inventario al igual que si demanda ha crecido, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: aceite, frijoles, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros mas, Elba Maria agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Elba Maria is an adult single woman with two children. She is from a municipality in Chinandega, in the west of the country. This region is characterized for being productively commercial, and for the production of cane, rum and sugar. Elba is a microentrepreneur that manages her own business, which consists of a mini grocery store where she offers home consumption products in small quantities, such as: oats, cornmeal, candy, soft drinks, juice, sugar, rice, oil, toilet paper, among others. She purchases her products in cash in distributor markets in her town. She sells in cash and has regular and occasional customers. 

She started her business with her own funds that she saved from her previous job. She realized this was a good option to continue working and be able to have economic stability and provide more security to her children. Her work day begins very early when she opens her business' doors. One of her dreams is for her business to grow and for her children to become professionals. This is not her first loan with Leon 2000. She has increased her inventory as the demand has grown. The objective of this new loan is to invest in working capital by purchasing home consumption products such as oil, beans, soft drinks, and candy, among others. Elba Maria thanks greatly the support that Kiva lenders offer to people of limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy home consumption products such as oil, soap, candy and rice, among others.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 50 years old, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Vicenta has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vicenta has been in the business for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Virley

texts.en:
Virley is 43 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Virley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries. She has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Virley would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Kagongo Tweyombekye Group

texts.en:
Regina, a member of the group, and other group members appreciate the great work done by UGAFODE and the Kiva lenders. Being a widow, she needed financial support thus joining the group, and because she did not have any form of collateral to stand. She has three children and also takes care of her brother’s two sons whose mother ran a way from the husband.
 
She runs a small drug shop with just minimal capital of less than 500,000 where she earns income to look after the family. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to add more stock in her drug shop, to increase her working capital, and to use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children. Her customers are neighbors and a few outsiders. She is a very hardworking lady, despite the fact that she has a few challenges like insufficient capital to expand her business, but she is grateful for the financial boost.

loans.use: to buy drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de lato riesgo, tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 3 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Vive en casa propia con su madre, la joven solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This young woman's face appears blurred in the photo because she's 22 years old and she lives in a high risk zone.

For  the last three years she's had a beauty salon business that she operates from her home. She works from 9 am to 7 pm and has many clients since she works very well. She lives in her own home with her mother, and she manages to cover the household expenses with her earnings.

She is requesting a loan to buy products for her beauty salon such as creams, shampoo, hairpins and scissors, among other items that she needs in order to increase profits to help her achieve better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, among other items.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be hardworking and committed. She operates a retail business where she sells eggs and also cooks fries for sale. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her challenge to be poor access to clean water. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future, she will purchase a vehicle for transport. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
39-year-old Alma is a resident of Mcarthur, Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has three children. The oldest child is 18, while the youngest is 1-year-old. 

Alma raises hogs. She has been in the hog raising business for almost three years. Aside from hog raising, Alma is going to open up a sari-sari, or variety store, to augment additional income. She is asking for a loan to buy stock for the store like canned goods, beverages, chips, and other basic commodities. These will attract more customers. 

Alma hopes that, with the additional capital, she can make a better profit from her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, beverages, chips, and other basic commodities to stock her store.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Elsie aimed to improve her small retail store to earn a higher income and sustain the necessities of her family. 

She wants to acquire more grocery items to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders through ASKI amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of bread, junk foods, coffee, soft drinks and biscuits to resell. 

She is hoping that she can use her loan request to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy stock of bread, junk foods, coffee, soft drinks and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of one child, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Virginia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
La última temporada de Leopoldo ha sido todo un éxito, la cosecha se vendió en buen precio, por lo que sus ingresos económicos mejoraron. Por esta razón, el agradece a todas las personas que le ayudaron en este crecimiento, el cual fue logrado por el préstamo anterior con el cual pudo comprar abono orgánico y semillas. A sus 68 años de edad, no ha dejado de crecer con cada siembra, cumpliendo ya 50 años como agricultor.
Leopoldo quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, semillas, fertilizante y una vaquilla para seguir con la nueva cosecha de calidad y al mismo tiempo obtener más respaldo económico. Al cancelar el préstamo le gustaría mejorar su finca. Por el momento no se considera una persona autosuficiente, pero asegura que está a punto de convertirse en una, debido al esfuerzo que tiene en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Last season was very successful for Leopold. He sold his harvest at a good price, thus increasing his income. For this reason his is thankful to all the people who helped him grow his business. Through his previous loan he was able to buy organic manure and seeds.

At 68 years old, he hasn't stopped growing his business with every season. He has been farming for 50 years. Leopold wants to continue investing in his business. Therefore he seeks a new loan to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, and a young cow to continue with a new, quality growing season and at the same time have backup economic support. Upon paying off his loan he would like to improve his farm. At the moment he doesn't consider himself self-sufficient, but he assures that he is at the point of being so, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, and a young cow.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is a 40-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. He has run his farm business for years, and he makes a good income from this.  Together with his partner, Anabel, he is working hard to provide for their everyday needs. He is determined to give his family a good life and looks forward to increase his profit through his business.

Juanito grows different varieties of vegetables on their farm located in Cavite. It is in the highlands, which are well suited to grow vegetables and fruits. He sells his produce to a market that he regularly supplies and to the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

He is taking out PHP 10,000 loan assistance to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his business. He will be utilizing the loan to improve his farm business and also to increase his income.

For the future, he dreams of having his own place to display and sell his produce in order to attract more customers.

Juanito meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week in a setting where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Letecia is 50 years old and has 3 children who are still in school.

Letecia has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a college-educated smallholder farmer in the village of Ntima. She considers the fact that she has stayed married for 24 years and given life to three children a blessing. It is the love for her family that keeps her going as she struggles to raise money for her children's education fees, including college fees for her first born who is 24.

Janet was born second last in a family of seven children. She describes her upbringing as "challenging." The only way out of the hard life she knew was through hard work and persistence. She carried these tributes over to her business life. 

In 2004, she decided to utilize her husband's 0.4-acre piece of land to keep poultry for egg production. Originally, she had used the space to grow vegetables, bananas and trees.

She considers herself to be much more hardworking than most farmers. She is also always eager to seize new business opportunities that cross her path.

Janet is seeking a KES 60,000 loan to purchase dairy goats and more poultry to add to the 10 hens that she already has. The more hens, the more eggs, which will give Janet more chicks and more income. The goats will be used for meat and milk production. Many parts of the animal are economically valuable for a variety of purposes such as the skins for leather and the pelts for rugs. 

Income from this investment will enable her to help her children build a strong foundation for a brighter future through education.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats and poultry

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru:
Эту простую сельскую женщину зовут Мавлюда. Она родом из села района Джиликуль. Джиликульский район расположился в южной части Хатлонской области республики Таджикистан, на площади в 1,83 тыс. кв. км., который тонкой ниткой вытянулся с севера на юг по обоим берегам реки Вахш. Погодные условия в районе более мягкие и благоприятны для ведения земледелия и скотоводства, поэтому основная часть населения занимаются этими видами деятельности.    
Мавлюда сама по натуре трудолюбивая честная женщина. Она на протяжении около 35 лет занимается земледелием - выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она любит свое ремесло и гордится этим. Ее семья получает не только доход, но и экологически чистые и свежие продукты.
Мавлюда живет в селе вместе с сыном, дочерью, невесткой и внуками. Ей 53 года. Ее сын предприниматель. Он также помогает матери в ее посевных работах. В данный момент Мавлюда нуждается в кредите для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Она хочет удобрить свои посевы, чтобы получить качественный урожай. Прибыль с деятельности она планирует потратить на ремонт магазина сына. Мавлюда надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
The name of this simple country woman is Mavlyuda. She is a native of a village in the Jilikul district. Jilikul district is located on an area of 1.83 thousand square kilometers in the southern part of the Khatlon province of the Tajikistan republic. The district stretches as a thin thread from north to south along both coasts of the river Vakhsh. The weather conditions in the district are mild and suitable for farming and animal husbandry, and this is why the majority of the population is involved in these types of businesses.

Mavlyuda is a hardworking and honest woman. She has been involved in farming - growing agricultural crops - for about 35 years. She loves her work and is proud of it. Her family earns not only an income, but also ecologically clean and fresh products.

Mavlyuda lives in the village with her son, daughter, daughter-in-law and grandchildren. She is 53 years old. Her son is an entrepreneur. He also helps his mother with her sowing work. At the present time, Mavlyuda needs a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. She wants to fertilize her soil in order to get a quality harvest. She is planning to spend the profit from the business to repair her son's store. Mavlyuda relies on your responsiveness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her next crop sowing

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Tucked away in the countryside near the Kaplamai, Kitale area of Kenya is a jobless man-turned farmer named Jacob and his family of four lovely children. He is a hardworking man and aggressive with the principle of truth on his lips; he is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. 

“Kaplamai” in the local dialect means “valley”. In this valley are a people who, in their totality, constitute wrenching statistics. Hardcore poverty pervades every homestead yet every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see a sea of people: a sea of about 5,000 bright, vibrant, open faces, searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it’s possible. They are like the bones in the “valley of dry bones” that required only a breath to spring back to life. 

Armed with this conviction, Jacob has kept hope and has been toiling on his farm for the past 7 years. His primary sources of income have been milk, poultry and some “side hustles” he does to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. The Kaplamai area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a sea of people but the mill keeps breaking down; hence farmers are not able to grind their maize. Jacob intends to change this and is requesting a loan to buy an electric posho mill, which will grind corn or maize into flour. Maize meal is very common in Kenya and is a staple food for many communities. Many Kenyan families consume the maize product “ugali“ (hard porridge) regularly. The market usually provides sifted flour, but the cost is higher because of the sifting and packaging. Cheaper flour can be obtained by milling the maize directly using a posho mill. 

Through this loan, Jacob will be able to grind maize faster because he will use an electric posho mill. Cases of breakdown will be long history because electric posho mills are more reliable. This loan will assist Jacob to permanently change his life and achieve his life mission of driving economic development and poverty alleviation in communities in arid and semi-arid areas. Profits from the posho mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan, which Jacob promises to fully repay on time. In the next two years, Jacob sees himself as a very established businessman who will be running more than one posho mill in his remote village. Jacob patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an electric posho mill

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en: Paterna, 49 years old, is married and has four children, three of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 3 years, Paterna has operated a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of eggs to sell. In the future, Paterna would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of eggs to sell

loans.name: Orquideas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Orquídeas de San Bartolo
Este dúo está formado por doña Maricela, ella tiene 35 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de orquídeas en el mercado la cuchilla de San Bartolomé Milpas Altas desde ya hace varios años, así como venta de arreglos florales y crianza de animales, ella está solicitando el crédito para compra de masetas, broza y fibra de coco para la decoración de sus orquídeas, su deseo es seguir creciendo más su jardín de orquídeas  y poder tener todo la especie de orquídeas en su jardín.
texts.en:
Dúo Orquídeas de San Bartolo [Orchids Duo of San Bartolo]

Half of this duo is Maricela, who is 35 years old. For many years, she has sold orchids for a living in the Cuchilla Market of San Bartolomé Milpas Altas, including floral arrangements. She has also worked raising livestock.

She is requesting this loan to buy flowerpots, leaves, and coconut fiber to decorate her orchids. She wants her orchid garden to continue growing and to be able to have every species of orchid in her garden.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting and flower arrangements to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza es casada tiene 3 hijos y vive en El Alto Ella se gana la vida como ayudante de costura pero no trabaja de manera independiente, por eso quiere un credito para compra de maquinas de costura para abrir su propio taller, pues desde hace mucho tiempo ella ha querido tener indepedencia Aunque su esposo trabaja como carpintero colocando pisos de parquet, lo que el matrimonio gana no es suficiente para solventar este emprendimiento, por eso Maritza necesita su ayuda, ademas ella goza de buena salud y tiene muchos deseos de superarse
texts.en: Maritza is married. She has three children and she lives in El Alto. Maritza earns a living as a sewing assistant, but she does not work independently. On account of this situation she would like a loan to purchase sewing machines to open her own shop because she has wanted to obtain independence for a long time. Although her husband works as a carpenter installing parquet wood floors, the amount that the couple earns is not enough to pay for this investment, therefore, Maritza needs your help. Moreover, she is enjoying good health and she has a lot of desire to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines to open her own shop.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa, 42 years old, is married and has four children. She has been farming bananas for 18 years and also earns additional income from food vending. Marissa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a married woman and a mother of five children from Dulag, Leyte. She makes a living by selling fish and cooked foods to the people in her place.  This is the source of her income. Imelda is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell, and additional ingredients for food vending like meat, cooking oil, seasonings and vegetables. She believes that this loan could help her in improving her business as well as her income. In the future, Imelda aspires for a better life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and additional ingredients for food vending.

loans.name: Dúo Sinaí De Peronia Group

texts.es: Dúo Sinaí de Peronia: Este grupo esta conformado por la señora Telma de 44 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta de sandalias y calzado de plastico se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en calzado para la venta ya que nececita mas capital para agrandar mas su negocio,espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Dúo Sinaí de Peronia [Sinai Duo of Peronia]

One member of this group is Telma, who is 44 years old. She sells sandals and plastic footwear, and has for many years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to sell because she needs more capital to expand her business. 

She hopes that you all can help her with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase plastic shoes to sell

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 60 years old and married, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonita runs a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Leonita has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Fehmi

texts.en: Fehmi is a father of three children, living with his family in an Ashkali community.  As most people in their community, they are very poor and live in substandard living conditions. Fehmi is the main source of income for his family and works long hours to provide for them, working as a guard. For the first time he is requesting a loan in order to renovate his house. He would like to replace the doors and windows before the winter, so that he can improve their living conditions by cutting down on utility costs and keeping them warm and dry, also improving their health. Fehmi’s goal is to be able to open his own business in the future and give his children a better life.

loans.use: to replace the doors and windows before the winter so that he can improve their living conditions.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 29 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Marites has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. She has been in this business for six years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Sixta es una mujer de 63 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo y su negocio es una tienda de barrio con productos de primera necesidad.
Ella es independiente, trabajadora, responsable, constante y paciente. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘El Torno’ un área rural que acoge la llegada de productos agrícolas de todo tipo; frutas, verduras, animales, etc.
Sixta es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatua mediana, su lengua materna es el español y también habla guaraní porque cuando era niña esa lengua era más utilizada por sus vecinos (al centro, bluza azul y pantalón blanco), debido a la necesidad de expandir su negocio, formó una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus actividades comerciales. Su vida la comparte con su pareja y su hijo que asiste a la universidad técnica. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con artículos de primera necesidad como; papel higiénico, víveres, refrescos, algunos artículos de librería, etc. su negocio es el sustento de la familia, Cada día ella se levanta muy temprano a recibir el pan y pronto empiezan a llegar sus clientes, su labor la realiza de lunes a domingo sin descanso desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta muy tarde por la noche. Ella sueña con ver a su hijo profesional y desea dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
es por esos motivos que Sixta solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes en general y con los beneficios ayudar  a terminar la universidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sixta is a 63 year old woman. She lives with her spouse. She has a son and her business is a neighborhood store with products for basic needs. She is independent, a hard worker, responsible, steadfast and patient. Her business is located in the 'El Torno' zone, a rural area that hosts the arrival of all types of agricultural goods: fruits, vegetables, animals, etc.

Sixta is of medium height and she is dark skinned with long black hair. Her native language is Spanish and she also speaks guaraní because when she was young this language was used a lot by her neighbors. (She is in the middle of the photo in a blue blouse and white pants). Because of the need to expand her business she formed a bank composed of people with different businesses and similar needs to seek loans and to continue with their commercial activities. She shares her life with her spouse and her son who is attending a technical university. Her business is a neighborhood store with staple items such as: toilet paper, food, drinks, a few items for reading, etc. Her business sustains her family. Each day she gets up very early to receive bread and her customers quickly begin to arrive. She works Monday to Sunday without a break from very early in the morning until very late in the evening. She dreams of seeing her son become a professional and she desires to provide a better quality of life for her family. It is because of these motives that Sixta is seeking a loan to purchase general groceries and to help her son complete his university studies with the proceeds.

loans.use: to purchase general groceries and to help her son complete his university studies with the proceeds.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 53-year-old, married woman and a mother of four grown-up children, from Leyte, Philippines. 

She earns an income through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Susana wants to augment her stocks. With that, she will be able to improve her inventories and attract more buyers in her store. 

Susana dreams of a more sustainable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like noodles, soda, coffee, sugar, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and detergents.

loans.name: Saumolia

texts.en:
Saumolia is a 30-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has two years with this business. 

Saumolia needs a loan to buy four new tyres, a new battery, rear window wipers, and a new front bumper. She will use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. 

Saumolia joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy four new tyres, a new battery, rear window wipers, and a new front bumper.

loans.name: Deonisia

texts.en: Deonisia lives in Ermera, and she is married and has eight children. She has a kiosk in her house, so she requesting a loan of USD 800 from Tuba Rai Mentin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy needed items to keep in her kiosk. She opened her kiosk in 2007 with her own working capital of $1,500. She was happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods, because in the future, she hopes make her business bigger. Deonisia also like to cultivate animals like cows, pigs, dogs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, aqua, eggs, lighters, candles, soaps, sardines, batteries and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Analy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa mayor de edad casada con un hijo menor de edad, originaria de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal,es una microempresaria y administradora de sus propios negocios el cual consiste en la venta de cosméticos, mercadería en general y pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo diario como: granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, gaseosas, hielo, pan, huevos, productos congelados entre otros y  de buena calidad y accesibles para sus clientes sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados, camiones distribuidores y distribuidoras de esta misma localidad,tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio con fondos propios productos de sus ahorros de trabajo anterior, empieza con una pequeña ventecita y de esa forma ha ido invirtiendo poco  a poco hasta tener bien surtida su pulperia, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar su negocio para generar mas utilidades realizar ciertas mejoras a su vivienda para ampliar su negocio, por lo que hoy en día Candida Rosa Solicita un financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo en sus negocios en surtir con productos básicos como arroz, frijoles aceite, golosinas entre otros tambien invertir en mercadería en general variedades de ropa, zapatos, productos plásticos y cosméticos como: maquillajes, cremas, perfumenes entre otros mas, al incrementar la magnitud de su negocio puede comprar a mejores precios, surtir de todo lo que no pueda tener, los productos mas demandantes y así obtener mayor volumen de ingresos y ofertarles mejores precios a sus clientes.-
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is a married adult with a young son.  She is a native of Chinandega, which is located in the western region of the country.  She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with a strong desire for self-improvement.  She is a small business owner who manages her own businesses which include a cosmetics business, a general store and a convenience store where she sells products for daily use such as basic grains, soap, detergents, soda, ice, bread, eggs, and frozen goods, among other items.  Her merchandise is high quality and affordable for her customers.  She buys her merchandise from markets, and distributors from the region.  She has loyal customers as well as irregular customers.  She started her business with her savings from her previous work.  She started with a small window and little by little she invested until she has a well-stocked store.  She starts her day very early, opening the doors to her business and tending to her customers.

One of her dreams is to expand her business so that she can increase her profits and make some repairs in her home.  For these reasons, Candida Rosa is seeking a loan to invest in working capital for her businesses by purchasing basic goods such as rice, beans, pol, snacks, etc.  She will also invest in other general merchandise like clothing, shoes, plastic goods and cosmetics including: makeup, creams, perfumes, etc.  By increasing the size of her business, she can purchase products at better prices, stock her store better with the products that are in highest demand, and in so doing, increase her income and offer her customers better prices.

loans.use: invest in working capital by purchasing basic grains, general merchandise and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the floor in her home.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 44 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Teresita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jover

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Jover works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jover is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to purchase kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Jover has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a corn mill operator business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her machine for her corn mill operator business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns more income from selling ready-to-wear. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her corn mill machine.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Ema has been in this business for ten years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Ema would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Sixty-seven-year old Alicia is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She has one grown child. 

Alicia is engaged in a food vending business, where she sells home meals like stewed vegetables, fish, chicken, meat, and rice. In addition to this, she is engaged in a rice retailing business, where she sells rice on a retail and wholesale basis. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies such as vegetables, spices and rice, and for additional capital for her rice retailing business. These will help Alicia cater to the family's daily expenses. 

Alicia hopes that she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as vegetables, spices and rice, and to obtain additional capital for her rice retailing business.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 39 años de edad, viuda, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 5 años y dos hijas de 18 y 16 años, su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Ella es independiente, buena madre, luchadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la feria de ‘Batallas’ los días sábados a partir de las cuatro de la madrugada, esta fería se caracteriza por la aglomeración de productores lugareños que se juntan a vender sus productos la mayoría son; ganado vacuno, ovino, derivados de la leche, camélidos, y producción agrícola como; papa, chuño, quinua, etc.
Rosmery es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es típica, (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla muy poco español. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno, y también la producción de queso. Inicio su negocio por herencia familiar, antes trabajaba con su esposo que se fue y la dejó con cuatro hijos, sus hijos mayores son casados y no viven con ella, sus hijos menores asisten a la escuela. Su casa cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz y agua. Su sueño es dejar el campo y emigrar a la ciudad, comprar una casa y abrir un restaurante. Ella necesita realizar la compra de ganado para la crianza, producir más leche para hacer queso y engordar el ganado que tiene para venderlo.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado y con los beneficios ayudar a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a 39 year old woman.  She is widowed and has two sons, ages 20 and 5, and two daughters, ages 18 and 16.  She has a business selling cattle.  She is independent, a good mother, a constant fighter, responsible and hardworking.  She works in the "Batallas" market on Saturdays, starting at 4am.  This market is known for its abundance of local producers who come together to sell their products.  The majority of the products sold are cattle, sheep, dairy products, alpacas, and produce such as: potatoes, potato flour, quinoa, etc. Rosemery has a dark complexion and long, black braided hair.  She wears the traditional dress (blanket, skirt and hat), her native tongue is Aymara and she speaks very little Spanish.

Her business is selling cattle and producing cheese.  She inherited this business from her family, and before this, she worked with her husband who left her with four children.  Her older children are married and no longer live with her.  Her younger children attend school.  Her house has basic electrical and water services.  Her dream is to leave the countryside, move to the city, purchase a house and open a restaurant.  She needs to purchase cattle that she can raise so that she can produce more milk to make cheese, and fatten the cattle that she has to sell.  For this reason, Rosmery is seeking loan to purchase cattle and use the earnings to care for her young children.

loans.use: purchase cattle.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and three go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 16 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested from MCDT–SACCO a loan of 900,000 UGX to buy a box of tomatoes, onions, pineapples, watermelon, cassava, and cabbages. Her major challenges are seasonality, perishability, and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, pineapples, watermelon, cabbages, and cassava.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela has owned and operated farmland, planting and harvesting pineapples to sell, for more than 20 years. She was able to provide for her family and has successfully repaid her previous loans used for farming. She earns well from her investments.

Marcela wants to improve her farm, for she wants to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time PHP 50,000, to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm.

In the future, Marcela wants for her children to be able to complete their schooling through all her hard work in business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed for her pineapple farm.

loans.name: Solidario Superacion Group

texts.es:
Solidario Superacion: GLENDA YANETH
ella tine 48 años y tiene tres hijos hace 16 años tiene su negocio de lacteos ella tenia una tienda chiquita y asi fue viendo como el producto le iba obteniendo mejores ganncias, se decidio a vender solo queso por menor 2 litros de crema casiun promedio de Q72 en aquel tiempo y desde entonces quito la tienda y puso su negoco en su casa y asi fue creciendo, conocio a FAPE Y ella encontro un apoyo para que ella tuviera ahora mas producto y mas ganacia ahora ya todos los lacteos los vende por mayor y asi fue creciendo, ella estamuy agradecida y entusiasmada por el gran medio que es KIVA y ahora ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de quesos
texts.en:
"Solidario Superacion": Glenda Yaneth

She is 48 years old and has three children.  Sixteen years ago, she started her dairy business.  She had a small store, and little by little, her product started to generate greater earnings for her.  She decided to sell only cheese and cream in 2 liter amounts, averaging 72 Quetzals at that time.  From that point, she closed her store and moved the business to her home.  As her business grew, she found out about FAPE, which became a source of help for her to increase her production and her earnings.  She now sells all of her dairy products in bulk, and has continued to grow.  She is very grateful and enthusiastic for this opportunity with Kiva to get her children ahead.  She is seeking this loan to purchase supplies to make cheese.

loans.use: purchase supplies to make cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new chairs, combs, a dryer, and dyes for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 57 years old and married with ten children, one of whom in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Eliza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Eliza has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Aida is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en: Enriquita, 42 years old, is married and has six children, three of them in school. For the past 15 years, Enriquita has been raising pigs and also earns additional income from poultry. Enriquita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en:
Guloglan, 28 years old, has been a taxi driver for 7 years. He is married and has a child. He lives with his family in Mahmudlu, a village in the Fuzuli region. Guloglan and his family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their home which was in the city of Fuzuli. 

Guloglan wants to increase his business, so he has applied for a loan of 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair his car engine. He says great thanks to Kiva organization for the aid. In the future, Guloglan wants to change his car.

loans.use: to repair the car engine

loans.name: Confiamos En Ti Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5  socios responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal. “CONFIAMOS EN TI ” una de ellas es la Sra. Kely  de 33 años soltera y con 3 hijos, la Sra. Kely  se dedica ya hace 2 años a la venta de  productos de belleza  en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder ayudar a su familia y poder pagar los colegios de sus hijos, la Sra. Kely ha logrado mejorar su economía  y mejorar su calidad de vida , y  así Seguir mejorando su negocio , su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos sean profesionales , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más productos de belleza (cosméticos)  y así poder tener más ingresos. a la vez Sra. Kely se le distingue por su polo de color negro, se  despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The “CONFIAMOS EN TI” communal group is formed by five responsible members with a variety of businesses. One of them is Kely, who is 33 years old and has three children. For two years, Kely has made a living by selling beauty products every day in a small store with the objectives of getting ahead, being able to help her family and paying for her children's high schooling. Kely has been able to improve her earnings and her quality of life, and she keeps improving her business. Her greatest dream in life is that her children will be professionals. She will invest the loan granted in buying more beauty products (cosmetics) and will thus be able to have more earnings. 

Kely is wearing a black polo shirt (first person from left to right); She says goodbye with a hug to Kiva and EDAPROSPO, and she is grateful for the loan provided because it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia has a teen who is now in college. Through her income from selling street foods, Amalia is able to sustain their daily needs. She is selling street foods from in the afternoon until seven o’clock in the evening. Amalia needs to double her income to have enough funds for the education of her child. She wants to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw meat, hotdogs, and ingredients for her barbecue business. She believes that the loan will have a big contribution to extend the foods she vends, increase her income, as well as provide for her child’s needs for school.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, hotdogs, and ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 16 years, she has operated a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. Mirasol has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell. In the future, Mirasol would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza is 43 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. Rizza is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Rizza has been in pig fattening for 16 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rizza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Chann, 41 years old, is a widowed farmer with four children living in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been in this work since 1984. Chann's three grown-up children have been employed as garment factory workers. Together, they earn approximately $18 a day. Since her three children spend a lot on traveling, Chann would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for them to commute to work. This loan will help to improve her family’s finances. In the future, Chann wants her children to have a shop for designing clothes and build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en: Anacleta is a 63-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown-up children from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in firewood vending and vegetable farming. Anacleta is asking for a loan to buy more firewood, seedlings and fertilizer. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and her income. In the future, Anacleta hopes to make her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more firewood, seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 47 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Helen has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, rice, noodles, sardines and other groceries. Helen has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like snack foods, rice, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roselyn is 51 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Roselyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, peanuts, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Roselyn has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save money to expand her business and secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, peanuts, flour, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 10 years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. Nelia has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Florencia se dedica al negocio de venta de pasto, la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pasto.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Florencia has her own business selling grass. She sells grass from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has spent 5 years working on this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a grocery store. She is seeking a loan to purchase grass. Florencia is happy because of the loan and she promises to complete her portion of the payments .

loans.use: to purchase grass.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Sixty-two-year old Benedicta is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has four grown children. Benedicta operates a sari-sari (or variety store), where she sells basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasonings, toiletries and rice. She has been operating a sari-sari store for almost 10 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy commodities like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other basic commodities. These will help improve her daily earnings. 

Benedicta hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy commodities like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other basics

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, 28 years old, is married and has two children, both in school, Rosemarie works very hard to provide for her family. For the past year, Rosemarie has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as coffee, juice, milk, canned goods, noodles, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Romela

texts.en: Romela is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 6 years, she has operated a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. Romela has requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Romela would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Welnida

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Welnida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Welnida is borrowing 31,000 PHP (Philippines pesos)  through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Welnida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a single father of one who practices mixed farming and another side business for a living. On his small plot of land, he keeps goats and grows bananas and other crops using irrigation. He is also a very keen observer of the market dynamics. He believes the market is the most important factor in business because it dictates what products are produced. 

Justus is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats. He will also use the money to expand his horticultural farm. Goat's milk demand is increasing by the day. Taste and preference is slowly shifting to goat milk because it compares favorably in nutritive value with cow's milk, but it contains smaller fat globules that make it easier to digest. 

Justus will use money from this investment to provide the best for his child. His difficult upbringing motivates him to strive to provide better for his child. His dropping out of school in form 1 forced him to get in the real world and make a living. He stopped believing in luck as he hustled for survival. Today, he has goats that produce milk for sale, he supplies bananas that he grows at Nkubu market, and he also owns a motorcycle that helps him ferry goods and passengers. 

Justus has grown to be independent. He considers himself to be more confident and hardworking than most people are. He grows trees on his farm because he believes human activities are responsible for climate change.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats and grow his horticulture business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор родилась в 1972 года. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Гулбахор занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она предоставляет услуги портнихи более чем 5 лет. Гулбахор имеет достаточного опыта и знает своё дело отлично. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов и делает индивидуальный подход каждому клиенту. Она знает все тонкости своего дела. Гулбахор очень заботиться об образовании своих детей. Они учатся в средней школе. Гулбахор запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки книг, тетрадей и других школьных принадлежностей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulbahor was born in 1972.  She is married, has two children, and has worked as a seamstress for more than five years.  She has a significant amount of experience in her trade, and knows all the fine details that go into making women's clothing.  She has her own set of regular customers, and takes an individual approach to every order.  

Gulbahor worries a lot about her children's education.  Her children are currently in grade school, and she is seeking a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy books, notebooks, and other school supplies for them.  She is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: buy books, notebooks, and other school supplies for her children

loans.name: Dúo Elizabeth Group

texts.es:
DUO ELIZABETH
Este dúo está liderado por doña Victalina de 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos  y desde hace 4 años tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa, además hace tubo con prensa, es una mujer muy trabajadora y nos cuenta que solicita este crédito porque necesita comprar artículos de consumo diario para su tienda, además quiere comenzar a vender un poco de verduras que le piden y pollo, quiere que fape la apoye ya que con sus ganancias ayuda con los gastos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en: This duo is led by Victalina who is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. For 4 years she has had a small store located in her home. In addition, she makes pipes with presses. She is a hard working woman and she told us that she is seeking this loan because she needs to purchase items for daily consumption for her store. In addition, she wants to sell a few vegetables that her customers request and chicken. She wants the support of FAPE because her earnings help pay for the cost of maintaining her home.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 30s, is single with one daughter who is still at school. She has been running two businesses, selling fabrics and running a mamalishe (café) for three years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a  a good monthly profit.

This will be Halima's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling fabrics, bought a cooking stove, saucepans and cooking ingredients, and has paid back all the loans successfully. She is doing great and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land and has covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy fabrics, cooking oil and baking flour for her mamalishe business. She dreams of growing her businesses.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group, "Blue," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, and cooking oil and baking flour for her mamalishe (café) business.

loans.name: Charina Rosario

texts.en:
This is Charina Rosario. She is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to utilize the loan to purchase more stock of eggs needed to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Charina Rosario now focuses on managing their mini grocery store. She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

In the future, Charina Rosario hopes to sustain the needs of her family, especially her children's education. She also dreams of expanding her "sari-sari" store. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
