* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman and a mother of ten grown-up children from Dulag, Leyte. She earns a living through her sari-sari or convenience store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. 

Virginia is asking for a loan to buy more stock, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings. A loan would greatly help Virginia in improving her business and in making it more sustainable. In the future, Virginia aspires for a better life.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings

loans.name: Gissela Veronica

texts.es:
Gissela es una madre de familia que siempre se preocupa por sacar adelante a su familia es por ello que desde hace varios años trabaja como cobradora de combi en su ciudad natal, Lima. En sus tiempos libres le gusta conversar con sus hijos sobre cómo les fue durante el día en su colegio y los apoya con sus tareas. Desde muy joven sabe lo que es el trabajo fuerte, lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional por eso quiere que el futuro de sus hijos sea diferente.
Gissela va a utilizar el crédito para comprar un televisor y cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar como la alimentación de sus hijos y pago de algunos servicios, ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para más adelante abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en: Gissela is a mom who is always thinking about getting her family ahead. She has worked as a fare collector on buses in her hometown of Lima for many years to support them. In her free time, she likes to talk to her children about their day at school, as well as helping them with their homework. She has worked hard since a young age and sadly this meant that she was not able to pursue her studies and become a professional. For this reason, she wants her children's future to be different. Gissela plans to use the loan to buy a television, and to pay some household expenses, such as food for her children and bills. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. She wants them to know that the loan is improving her quality of life and that she will continue working hard to be able to start her own business.

loans.use: to buy a television and to pay household bills

loans.name: Blanca Edilia

texts.es: Blanca, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y vive junto a sus conyugue e hijos en una comunidad que pertenece al Municipio de Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado al cuidado de sus hijos y del hogar y a la agricultura, lleva 14 años de sacar producción de maíz y frijoles junto a su pareja donde han obtenido ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para comprar semilla mejorada e insumos para siembra de maíz y frijol, con el fin de sacar buena producción y vender mas. Su idea es crecer con esta actividad.
texts.en: Blanca is 42 years old. She has three children. She lives with them and her husband in a community that belongs to the municipality of Yoro. Blanca has always worked looking after her children, taking care of the house, and farming. She has been growing corn and beans for 14 years alongside her husband. Together they earn money to support their family. Blanca is requesting a loan of 5,000 lempiras to buy enhanced seeds and supplies to sow her corn and beans. This will help her to increase her production and sell more. She hopes to grow with this business.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds and supplies to sow corn and beans.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 50 years old, is married and has six children, one of them in school. Susan works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 9 years, Susan has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc. to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en: Clarissa, 33 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past year, Clarissa has operated a meat vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat, ice and plastic bags for her business. In the future, Clarissa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat, ice and plastic bags

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny Margot ella es soltera y tiene 38 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollos al horno, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.
texts.en:
The members are part of the “Siempre Unidos” ("Always United") communal bank. This group is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province of Cusco and within the department of Cusco. Yenny Margot is 38, single and has 2 children. She works in her restaurant business, preparing various dishes such as oven-cooked chicken, soup and Peruvian salted meat dishes. She works from 8 am until 7 pm. She has been running this business for 10 years, and it is going really well. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business.

She is asking for a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables. The other members work selling clothes, running a food business, a grocery store and a business selling handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Milagros Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Milagros Yolanda se dedica al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Milagros Yolanda works as an elementary school teacher. She works from 8:00 a.m until 2:00 p.m. She wants to move ahead through her job. Her dream is to have a store where to sell clothing. The member is requesting a loan to buy a television set for her house. She is very happy with the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a television set for her house.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia se dedica al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante,la socia ya tiene varios años ene ste trabajo, el sueño de la socia es ser dueña de un colegio. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sonia works as a primary school teacher. She works from 8:00 am until 2:00 pm. and she would like to move forward with her job. She has worked at this job for many years and her dream is to own a high school.

She requests a loan to purchase a sound system for her home. She is happy to have the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a sound system for her home.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 26 years old and married. She has one child, who is in school.

Aileen is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Aileen has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Aileen has had her pig fattening business for nine years, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Aileen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es:
Al hablar de Horacio es imposible evitar notar que es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de Colombia. 

Horacio no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como jornalero, decidió iniciar con su propio cultivo de maracuyá en el municipio de Sonson y asi complementar su actividad ya que encontraba mucho tiempo disponible para trabajar.

Es por esta razón que el señor Horacio solicita un crédito para la compra insumos como pesticidas, semillas, abonos, entre otros, que le permitan realizar mantenimiento a sus tierras y mejorar sus cultivos.

Su sueño es que dios le permita tener salud para trabajar incansablemente y poder generar buenos ingresos para comprar el un terreno de tierra mas grande.
texts.en:
In talking with Horacio it is impossible not to notice that he is a born farmer, raised and trained with the noble values of the countryside such as humility and hard work. These two qualities are the most representative of Colombian farmers. 

Horacio wasn’t satisfied with the income he earned as a day laborer. He decided to start his own passion fruit farm in the Sonson municipality to complement his work, especially since he had a lot of free time to work more. 

For this reason Horacio is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as pesticides, seeds, and fertilizers, among others. These elements will allow him to keep his crops.  His dream is that God gives him good health so he can continue working tirelessly and be able to generate a good income so he can buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as pesticides, seeds, and fertilizers, among others.

loans.name: Wily

texts.es:
Wily es un hombre de 29 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es emprendedor, optimista, luchador, fuerte, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la ‘Isla Suriqui’ que es un lugar notable por la fabricación de las balsas de totora, que permitieron al hombre andino navegar en el lago desde épocas remotas.
Wily es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla muy poco español. Su negocio es la pesca, trabajo que heredó de sus padres que también se dedican  a lo mismo. Su trabajo lo realiza solo, porque todavía no encuentra compañera. Su vida la desarrolla en la isla donde trabaja y su vivienda cuenta con agua potable y luz. Su sueño es tener otro negocio en la misma comunidad como ser; una tienda de barrio. Él desea realizar la compra de redes de pesca de distinta variedad también necesita refaccionar su bote para generar mejores ingresos y abrir una tienda de barrio.
Es por esos motivos que Wily solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca, refacción de bote y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Wily is a 29 year old man. He is single, has no children and he works in the fishing industry. 

He is enterprising, optimistic, a fighter, strong, constant, responsible and a hard worker. He works on the "Suriqui Island" which is an area known for the manufacturing of reed boats which allowed Andean men to navigate in the lake since ancient times. 

Wily has a dark complexion, short black hair and is medium height. His mother tongue is Aymara and he speaks only a little Spanish. 

He has a fishing business, which he inherited from his parents who were dedicated to the same. 

He works alone because he has not found a companion yet. He lives on the island where he works and his house has potable water and electricity. 

His dream is to have another business in the same community; a neighborhood store. He wants to buy different types of fishing nets and he also needs to renovate his boat in order to generate better income and buy a neighborhood store. 

Wily is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets, renovate his boat and realize his dreams.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, renovate his boat and realize his dreams.

loans.name: Victor Javier

texts.es:
Victor es un joven emprendedor, quien vive con sus abuelos en Ica, tiene muchas ganas de sacarlos adelante y brindarles mayor bienestar. Desde hace varios años trabaja como chofer, brinda servicios por toda la zona de su ciudad y cree que le está yendo bien por su arduo trabajo y porque siempre trabaja con honestidad y ética. Debido a los deseos de superación que tiene, está estudiando la carrera de Control de Calidad para más adelante gozar de mayores oportunidades laborales.
Victor en esta ocasión utilizará el crédito para poder comprar un celular y así mantenerse comunicado con su abuela, quien todos los días se preocupa por cómo le estará yendo. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque así le dará tranquilidad a su familia. Más adelante Victor quiere comprarse una moto propia para tener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is a young entrepreneur who lives with his grandparents in Ica. He would really like to move them forward and provide them with a better quality of life. For the past few years, he has been working as a driver, serving the entire city. He thinks that it is going well due to his hard work and due to the fact that he always works with honesty and ethics. Due to his desire to succeed, he is studying Quality Control in order to take advantage of better job opportunities in the future. 

Victor will use the loan to purchase a cellular phone so that he can keep in touch with his grandmother. He worries about how she is doing all day. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity because, this way, he will be able to provide tranquility to his family. 

In the future, Victor would like to purchase his own motorcycle so that he can earn more money and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a cellular phone to communicate with his family.

loans.name: Williams Antonio

texts.es: Williams Antonio, mayor de edad acompañado, con dos hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia en secundaria y el otro es un pequeño recién nacido ambos bajo su responsabilidad de origen chinandegano, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística, y por sus hermosas playas, Williams es un microempresario administrador y propietario de su propio negocio el cual consiste en un taller de Ebanistería ubicado en su casa de habitación con mas de 12 años de experiencia en esta actividad, donde ofrece productos como: camas, roperos, puerta, cómodas, cunas, sillas, comedores, entre otros mas tiene clientes fijos los cuales son dueños de negocio de venta de muebles en uno de los mercados de esta localidad y clientes eventuales de otra zonas, gracias al buen trabajo y calidad es que su clientela ha ido incrementando, inicia su negocio con fondos propios productos de sus ahorros, y de esa forma ha venido poco a poco creciendo y con la ayuda de los créditos que se le han brindado ha logrado consolidarse mas en su negocio, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en todos unos profesionales, realizar ciertas mejoras a su vivienda principalmente su taller el cual esta forrado con laminas de zinc, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento  es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de muebles como: madera, clavos, tornillos, pega, laca, lijas, aldabas, pasadores entre otros y de esa forma lograr cubrir varios pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. Williams Antonio agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Williams Antonio, who is older and married, has two children. One of his children is in secondary school and the other is a newborn. They are both under his care. He is from Chinandega, an area known for its commercial and tourist activity and for its beautiful beaches. Williams is an administrator of a small business and owns his own woodworking business. His business is located in his home and he has more than 12 years of experience in this area. He offers products like beds, closets, doors, chests of drawers, cradles, chairs, dining tables, and other things. His customer base includes owners of furniture stores in the area and occasional customers from other areas.

Thanks to his hard work and quality of his products, his customer base has increased. He started the business with his own funds from his savings and has grown the business little by little. With the help of loans, he has been able to strengthen his business. One of his dreams is to be able to see his children become professionals and to make some improvements to his home, particularly to his workshop which is covered with zinc laminate.

The purpose of this new loan is to invest the working capital in the purchase of primary materials used for furniture making, like wood, nails, screws, glue, shellac, sandpaper, latches, bolts, and other things. This way, he will be able to complete various orders from his customers.

Williams Antonio is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders have provided to people with few economic resources.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, glue, shellac, screws, nails, sandpaper, and other things.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 40-year-old married mother of five children, who works hard to support her husband and beloved family in their living, through taking good care of them and preparing their necessary living needs.

Ibtissam is a housewife. She takes good care of her house and family and provides her beloved husband, who works in agriculture, a peaceful family living.

Today, Ibtissam is acquiring this loan to pay school tuition fees for her beloved daughter, who's next to her in the picture.  The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationary, transportation, and fees for students whose families have low incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. 

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options.

loans.use: To pay her beloved daughter's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto has owned and cultivated farmland for more than 20 years, planting and harvesting pineapples for sale. He is able to provide for his family and has repaid his previous farming loan. He earns well from his investments.

Roberto wants to improve his enterprise to ensure a better and greener farm. He is therefore requesting a new loan for PHP 50,000 to purchase organic fertilizer.

In the future, Roberto wants to see his farming business thrive, for he hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family. As a CCT community partner, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and other tools for the maintenance of the farm.

loans.name: Doris Margarita

texts.es: Doña Doris, tiene 57 años de edad, esta soltera, tiene un hijo, y  reside en un Sector de Cofradía, Cortes con su familia. Hace 10 años tiene una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar en general, refrescos, y verduras. Ya ha invertido varios prestamos en su negocio para mantenerlo estable y actualmente solicita el quinto ciclo que es por 21,000 lempiras para surtir y mejorar la situación del negocio, va comprar azúcar, manteca, huevos, pan, café, sal, condimentos, productos de limpieza, refrescos, verduras, frijoles, churros y lácteos, considera que este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el inventario y las ventas, su plan a futuro es llegar a tener una bodega de venta de alimentos al por mayor.
texts.en: Doris is 57 years old, is single, and has a son.  She lives in the sector of Cofradía, Cortes, in Honduras, along with her family.  For the past ten years she has had a grocery store where she sells general family staples such as sodas and vegetables.  She has invested several loans into her business in order to keep it stable, and currently she is requesting her fifth loan cycle, asking for 21,000 lempiras (Honduran currency) in order to supply and improve her business.  She is going to buy sugar, butter, eggs, bread, coffee, salt, condiments, cleaning products, sodas, vegetables, beans, churros and milk products.  This loan will allow her to increase her inventory and sales.  Her future plan is to have a store that sells food in bulk.

loans.use: to buy sugar, butter, eggs, bread, coffee, salt, condiments, cleaning products, sodas, vegetables, beans, churros and milk products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married  mother of three children and two of them  go to school.  She takes care of additional family members. She has a business of fresh fish at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for five years. 

She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy fish. She generates additional income from selling fried cassava and other snacks. 

She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include perishability of fish and  high transportation costs. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land and build a house.    

She resides in a rented house and the family has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 65-year-old  married woman and a mother of three  grown children from Dulag, Leyte. 

She raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for almost five years now. She also engages in a fish-vending business. She sells fresh fish.These are the sources of her income. 

Marina is asking for a loan to buy additional pig and provide capital for her fish-vending business. This will help improve her daily earnings as well as make her able to buy nutritious food.

In the future, Marina would like to expand her both business for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy an additional pig and provide capital for her fish-vending business

loans.name: Lisseth Estefania

texts.es:
Lisseth es una joven de 23 años, soltera y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja en una empresa prestigiosa de su ciudad natal, Ica. También está estudiando la carrera de Administración porque quiere sobresalir para poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia. Todas las mañanas Lisseth despierta con la motivación de sacar adelante a sus padres y por eso que siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace.
Lisseth está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá hacer mejoras en su habitación como pintarrajearla y comprar un juego de dormitorio, con esto su calidad de vida mejorará y ella seguirá luchando para crecer profesionalmente y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lisseth is a young 23 year old woman who is single and has a great desire to get ahead.  She works in a prestigious business in her native city, Ica.  She is also studying for a degree in Business Administration because she wants to excel in order to provide the best for her family.  Every morning Lisseth wakes up with the desire to move forward and help her parents, and for this reason she puts effort into all she does.  

Lisseth is thankful to the KIVA lenders because through their support she will be able to make improvements to her room such as painting and purchasing furniture, specifically a bed set.  This will improve her quality of life and she will continue struggle in order to grow professionally and have a better future.

loans.use: to make improvements to her room such as painting and purchasing a bed set.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, slippers, underwear, children's clothing, umbrellas, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Suchitra

texts.en:
Suchitra is 20 years old, a young and energetic girl who is willing to learn new skills to take her career forward. 

Her father is a businessman, engaged in the cracker business which is seasonal in nature. Whatever her father makes from this business is not sufficient for her family's monthly expenses, as she and her siblings are studying.

Suchitra tutors nearby children as a part-time job and makes 2,000 INR per month. From this money she pays her own tuition fee. Now Suchitra wants to join a finance and banking course from a reputed institute of Bhubaneswar called IFBI (Institute of Finance, Banking and Insurance) so she can get a good job in a bank or financial service company.

She is requesting a loan of 62,000 INR to pay her banking and finance course fee. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for this great support. She has a dream to educate her siblings from her own funds.

loans.use: to pay for her banking and finance course fee

loans.name: Rosemae

texts.en:
Rosemae is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a dressed chicken business in the Philippines. Rosemae requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more dressed chicken to sell in her food stall.

Rosemae has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dressed chicken to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nyamitamga Youth Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a young widow, aged 30 years, from Nyamitanga a Division in Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school and got married when she was young. At the age of 27 with three children, the husband passed away leaving her with no source of income to support the family. 

She acquired a loan of 800,000 UGX and started up a food stall in the market in order to survive and also to cater to her children. This business grew and helped her to sustain her family. 

Her business progressed with the help of Ugafode microfinance loans and this motivated her to mobilize her colleagues in the market to form a development group called Nyamitanga Youth Development Scheme to help the youth have a source of income through small businesses. This group has made their businesses prosper and they are requesting a loan to help them increase on their business working capital so as to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To buy green bananas, eggplants, cabbages, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Dúo Sumpango Sacatepequez Group

texts.es:
Dúo Sumpango Sacatepequez
Este dúo está conformado por Ermelinda de 44 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de blusas típicas diariamente teje bordados para entregarlos en los distintos negocios que hay en Sumpango, ella necesita otro crédito para poder comprar hilo por mayor ya que Gracias a Dios les ha ido muy bien en sus negocios, agradece la oportunidad que kiva le ha dado de poder darle un crédito ya que les ayuda a seguir creciendo diariamente.
texts.en: One member of the Dúo Sumpango Sacatepequez group is Ermelinda, who is 44 years old, and makes a living making traditional blouses. She embroiders the blouses and sells them at the various businesses that are in Sumpango.  She needs another loan to buy yarn wholesale because thanks to God, the business has done well. She is also grateful for the opportunity Kiva has given her to take out a loan, as it helps to keep the business growing daily.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make traditional blouses.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
To have additional source of income, Raymundo has been engaged in the hog-raising business within their community. He aimed to make this business profitable to earn sufficient income and sustain the necessities of his family. 

Due to capital insufficiency, Raymundo wants to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 20,000 to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and additional pigs to raise. Through hard work and strong determination, he believes that someday somehow, he will improve his business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
47-year-old Marilyn is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has five children. The oldest is 21 while the youngest is 6 years old, respectively. 

Marilyn engages in the fish-vending business, wherein she sells fresh fish to nearby household in her community. She has been selling fish for more than a few years now. She plan to raise hogs to have an additional source of income.

Marilyn is asking for a loan to have additional capital to  buy fresh fish and pigs. These will help Marilyn sell more fish, and provide her family with nutritious food.

She hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business as well as continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and pigs

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Analie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Analie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish-vending business.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Doña Teresa, tiene 63 años de edad, casada, tiene 10 hijos, reside en un aldea que pertenece al Municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su pareja, hijos, yerno y nietos. Siempre a buscado como generar ingresos para el mantenimiento de su familia, anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría de cerdos y hace 5 años vio la oportunidad de vender comidas y golosinas en una cancha de futbol y decidió preparar comidas como pollo frito con tajadas, topogigios y licuados de frutas. Ha invertido varios prestamos para sostener el negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 lempiras para comprar carne de pollo, condimentos, tajadas, manteca, frutas, azúcar, y otros materiales para elaborar la comida, topogigios y licuados para vender y mejorar los ingresos. Su plan es primero estrechar su relación con Dios, ayudar con los estudios de dos nietos y ampliar su negocio poniendo una cafetería.
texts.en:
Teresa, 63, is married, has 10 kids and lives in a village that is a part of the Mulicipality of Tela in Atlántida with her partner, children, son in law and grandchildren. 

She is always looking for ways to generate income to help maintain her family. She raised pigs in the past and five years ago she saw the opportunity to sell food and snacks at a soccer field. 

She decided to prepare foods such as fried chicken with plantain slices, ice cream and fruit juices. 

She has invested several loans to maintain the business. 

Currently she is requesting a $500 loan to buy chicken, spices, plantains, butter, fruit, sugar and other materials to make food, ice cream and juices to sell and to increase her income. 

Her plan is to first strengthen her relationship with God, help with her grandchildren's studies and increasing her business by adding a coffee shop.

loans.use: o buy chicken, spices, plantains, butter, fruit, sugar and other materials to make food, ice cream and juices to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married mother of five children and two go to school.  She takes care of additional family members. 

She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy weaves, braids, relaxers, rollers, treatments, and oils.  

She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include power shortages. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked beauty salon providing bridal services, and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.    

She resides in a rented house and the family has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees  .

loans.use: To buy weaves, braids, relaxers, rollers, treatments, and oils

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee un molino desde hace 12 años tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahí llegan a moler el maíz para elaborarlas ya que ella es una persona muy amable y responsable, Lucia  solicita un crédito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y así seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Lucia is 63 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She has owned a mill for the last 12 years and has many customers; mainly the women that make tortillas, because they come to grind the corn to make them. 

She is a very nice and responsible person. Lucia is requesting a loan to buy blades, discs, and all the necessary parts to have a good mill. This way she can keep working, and give her family their daily sustenance without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs, and all the necessary parts to have a good mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Jose Irene

texts.es: José, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, reside con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. José lleva 10 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar y venta de agua. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos y de trabajo, en la pulpería le ayuda su esposa y el sale a vender agua de forma ambulante en al comunidad. Ha obtenido varios prestamos con la institución para mantener su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 lempiras para comprar arroz, manteca, harina, frijoles, azúcar, pan, papel higiénico, jabón, refrescos, churros y otros para surtir el negocio. Su plan es agrandar el negocio y enseñarles a trabajar y valorar el trabajo a sus hijos.
texts.en: Jose is 43 years old, married with two children, and lives with his family in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara, Honduras. José has worked for 10 years at his own grocery business, where he sells basic home goods and and sells water. This business is his source of income and employment. In the grocery store he helps his wife and goes to sell water around the community. He has obtained several loans with the institution to support his business, and is currently seeking another 10,000 Lempiras to buy rice, butter, flour, beans, sugar, bread, toilet paper, soap, soft drinks, churros and others to fill the business. His plan is to grow the business and teach his children to work and to value their work.

loans.use: to buy rice, butter, flour, beans, sugar, bread, toilet paper, soap, soft drinks, churros and other products.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 70 years old and a widow with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a manufacturing (chopping-board) business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase hardwood to make chopping boards and sell them to customers.

Aurelia has been in this business for 34 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase hardwood to make chopping boards and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF. She is using the loan to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp, because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency. Marivic is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and safety risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 36-year-old, married mother of four children. She works hard to support her husband and beloved family in their living. She takes good care of them and prepares their necessary living needs. Nada is a housewife, and she takes good care of her house and family, providing her beloved husband a peaceful, family living. Her husband works in agriculture.

Today, Nada is acquiring this loan, which is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program. The program is designed to finance school expenses, such as books, stationery, transportation, and fees, for students whose families have low incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. Nada will use the loan to pay for her beloved children's school tuition fees. By supporting this loan, you will be enabling access to education for students with limited options.

loans.use: to pay for her beloved children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is a 47-year-old, married woman, from the village Jghali. She lives with her school-aged daughter and son, and also with her husband. He works as a watchman and earns 220 GEL monthly. In addition to this, the family gets income from small agricultural activities. Lela cultivates a plot of land and harvests corn and other vegetables for local trading. In order somehow to increase her productivity, Lela plans to be involved in a trading business. She requested a loan and was approved, under the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to people who don't have access to local financial organizations.

With the loan of 700 GEL, Lela will purchase a stock of home products and clothing at wholesale prices. She will sell these, at higher prices, in her community. The new source of income will give her a chance to do her great bit for the family's welfare and make better living conditions for her family. Lela will highly appreciate your help, for maintaining her trading business.

loans.use: to start a business, selling home products and clothing.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman and a mother of nine children, from Dulag, Leyte. She is a hard-working woman. She tries her best to support her husband in providing for the needs of the family.

Carolina makes a living through her food-vending business. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place. She earns an additional income through her hog-raising venture.

Carolina is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more ingredients for food vending, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings, and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her businesses and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food-vending business and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF, in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp, because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Ma. Cecilia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she will be saving money, and she will be helping the environment and reducing health and safety risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old single man, who has been working in scrap business for four years. He is the sole breadwinner to two other members of his family; he works hard to provide them with the necessary living needs.

Ali is working hard to start his own scrap business, but he can't afford the requested amount to start up his own business. For this reason he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary tools to start his own scrap business.

He is planning that in the future, and when his business develops properly, he will open a mobile phones selling shop and develop his living properly.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools to start his own scrap business

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Irene is in her late 20s and is single with one daughter and two dependents who are still at school. She has been running two projects, a pub and a beauty salon, for three years now. She works from 8am in her salon and then opens her pub at 5pm daily; she is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Irene's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open a pub and bought all types of drinks, bought salon products and has paid back her loan successfully. She is doing great and appreciates the support which has made her group happy and progressive. She used the profit to pay school fees, covered household expense and reinvest in business. She will use this loan to buy meat, cooking oil to cook, nyamachoma (grilled meat) and mishikaki (kebabs).  She dreams of making her business grow.

Irene will share this loan with her loan group "DOVE" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy meat, cooking oil to cook, nyamachoma and mishikaki.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mugambi

texts.en:
Mugambi is a brilliant hardworking farmer based in Igoti village located in central Kenya. He lives together with his wife with whom he has been married for 22 years! The couple has been blessed with 4 children, the youngest being 14. Mugambi has been farming for the more than 25 years to provide for his family. He grows bananas among other crops using irrigation. He also works in a quarry. 

Mugambi is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements and expand his banana farm. Old farming equipment are worn out, inefficient and uncomfortable to use. This tools frustrate the users and deteriorate the overall quality of work. Use of inferior and outdated tools was one of the major obstacles for the expansion of his banana farm. 

Your loan investment will kill two birds with one stone. He will purchase modern tools that are much improved and efficient and use the remaining amount to pay for input costs of growing more bananas. This business maneuver is unlikely to go wrong because he has invested on irrigation which has worked out very well in the past.  

Mugambi did not receive much education because he had a difficult childhood. However, through years of experience and discipline, he has trained himself to always record his expenses and keep a monthly budget. Returns from the investment will go to loan repayment and his children's education. He stated that this loan will raise his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements and expand his banana farm

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Argie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Argie has been in pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build her own groceries store.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support five children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Jocelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Alba Judith

texts.es:
Alba una madre llena de ideas para progresar que empezó con bajo capital vendiendo mercancía de papelería y pequeños artículos de uso doméstico, con su empuje y ganas y la fortaleza espiritual y mental que le brindan sus 5 hijos ha podido conseguir una vitrina y un exhibidor donde comercia ropa, calzado y pequeños electrodomésticos. 
Alba pensando en mejorar y seguir ofreciendo sus servicios pocos visto en la comunidad que es de escasos recursos quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de electrodomésticos, colchones de baja gama, ollas.
Con el impulso de este crédito  podrá posicionarse mejor en el mercado vendiendo más productos que le ayuden a tener mejores beneficios económicos que usara para darle estudios a sus 5 hijos, mejorar su casa y muchos proyecto que tiene pero sabe que trabajando los alcanzara.
texts.en:
Alba is a mother, full of ideas for progress, that started with little capital by selling stationary merchandise and small home use articles. With her push and drive, and the spiritual and mental strength that her 5 children bring her, she has been able to obtain a showroom and a display where she sells clothes, shoes, and small appliances.

Alba in thinking about improving and continuing to offer her lesser seen services to the community, which has scarce resources. She is requesting a loan that she will use to buy appliances, low-end mattresses, and pots. With the help of the loan she will be able to better position herself in the market by selling more products that will help her have greater financial benefits. She will use these to provide schooling to her 5 children, to improve her house, and many other projects she has but knows that by working she will reach them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like appliances, pots, and mattresses.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 children who are in school. He does farming in Oloitoktok and he grows maize, beans and vegetables for sale. He has been in this business for the past 10 years.

He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He will also use part of the amount to cultivate his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

This is Peter's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business and be successful, make more income, and improve his family's standards of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her variety store. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan which she will utilize to expand inventory of her direct selling business. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margie hopes that her business will continue to become successful and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She also wants to have her own boutique for her direct selling products. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise products for her business

loans.name: Czarina

texts.en:
Czarina is a 36 year old married woman living in the town of Dulag, Leyte. Czarina is engaged in a fish selling business for more than 15 years now. 
Czarina needs a loan for her fish vending business. She is requesting for a loan  to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to sell more to her customers thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Czarina hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Arlene requested a PHP 1,800 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Arlene is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Patrick, a youthful 51-year-old Mzee (old man), a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Kitale, in the northern Rift Valley region of Kenya. Patrick's farming experience dates back to 2000. 

Like many other farmers in the region, maize is a staple crop which he has been planting for as long as he can remember. With time, the fertility of his land has started to dwindle and whenever he plants maize the yields go down with each cropping season. Patrick has also been affected with weeds he recalls that at some point a strange but nice looking weed which produced purple flowers emerged and started to slowly colonize his farm causing his maize yields to decline even further. At some point he could not be assured of harvesting anything at all. Patrick's initial thought was that his farms had been bewitched, a notion that made him feel helpless. 

Today, Patrick is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds. Through this loan Patrick is going to increase his crop production and this will translate to improved income level. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Patrick and there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds

loans.name: Aku

texts.ru: Аку 45 лет, замужем. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад с покупки скота на сумму 3,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Аку в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. Также есть 1,50 ГА земельной доли, где она выращивает эспарцет, ячмень и чеснок. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аку обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 3 бычков, часть кредита будет направлена на ремонт сараев. Доходы от кредита Аку планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, в будущем планирует сделать капитальный ремонт своего дома.
texts.en: Aku is 45 years old and married. She has finished junior college. As a main source of income for her family,  Aku raises livestock, having launched this business 20 years ago by buying cattle for 3,000 KGS. Thanks to Aku's hard work, her farm at present includes two cows, one horse and 10 sheep. She also has 1.5 ha [3.7 acres] of land, where she grows sainfoin [a herb used for animal fodder], barley and garlic. Her total monthly revenue is 8,000 KGS on the average. In order to develop her business further, Aku has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 130,000 KGS to increase livestock headcount by buying three steers. A part of her loan will be used to renovate her barns. Aku plans to invest the revenues derived from her loan in an additional increase of livestock. In the future, she also plans to do major renovations on her home.

loans.use: to purchase three steers and repair her livestock barns.

loans.name: Manuel Jose

texts.es:
Manuel tiene una legumbrera hace 35 años y aprendió de su oficio gracias  a un familiar que le enseño a ser independiente puesto que en ese tiempo el trabajo escaseaba, es muy feliz haciendo su negocio pero la felicidad no es completa ya que los constantes cambios climáticos le están afectando sus productos y estos tienen que venderse siempre frescos. 
Manuel vive con su pareja y como todo caballero la tiene en casa atendiendo el hogar y él se preocupa por llevar los suministros para vivir dignamente, con su pareja tuvo 2 hijos que hoy en día son mayores de edad tienen su familia y Manuel depende netamente de su negocio para sobrevivir. 
Solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en surtido de legumbres y frutas para surtir su negocio poco a poco, aunque cuesta más pero no tendrá desperdicios y no tendrá que botar mercancía y con el crédito podrá hacer comprar periódicas por eso le urge con urgencia.
texts.en:
Manuel has had a produce store for 35 years. He learned his craft thanks to a family member who taught him to be independent because at the time the work was scarce. He is very happy running his business; but happiness is not complete, since the constant climate changes are affecting his products and they always have to be sold fresh.

Manuel lives with his partner, and as a gentleman he keeps her at home tending the household while he makes sure to bring home supplies to make a living. With his partner, he had two children. Currently they are adults and have their own families. Manuel depends entirely on his business to survive.

He requests a loan that he will invest in vegetables and fruits to stock his business bit by bit. Although it costs more to buy in smaller amounts he won't have as much wasted produce and won’t have to throw it away. With the loan he will be able to make these periodic purchases and that is why he needs the loan.

loans.use: to buy inventory of fruits and vegetables periodically, since changes in climate are spoiling his produce.

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
Luz se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos a quienes les garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente junto con su esposo para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una buena calidad de vida. 

Desde hace más de 10 años comenzó a trabajar vendiendo productos en la calle de manera ambulante, y gracias a un gran esfuerzo que hizo logró ubicarse dentro de un local y allí inicio un negocio de venta de ropa. 

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Luz busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de ropa de dama y caballero para mejorar su inventario y tener más mercancía para ofrecer.

De esta manera su negocio saldrá adelante y podrá ofrecer en su hogar unos buenos ingresos para que sigan teniendo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is married and has 3 children to whom she provides a good quality of life. This is thanks to her business that generates incomes that contribute financially together with her husband so that her home can improve its financial conditions and have a good quality of life.

Over 10 years ago, she started to work selling items as a street vendor, and thanks to her large effort that made it possible to move into a station inside a venue, she started a business selling clothes. Because her customer base is growing and each time demanding more products, Luz is requesting a loan to buy a variety of clothes for women and men to improve her inventory and have more merchandise to offer.

In this way her business will move forward and she will be able to offer a good income to her home so that they continue having a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to supply her store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married and has five children who go to school. She has additional family members. She operates a stall at the market selling green bananas and has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to expand her business through increasing her sales. She owns a house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas for resale

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad works hard to support her family. Natividad is married and has a ticketing outlet business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional office supplies and a machine for her business.

Natividad has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional office supplies and a machine for her business

loans.name: Rwentuha Development Group

texts.en:
Vislam is a forty-six-year-old hardworking married man with four children, aged 18, 16, 12 and 11 years, who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop as his main source of income. He started this business with the intention of boosting his family's income and improving his standard of living. He also earns additional income from farming. Vislam faces challenges of price fluctuations; however he has hopes of educating all his children and maintaining a financially sustainable business. The extra two people in the photo are group members with savings and have guaranteed the others though they have not taken the loan.

Vislam is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, salt, maize flour and sweets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, maize flour and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Marcelin

texts.en:
Marcelin is 30 years old. He has been selling electricity for 14 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more electricity to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his savings.

loans.use: To buy more electricity to sell.

loans.name: Nyasura Group

texts.en:
Emmilia, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three sons who are still in school.  She has been running a retail shop for three years now.  She works from 06am to 08pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Emmilia's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to increase her shop inventory and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to help her husband pay school fees and sometimes contributed to buying food and hospital expenses. 

She will use this loan to increase her shop inventory to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of building a wholesale shop. 

Emmilia will share this loan with her loan group  "NYASURA GROUP" which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase shop inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three doors and frames.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her variety store business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. She also now manages a small canteen which helps provide for their everyday expenses. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve profits, Joy would like to apply for a new loan to pay for raw ingredients which she needs for her canteen. With PHP 50,000, she can purchase more quantities of rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business. She will also use the loan to expand inventory of her variety store. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Joy hopes that her business will continue to cover her everyday needs and that she will always be able to help her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Sixty-six-year-old Aurelia is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has eight grown children. Aurelia operates a coconut grater machine, where fresh coconut is crushed into the edge of the spinning machine and she charges a certain fee. She has been operating this business for quite a few years. In addition to this, Aurelia is engaged in a rice farming business. She grows and sells rice. Aurelia is requesting a loan to pay for the repair of the coconut grater and thresher (the machine that separates rice grains from the plants by beating). These repairs will help improve Aurelia's smooth operation of her business.

Aurelia hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to pay for repairing the coconut grater and  thresher

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for his motorcycle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Introducing you to Joseph, a 65-year-old honest, hard-working and ever-smiling father of 8 adorable children. He hails from Nyamira in Kenya, a banana-growing area where the staple food is “matoke”, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from bananas. Joseph has been involved in farming for the past 25 years and he owns dairy cows that produce milk for sale. Besides his dairy cows, he also keeps poultry and when you visit his farm you will witness tea growing as well as a variety of vegetables.

Joseph has a passion for dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows “Nyabarati” (from a person's name); but all is not well for this humble man. He is facing the challenge of the lack of a proper dairy unit which is why he is seeking funds to construct a proper dairy unit. With your loan, he will be able to better manage his dairy farm and create more value. A better dairy unit will assist Joseph to save more money because his cows will never be sick and this will also boost his dairy's milk production. Through building a dairy unit with the loan, Joseph will be able to collect the cows' by-products, namely, cow dung and urine which can be sold or better yet used on his farm. With a dairy unit, he will be able to better feed his animals and collect by-products such as dung to generate biogas fuel, make organic fertilizer and plaster his hut. The money that he will earn from the dairy unit will be reinvested back into the business to create growth. Joseph is a very ambitious man and he projects that through the loan he will have higher quality dairy cows and be able to permanently change his living conditions and secure his children's future.

loans.use: To construct a proper dairy unit

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Esther, a hardworking, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Esther is the proud mother of four lovely children whom she adores and always protects. 

Esther's upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming six years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Esther is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her four children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Esther is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Esther is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. 

Through the income from horticultural farming, Esther will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: To start horticultural farming

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a unisex salon in Bundibugyo town and works very hard to maintain her business. She also has cocoa gardens which help to supplement her income from the salon. She hopes to expand her business.

She wants the loan to buy more salon equipment, to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment, to serve her customers better.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en: Aggrey is a 37-year-old man with three children, two of whom are attending school. He does a boda boda (motorcycle taxi) business as his source of income. He has done this business for over 10 years. Aggrey depended on a boda boda business, however later he found out that the boda boda couldn’t meet all his financial needs. Therefore, he decided to come to Ugafode for financial assistance and he started a small restaurant plus a timber business, which supplemented his income sources. Aggrey thanks Ugafode for financial assistance, which enabled him to take his children to school and widen his income sources. He is taking  a loan of UGX.2,500,000 to buy more timber and restaurant utensils for his restaurant to help him earn more income. Aggrey thanks Ugafode for financial support which has improved peoples standards of living.

loans.use: to buy timber and serving plates and warmers for the restaurant

loans.name: Nelson Vladimir

texts.es: Nelson es un señor de 42 años de edad que se dedica a  la  elaboración de muebles  desde hace 22  años atrás, el tiene un hijo de 1 año, Nelson se dedica desde que tenia 20 años a la elaboración de muebles, su negocio esta bien ubicado ya que se encuentra  por el centro de la ciudad donde él vive, el crédito lo necesita para comprar madera para la elaboración de camas, armarios, cómodas y demás muebles, lo que Nelson aspira es mejorar su negocio y por medio de este que no le haga falta nada a su hijo y de ser posible le gustaría comprarse  un cuartito para poner su negocio y ya no tener que pagar arriendo.
texts.en: Nelson is 42 years old. He has worked making furniture for 22 years. He has a 1 year old son. Nelson has made furniture for 20 years. His business is in a good location because he is in the center of town where he lives. He needs the loan to buy wood to make beds, dressers, wardrobes, and other furniture. What Nelson aspires to is improving his business so that his son will lack nothing and if possible he would like to buy a little room to put his business in so he doesn't have to pay rent anymore.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en: Elly is 45 years old and married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Elly has been operating a dairy milk business for seven years. He began the business delivering services to people nearby. Elly has a dream of enlarging his business. He is hardworking though challenged by weather and limited capital. He needs money to buy milk cooler.

loans.use: to buy a milk cooler for his business.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a hard working farmer from Biafra, Mbarara district.  She is 32 years and is happily married to an old man of the age of 67 years.  They have together three children besides the seven children from the first wife who died.

Her husband is frail as a result of advanced age. He also suffers a chronic illness and his age also limits his working abilities.  All the children attend school and as a family they have a challenge of paying tuition for better education.

As a family, they have some small rentals which generate some of the school fees and the remaining part of the school fees is obtained through hustling.  Quite often the children are sent back home for lack of school dues and this hinders their academic excellence at school.

The husband no longer works because of his health; he is dependent on the wife.  This leaves Jackie with the burden of caring for the family given that she is the sole bread winner in the family.  As a result she also engages herself in agriculture. This is a fragile business because of diseases and poor climatic conditions.

She cultivates passion fruits together with bananas on a small piece of land.  She had taken a loan of 500,000 from Kiva partner Ugafode which she invested in that very garden of passion fruits and bananas.  The harvest gave her a big boost and she is back requesting for one million to invest in this business so as to compete favorably and serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and herbicides.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette has always been entrepreneurial, starting with t-shirt sales and a catering businesses in the Philippines. After arriving in the US in 2005, Janette found her core competency in catering would not serve her in her new business environment, as licenses and fees were a significant barrier to entry.

She then remembered that she always had a knack for sniffing out garage sales like a bloodhound. Janette decided to turn her love for garage sales into a business, starting Treasure House, a pop-up vendor specializing in resale items. Her familiarity with the reselling/garage sale sector means she saves money, which she then passes on to her customers.

Since starting Treasure House, Janette’s primary difficulties have been in securing capital to fund inventory and in securing transportation to take her to local flea markets and garage sales. She will use her Kiva loan to pay for a van that she will use to transport her inventory.

Janette hopes to grow her business to the point where she will be able to leave behind the days of loading and unloading her van on a regular basis. She also hopes to open her own dollar store, with the goal of providing a heretofore unseen level of quality at the $1 price point. 

With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Janette’s dreams are today more possible than ever before.

loans.use: to pay for a van that she will use to transport her inventory.

loans.name: Mwihangiri Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Lilian, a member of Mwihangiri Self Help Group.  She is married and blessed with two children.

Lilian is a vegetable farmer, growing vegetables including kale and cabbages. She has applied for a loan to buy hybrid cabbage seeds which will give high yield and bountiful harvests. Lilian looks forward to improved income. She plans to use the profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs such as food and also plough back some profits to help expand her farming activities.

 Lilian appreciates Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy hybrid cabbage seeds.

loans.name: Ndwiga

texts.en:
Ndwiga is a farmer from Rubate village in Central Kenya. Dairy farming thrives in this area. Crop farming is also practiced even though the climate can be hot and dry for a very long period. Ndwiga enjoys the support of his 60-year-old wife when going about his farm business, which he has been doing for more than two decades. Their primary income sources from the farm are milk, eggs, tea, bananas and vegetables. Ndwiga also has a side business that keeps money coming.
 
He is seeking a small loan to purchase a water tank. He has always experienced problems keeping his animals hydrated during dry seasons. With your loan, Ndwiga will have water during dry seasons, which he will have 'harvested' during the few months with rain. Combined with the stored fodder, his livestock will be sufficiently fed during the dry season from the comfort of their stable.
 
This investment will bring food security to his family and profits to go to his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 43-year-old Palestinian refugee and a married father of three children. He works hard to provide them with the things they need to live. In 2007, Mazen started his own car body work maintenance business. He was trained since childhood by his father on this kind of work and had no chance to continue his education after he reached the Intermediate level.

Because he didn't have the chance to finish his education, he is working hard to provide his children with the best education he can.

For this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Immu

texts.en:
Immu is a married woman. She has one child, who attends school. Immu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Immu has a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from firewood operators. With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married man with three kids. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Kwekwe has operated a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbours. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments. In the future, he dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar for his food stall

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a livestock farmer and also does livestock trading. She has been in these businesses for 10 years now. She is 38 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with five children.

She will use this loan to buy goats and sheep to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business by buying more livestock.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in the future, she hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 41 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marisol has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marisol has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amy works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising chickens. Amy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with one child, and also has additional family members. 

She operates a food stall selling bananas and she has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green and yellow bananas. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality.  

Justine aspires to buy a plot of land to start farming. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Aida Noemi

texts.es: Noemi es una señora de 48 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos  de ellos 2 están estudiando, Noemi es una señora colombiana que ya vive en Ecuador 10 años y dice que en este país puede vivir mas tranquila y que trabaja al jornal de trabajo en el campo y a la crianza de animales, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para de esta manera mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para terminar de darles la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noemi is a 48-year-old woman. She is a single mother and has five children, two of whom are studying. Noemi is a Colombian woman who has been living in Ecuador for the past 10 years. She says that this country allows her to live more peacefully.
