Noemi works as a field laborer and also raises animals. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. This will improve her business and increase her earnings, which will help her provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mayita Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Mayita, lo integran tres mujeres laboriosas y con espíritu de superación, es primer ciclo que solicitan el financiamiento a la institución, lo coordina la señora Hilaria, quien tiene la edad de 45 años, acompañada y madre de ocho hijos de los cuales solamente cuatro dependen económicamente de ella, se dedica a la comercializa frutas en las principales calles de la municipalidad, y productos varios como es yoltamal, arroz con leche, cosa de horno, bollos, cuajadas, etc., con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El  crédito lo solicita para la compra de bananos, sandias, jocote para cocer, cuajadas, chicharrón, etc., y se ha propuesto cumplir con los pagos en el tiempo establecido para gozar de los beneficios que ofrece el ser buena paga. Otra integrante es la señora Petrona quien tiene la edad de 36 años y se dedica a la venta de especies en las calles de la capital y de Carazo, y la joven Ana Yanci de 22 años de edad comerciante de frutas y verduras en la capital desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Mayita” consists of three working women who have the spirit to excel. This is the first loan that they are requesting from ADIM. The coordinator is Sra. Hilaria. She is 45 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of eight children. Only four of them are financially dependent on her. She sells fruit along the main streets of the city. She also offers various products such as Nicaraguan corn tamales, rice pudding, corn cakes, buns, curds, and other items. Hilaria does all of this to improve her income and to provide a better quality of life for her children. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bananas, watermelons, hog plums, curds, pork rinds, and other products. She intends to complete her payments on time so that she can enjoy the benefits that are offered to those who have a good record.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. Petrona is 36 years old and sells spices along the streets of the capital and in Carazo.
• Ana Yanci is a young woman who is 22 years of age. She has been a fruit and vegetable merchant in the capital for the past two years.

loans.use: to buy bananas, watermelons, hog plums, curds, pork rinds, and other products.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza is 62 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Edeliza is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her equipment.

Edeliza has been farming rice for three years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her equipment

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising chickens and pigs.  Editha is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Edna has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns an income from entertainment videoke.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto de 61 años de edad desde hace 7 años se dedica a realizar viajes en su camión, tiene mucha clientela que lo busca por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, vive en casa propia con su esposa, Rigoberto  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas nueva y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 61 years old and has been making trips with his truck for the past seven years. He has many customers because he is always responsible while he is driving. Rigoberto and his wife live in their own home.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy new tires and provide maintenance for his vehicle. This is his only means of work, so the loan will help him to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy new tires and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 48 years old and a mother to two dependents who are 1 and 15 years old. She is from Palompon, Leyte. For the last 15 years, she has been engaged in fishing as her source of livelihood. In addition to this, she and her husband also own a sari-sari store business and a food vending business.

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing net, nylon and fishing weights that are necessary for productive fishing. She has high hopes for the future and will continue to work hard to continue improving her family's quality of life. Her income will be for school fees and healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon and fishing weights

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is married with two children and both go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business selling fish and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy fresh fish. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and perishability. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked stall of fish. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their good customer care. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing. Josephine is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishnets and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishnets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Pontian

texts.en:
Pontian is a father of three children who are in school. He is married. He was born in 1968. Pontian has been managing a cereals business for three years now, working from 6 am to 8 pm per working day and is able to make a very good profit each month. He dreams that one day he will be able to resell more cereals to other regions. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his second loan request, which he will use to buy cereals; corn and beans to resell. He used the previous loans to improve his business. He bought cereals, which he managed to resell. Pontian earned extra income that he used to cover school fees and home expenses and plow back into his cereals business. Pontian is so thankful for Kiva's support and will appreciate those who will support his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals, corns and beans to resell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a parent of 13 children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising chickens, pigs and cows and farming rice. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to retail. 

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to retail

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 34-year-old man. He is single and lives with his parents. Bilal’s family members are IDP (Internally displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in the Fuzuli region in Dilagarda village. He has been in the animal breeding business and learned this profession from his father. Bilal buys little calves, raises them and sells them in the bazaar to earn money. He wants to repair his destroyed stall and for that, he needs a loan of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He gives great thanks to the Kiva organization and lenders for this help.

loans.use: to repair his destroyed stall

loans.name: Celenia

texts.en:
Fifty-eight-year-old Celenia is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has three grown children. Celenia operates a water refilling business. She has been operating the water refilling business for almost four years now. 

Celenia is going to open up a sari-sari (or variety) store. She is asking for a loan to buy stock for the store like noodles, soap, beverages, sugar and other basic commodities. These are very helpful in attracting more customers and eventually creating a higher yield.

She hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for a new store like noodles, soap, beverages, sugar and other basic commodities

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 56 years old and widowed with three children. She is a poultry farmer and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells the chicken and eggs to her customers, and the business has been profitable.
 
She will be using this loan to buy more chickens for rearing to later sell them. She will also buy poultry feeds. She will use the anticipated profits to buy goats.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loan well. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a 53-year-old, married woman from Palompon, Leyte. She is married and has two adult children. She has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years now. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy cigarettes, liquor and canned goods. In the future, Jovita would like to expand her store so she can help her husband, who is a carpenter, with their plan to save for old age.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, liquor and canned goods

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 60 years old, married and has six children. 

Loreta is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Loreta requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Loreta has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. Loreta is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish.

Loreta has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to retail for her rice retailing business.

Lucy has been in this business for one year. Lucy earns additional income from pig fattening.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to retail

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is aged 51 and married to a farmer; they are blessed with four children. Julieta owns and manages a retail store in their village for almost 20 years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, fish sauce, cooking oil, soap, and food spices. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, fish sauce, cooking oil, soap, and food spices for her general store business.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 25-year-old married father of one child, who has been working in making necessary maintenance to tractors' hardware and spare parts for the past eight years. In 2008, he opened his own business in order to increase his income and develop his family's living.

His business is going on just fine, but needs external support, especially since electricity is highly requested in his domain and it is a major problem in his region. 

To develop his business, and reply properly to his customers' needs, Bilal is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a power engine necessary for his business' development.

Today, Bilal has two employees who work hard with him to provide the customers with the best and fastest services. He hopes that in the future he can open another branch and expand his working zone.

loans.use: To buy a power engine necessary for his business development.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Merly works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Merly is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell for her dried fish vending business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is married and has three children all of whom go to school.  She has additional family members. She has a business selling bananas from the market and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bananas to sell.  She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy a plot and build. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El grupo “JEHOVÁ ES MI PASTOR” es un nuevo grupo conformada por 05 socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Zenaida tiene 37 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas gaseosas  y comida en su quiosco que tiene en las afueras de su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más golosinas gaseosas.   El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Zenaida es la que se encuentra parada en el lado derecho.
texts.en:
“Jehová es Mi Pastor” (Jehovah Is My Shepherd) is a new group that consists of five members who are devoted to their small businesses.

Zenaida is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three dependent children. She sells snacks, sodas, and food from a kiosk located outside of her home. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of more snacks and sodas.

The group appreciates the Kiva lenders for providing this loan. Zenaida is the one standing on the right-hand side.

loans.use: to buy snacks and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her hog raising business for more than 13 years now. Her husband is a farmer.

Maria is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. Through this loan, she will be able to grow healthy pigs that she can sell to the market after some time. In the future, Maria hopes to make her business more profitable and successful.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Lugina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lugina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming coconut. Lugina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishnet and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Lugina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishnet and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 38 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlyn has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luis Adan

texts.es: Luis de 51 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de tomates  por mayor desde hace 4 años, ya tiene clientela establecida que lo buscan por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con las ventas que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cajas de tomates para seguir con su venta y así podrá generar mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 51 years old and lives with his wife and their two children. He has been selling tomatoes in bulk for the past four years. Luis already has established customers who are looking for quality products and good prices. With what he earns from his sales, Luis is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy more cases of tomatoes so that he can continue his sales. This will help him to generate more income so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy cases of tomatoes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a deaf woman living just outside Nairobi, Kenya with her husband and five year old daughter, Grace. After losing her hearing at the age of 8 years old, Nancy struggled to keep up in regular school. It took years before her family identified a deaf school and resources - but Nancy has managed to excel despite communication challenges. Nancy trained in jewelry making three years ago, and now leads a group of deaf women who make jewelry for sale in Kenya and with Sasa Designs by the Deaf, a non-profit partner organization in the United States. Sasa Designs by the Deaf has doubled their sales figures every year since training and operations started. 

This loan is for $8,000 to purchase leather,beads and other materials for the group's largest purchase order to date (nearly 2000 pieces!). It will also help pay artisans fair wages and cover operating costs leading up to holiday production. This is the fourth purchase order they have received from this vendor - proof of the quality and consistency of the group's production. 

Through her vision, leadership and technical skills, Nancy is helping demonstrate the potential of the artisan sector and the true ability of women who are learning to overcome social stigma and isolation. Nancy and Sasa Designs by the Deaf are showing the world what they CAN do!

loans.use: to pay artisans fair wages and purchase materials to make custom bracelets

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her late 30s, is married with three sons who are still in school.  She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 6.30 am to 4.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Anna's 19th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling soft drinks and increase her food cooking ingredients.  She has paid back all loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay for school fees, bought a TV set, a deck, and a decoder and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy food cooking ingredients and soft drinks. She dreams of owning a good restaurant. 

Anna will share this loan with her loan group "Msasani", which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients and soft drinks.

loans.name: Verinica

texts.en:
Verinica is 63 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with four children. She does poultry farming and sells milk. She has been in these businesses for 11 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of poultry to raise and sell at a profit. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of poultry

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Lynette works very hard to provide for them.

Lynette runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lynette has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Lynette would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nonalyn

texts.en:
Nonalyn is 35 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, soap, eggs, noodles, groceries, etc. to sell.

Nonalyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loading.

Nonalyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shampoo, soap, eggs, noodles, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ritchelle

texts.en:
As a single parent of one child, Ritchelle works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising chickens. Ritchelle is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Ritchelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Dolores Inoa

texts.es: Dolores de 46 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros desde hace 8 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para surtir su negocio y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Dolores is 46 years old and has been making a living selling men's and women's clothing for eight years. Her business is located at the town market. Dolores lives with her husband and two children in a house owned by the family. Dolores is applying for a loan in order to stock up her business and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es: Flor de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito pera la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, sopas, detergentes, refrescos, huevos, etc. para poder seguir con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Flor is 29 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and son. Flor has a small shop that she runs out of her home. She has many customers because of the variety of products and the affordable prices on offer. Flor is applying for a loan in order to buy sweets, basic grains, soups, detergents, soft drinks, eggs and more to continue with her sales and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, soups, detergents, soft drinks, eggs and more.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Thelma has been in this business for three years. Thelma earns more income from raising chickens, pigs and cows.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Diego Francisco

texts.es:
Diego es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Electrónica Industrial, actualmente está cursando el II ciclo de su carrera. Sus padres se separaron cuando él niño, su madre tiene otro compromiso, a quien Diego ve como su padre. Ellos viven junto a sus 3 hermanos (dos mujeres y un hombre). Su madre se dedica al trabajo de Costura y también vende mermeladas, su padre es una persona jubilada.
Con los bajos ingresos de ambos, hacen todo lo posible para que Diego pudo continuar sus estudios, pero debido la actual situación económica por la que están atravesando, no les permite seguir apoyándolo, por lo que sin esta ayuda lamentablemente Diego tendría que dejar sus estudios, es por ello, que tuvo que recurrir al apoyo económico necesario para poder culminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente, porque de lo contrario tendría que abandonar la carrera y truncar sus sueños de ser un excelente profesional.
A Diego le gustó desde muy pequeño su carrera, le parecía muy interesante y siente que lo beneficiará mucho económicamente, pero sobretodo de manera profesional, porque desea ser un gran profesional.
Diego está muy agradecido con el apoyo brindado por los asociados a KIVA, ya que gracias a ellos él podría culminar su carrera y cumplir su sueño de ser un excelente profesional bien capacitado para así poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is a young man who is studying for an Industrial Electronics degree and currently in his second year.  His parents divorced when he was a child and his mother is in another relationship with a man who Diego sees as his father.  They live with Diego's three siblings (two sisters and a brother).  His mother is a seamstress and also sells marmalades.  His father is retired.

Ever since he was little Diego was interested in his career.  He thought it was interesting and feels it will help him economically, especially once he becomes a professional which is his goal. Diego is doing his technical degree with SENATI, one of Peru's premier technical degree programs. 95% of SENATI students find employment in their field within 3 months of graduation. For this reason, and because of a promising labor market, Diego feels this is a good investment in his future.

Despite the low incomes of both parents they do everything possible for Diego to continue his studies.  Diego is pictured here with his parents, who are proud of how far he has come. 

Unfortunately, due to the bad economic situation they are now experiencing they are unable to continue supporting him.  Diego is very grateful for the support from KIVA lenders because thanks to them he will be able to get his degree and meet his goal of becoming an excellent, well-trained professional who can support his family.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a technical degree in Industrial Electronic, so that he can become a licensed professional and find a good job

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es: Jose de 31 años de edad vive con sus dos hijas en casa propia, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace 6 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, el está solicitando un crédito para la  compra de 2 terneros y concentrado para poder continuar con la crianza y así poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose, 31, lives with his two daughters in his own house.  He has been raising cattle for six years and sells his products in different markets.  The loan he is requesting is to buy two calves and animal feed to continue with his livestock farming and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy two calves and animal feed.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is a married mother of three children. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling used shoes by means of moving door to door. She has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy used shoes. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She is aspiring of increasing her capital so as to serve more customers. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for four years.

In the future Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lincon Arley

texts.es:
Lincon un hombre de 45 años de edad muy luchador y emprendedor que fue víctima de desplazamiento forzado y le toco erradicarse en Medellín donde no tenía familiares y tenía a su familia conformada por sus dos hijos y su pareja. 
Fue trabajando poco a poco y logro montar en el centro de Medellín, que es el sector comercial un puesto donde distribuye videojuegos de baja gama para familias de pocos recursos como poly-station, o juegos de mesa y gracias a este negocio es que ha podido alimentar su familia. 
Solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de videojuegos, juegos de mesa y demás artículos de entretenimiento para familias de más bajos recursos. 
Lincon se proyecta en 5 años con un negocio donde tenga varios vendedores, que sea sostenible en el tiempo y tenga ese sentido de pertenencia a los pobres que también pertenecen a esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Lincoln, 45, is a hard-working entrepreneur who, as a displacement victim, had to flee to Medellín where he had no family.  His immediate family consists of his two children and his partner.

He worked little by little and established himself in the city center of Medellín which is the commercial sector.  He began selling inexpensive videogames such as "poly-station" and board games to low-income families.  Thanks to this business he is able to feed his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy videogames, board games and other entertainment items for low-income families.  In five years Lincoln sees himself in business and having several salesmen.  He believes the business is sustainable over time and gives low-income families a sense of belonging to this society.

loans.use: To buy inexpensive videogames and board games for low-income families.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre está buscando la manera de solventar los gastos de su hogar, desde hace 8 años ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural y le ha ido muy bien ya que obtiene buenas ganancias, por esa razón esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas medicina natural por mayor y asi continuar con sus ventas y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Leonor is 54 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her three daughters. Leonor is very hard-working and is always looking for ways to help cover household costs. For eight years, Leonor has made a living selling natural medicines. This has gone very well as she earns good profits. Leonor is applying for a loan in order to buy more natural medicine in bulk, to continue with her sales, and to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicine in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es: María de 67 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija y sus 2 nietos de 7 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer reconocida en su cantón por ser una mujer trabajadora que luego de la pérdida de su esposo tuvo que sacar adelante sola a su hija y apoyarla en la crianza de sus nietos, por lo que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar los materiales que utilizara para la elaboración de tamales y quesadillas, mismos que distribuye de forma ambulante a los alrededores de su localidad. María desea tener un poco más organizada su vivienda y es por ello que desea construir un cuarto para la cocina ya que por su negocio también necesita tener un espacio más amplio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto para la cocina.
texts.en: María is 67 years old and lives with her daughter and two grandchildren, ages seven and two years old, in a house that she owns. María is well-known in the area for being hard-working. After her husband passed away, María alone had to help her daughter to get ahead and to support her in raising her own children. María wakes up very early every day in order to prepare the materials that she will use for making tamales and quesadillas, which  she sells as a street vendor in her local town. María wants to organise her home a little more and wants to build a room to install a kitchen. She needs a larger kitchen for her business and so is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cement, gravel, sand, bricks and iron bars to build it.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron bars in order to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Karen Yaneth

texts.es: Karen de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una clínica odontológica desde hace 4 años, tiene muchos clientes por el buen trabajo que realiza y los buenos precios, gracias a su trabajo logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar,  ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de herramientas como: pinzas, limpiadores bucales, algodón, abrebocas, etc. para poder tener lo necesario y atender mejor a sus clientes y asi obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Karen is 34 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her family. Karen has had a dental surgery for four years. She has many patients as she does good work and offers good prices. Thanks to her work, Karen has been able to cover household costs. Karen is applying for a loan in order to buy tools such as tweezers, cleaning equipment, cotton wool and other tools. With these items she will have everything that she needs to offer her patients better service and to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy tools such as tweezers, cleaning equipment, cotton wool and other tools.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: Doña Eduarda de 61 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre esta pendiente de que a su familia no le falte el sustento diario, hace 25 años decidió poner en su casa una tienda donde comercializa diferentes productos de primera necesidad, ha tenido buenos resultados en sus ventas, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: sopas, café, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, jabón, detergentes, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Eduarda, 61, is a hard-working woman who is always making sure her family has enough to eat.  It was 25 years ago that she decided to set up a store in her house where she sells a variety of essential products and earns a nice income from sales.

She lives in her own house with her two daughters and is requesting a loan to buy more products such as soups, coffee, eggs, sweets, soft drinks, soap, detergents, etc. to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy soups, coffee, eggs, sweets, soft drinks, soap, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 41 years old. She is married with five children aged 4-20. She and her family live in Palompon, Leyte. 

Evalyn and her husband operate a sari-sari (variety) store, raise chickens and have also been engaged in a hog-raising business for two years now. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, starter feed, grower feed, finisher feed and merchandise such as detergent, soft drinks, condiments, canned goods and chips. She hopes that the loan will make a difference in her business, for the better. She dreams of seeing her children become successful in their studies someday.

loans.use: to buy piglets, pig feed, and merchandise such as detergent, soft drinks, condiments, canned goods and chips.

loans.name: Yesica Alejandra

texts.es: Yesica de 21 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y su hermano de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado salir adelante apoyada en su negocio de venta de antojitos típicos los cuales vende desde hace 3 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que gustan de sus productos. Yesica desea construir un baño para su vivienda, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión y es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lamina, madera y ladrillo para construir servicio sanitario en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yesica, 21, lives in her own house with her mother and seven-year-old brother.  Thanks to her hard work and tenacity she has been able to earn a living selling typcial snack foods, a business she has been in for three years.  She has many customers who enjoy her products.

Yesica wants to build a bathroom in her house but does not have enough money for the investment.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, wood and bricks to build a bathroom.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, wood and bricks to build a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood, metal sheeting, cement, sand, gravel and nails to repair the roof and put in a concrete floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Ana Elva

texts.es:
Ana una mujer de 64 años de edad muy trabajadora que no le gusta que le regalen nada pues dice tener fuerzas y habilidades para generarse sus propios recursos, es un vendedora ambulante ya muy reconocida y sin pena sale con su carrito diariamente a trabajar 10 horas buscando una venta para llevar un bocado de comida a la casa, vende bebidas como jugos naturales, tintos, pericos, aromáticas. 
Ana solo pide salud para seguir trabajando que Dios le permita seguir saliendo todas las mañanas a buscarse su sustento. Pensando en mejorar las ventas y ser más productiva la señora Ana quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido en frutas, utensilios, desechables y realizar algunas reformas a su puesto de venta haciéndolo ver más estético y agradable a la vista de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is a very hardworking woman of 64 who doesn't like anyone to give her handouts because she says she has the strength and ability to make an income for herself. She is a well-known street vendor who proudly goes out with her little cart every day to work for 10 hours in search of customers so she can take a mouthful of food home. She sells drinks like natural juices, coffee, white coffee and fruit teas.

Ana only asks that she stays healthy enough to keep working, that God allows her to keep going out every morning to earn herself a living. With a view to improving her sales and being more productive, Ana wants to request a loan to buy a variety of fruit and disposable utensils as well as making a few improvements to her stall to make it more aesthetically pleasing for her clients.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell her healthy and natural juices, coffee, and plastic utensils as well as to make some improvements to her cart. She's a 64-year-old woman who works 10 hours per day.

loans.name: Janeth Marisol

texts.es: Janeth de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 1 año y 7 años de edad. Ella todos los días demuestra su empeño y responsabilidad para sacar adelante a sus hijas siempre contando con el apoyo de su compañero de vida y su tienda de productos de primera necesidad, además vende variedad de ropa aprovechando la clientela de la tienda. Janeth siempre busca lo mejor para su familia y es por ello que desea que vivan en un lugar más seguro, por lo que ha pensado cambiar las puertas y ventanas de su vivienda ya que estas se encuentran deterioradas, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: puertas de hierro y ventanas para cambiar las de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Janeth is 32 and lives in her own ouse alongside her life partner and their 2 daughters who are 1 and 7 years old. Every day she shows her determination and commitment to help her daughters progress, always with her life partner's support, by working in her grocery store, where she also sells a variety of clothes to make the most of her customers.

Janeth always wants the best for her family and this involves them living in more safety. This gave her the idea of replacing the doors and windows in her house because the current ones are in a bad state. Because of this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in iron doors and windows to replace the ones in her house.

loans.use: to invest in iron doors and windows to replace the ones in her house.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma, age 58, is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has four grown children. Vilma engages in vegetable vending. She sells upo (bottle gourd), eggplant, patola (sponge gourd) and many other vegetables. She has been selling vegetables for a quite a few years now. Aside from vegetable vending, she raises and sells hogs. She is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables like eggplant and okra, and to buy feed for the pigs. Vilma hopes that with additional capital she can continue making better profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like eggplant and okra, and to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia is 32 years old, married and has six children. Five of her children are in school.

Anecia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Anecia has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Anecia has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Anecia would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 58 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with 11 children. She has managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost one year. In this business she has a net income of 600 PHP weekly. Her net income from this business is spent on her family's daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to borrow a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her vegetable production. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her vegetable production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. Maria runs a sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Maria is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries, detergents, biscuits and snack foods, and cooking ingredients, among other items. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract customers and sell more to them. In the future, Maria hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries, detergents, biscuits and snack foods, and cooking ingredients, among other items

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 25 years old and married with two children who are in school. Aileen works very hard to provide for them.

Aileen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries. Aileen has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 32 years old and married with three children, who are in school. 

Analyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, sugar, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, sugar, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and married with seven children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from vulcanizing.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Tiberio

texts.es:
Manuel desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco Manuel empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Tiene una hija por la cual ha tenido que responder durante 10 años y vive con ella y su esposa en una humilde vivienda en el municipio de Medellín.

Es un hombre emprendedor, amoroso y siempre dispuesto a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecido con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora.
El pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos como tela, hilos y agujas y así poder aumentar su volumen de producción al mismo tiempo que mejora su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Manuel learned to sew clothes at a very young age thanks to his mother, who was a seamstress her whole life. It was in this way that Manuel gradually began to understand and apply this knowledge.

Manuel has a daughter for whom he has been responsible for ten years. He lives with his spouse and daughter in a humble home in the municipality of Medellín. 

Manuel is a loving, entrepreneurial man who always looks after his customers in the best possible way. He feels very grateful for everything he has been able to build up until now. He is asking for financial support in order to purchase inputs such as fabric, thread and needles. This will allow him to increase his output volume and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Manuel has a lot of hopes for his business and dreams of having a much larger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase inputs like fabric, thread and needles in order to improve his output.

loans.name: Gitaza Group

texts.fr:
Vincent fait partie du groupe  Gitaza et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 28 ans et est marié à Alice, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 7 mois à 7 ans  dont  1 étudie.  

Il fait le commerce de Boutique (haricot, riz,…) depuis 4 ans.

Il est son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz et de  haricot à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une voiture pour faciliter le commerce et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Vincent is a member of the Gitaza group and lives in  Bujumbura. He is 28 years old and is married to Alice, a salesperson. They have four children aged from 7 months to 7 years old, one of which attends school.
He has run a small store (selling beans, rice, etc) for the last four years. He is on his third loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan he is requesting, he will increase his working capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and beans to resell, in order to increase his income.
In the coming years, he would like to buy a car to help his business, and he hopes to see his children in school.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Oumar Talla

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar Talla, marié et père de famille, s’active dans le transport depuis plus de 10 ans. Il a démarré comme apprenti avant de pouvoir acquérir son propre véhicule. Il a déjà eu à bénéficier des services de l’IMCEC avec trois crédits soldés convenablement. Oumar Talla fait un renouvellement afin de pouvoir réparer son véhicule en panne de moteur. Car c’est grâce aux recettes du véhicule, qu’il arrive à nourrir sa famille.
Il a souscrit à une épargne régulière afin de pouvoir garder un peu d’argent dans le but d’acquérir un autre véhicule qui viendra renforcer ses revenus et pourra améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Oumar Talla, married and a father, has been involved in transportation for over ten years. He began as an apprentice before being able to acquire his own vehicle. He has already benefited from the IMCEC assistance, with three previous loans all properly reimbursed.
Oumar Talla is seeking a new loan in order to allow him to repair his vehicle's engine; it is the income from his vehicle that enables him to feed his family.
He has a regular savings plan which allows him to retain some funds with the goal of acquiring a second vehicle - this will increase his income and will allow him to improve his family's dietary intake.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle's engine and bodywork.

loans.name: Tomas Enrique

texts.es:
Tomas es un agricultor de 46 años de edad que como muchos aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. La vida para tomas no siempre ha sido sonrisas, por circunstancias de la vida no ha podido tener su propia parcela de cultivo y es un sueño que siempre ha querido realizar, pero a pesar de todo sigue trabajando con cultivos y vela por el bienestar de su pareja y sus dos hijos de 19 y 15 años que para él lo son todo y no descansara hasta verlos en la universidad estudiando y siendo todos unos profesionales. 
Solicita un crédito para compra de insumos de sostenimiento como abonos e insumos de levante como riegos y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 46 year old farmer who like many learned to from what his parents taught him. Life for Tomas hasn't always been full of smiles. Due to circumstances of life, he hasn't been able to have his own land parcel and that is a dream he has always wanted to have come true. But despite everything he continues to work on his crops and he cares for the well being of his spouse and their two children, aged 19 and 15. They are everything for him and he will not rest until he sees them in studying in college and having good careers.  

He is asking for a loan to buy materials to support his crops, such as fertilizer and irrigation materials.

loans.use: to invest in support for his crops such as fertilizer and irrigation materials.

loans.name: Kanama Group

texts.fr:
Oscar  fait partie du groupe  Kanama et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 35 ans et est marié à Fabiola ,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 9 mois à 14 ans,dont  4 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants orphelins  qui étudient. 

Il a une  boutique (haricot, riz, huile de palme,…) depuis  17 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d'huile de palme(200littres), à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  devenir commerçant importateur, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Oscar is a member of the Kanama group and he lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 and is married to Fabiola, a salesperson. They have six children aged from 9 months to 14 years old, four of whom are in school. He also has two dependent orphans who are in school. He has had a small shop selling beans, rice, palm oil etc, for 17 years.

This is his second loan from Turame. With the KIVA funds he is requesting, he will increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil (200 litres) to resell and thus increase his income.
In the coming years, he would like to become an importer/trader, and to oversee his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of palm oil to resell.

loans.name: Twungubumwe I Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine fait partie du groupe  Twungubumwe et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 33 ans et est mariée à Emmanuel, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 1mois à 14 ans, dont  3 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  bière de banane depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est à  son  deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer  de la bière de banane, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  avoir un terrain cultivable, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jeanine is a member of the Twungubumwe group and lives in Gitega. She is 33 and is married to Emmanuel, a farmer. They have six children, aged from 1 month to 14 years old, three of whom are in school. 
She has sold banana beer for the last 15 years. This is her second loan from Turame. With the KIVA funds she is requesting, she will increase her working capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to make the banana beer; she will sell this to increase her income.
In the years ahead, she would like to get some agricultural land, and to oversee her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bananas in order to make banana beer for resale.

loans.name: Catalina Isabel

texts.es:
Catalina es una madre responsable de un hijo de 5 años que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener muy buenas ventas. 

Catalina sufrió un accidente y esto hizo que se tuviera que trasladar a vivir a la finca donde su familia, puesto que tuvo que ser intervenida quirúrgicamente en varias oportunidades. 

Ahora ya se encuentra recuperada, con muy buen estado de salud y por esto quiere retomar con gran entusiasmo su negocio para hacerlo crecer. 

Es por esto que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos y realizar mantenimiento de galpón.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Además, Catalina espera que con mayores ingresos su hijo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una mejor educación. 

Catalina sueña con tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Catalina is a responsible mother of a 5 year old son. She has had to go through a lot of adversity in her life but nonetheless has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family. A while ago she started selling eggs. She has a number of hens that allow her to have good sales. 

Catalina had an accident and this made her have to move to live on the farm with her family because she had to have several surgeries. Now that she is better and in very good health and that is why she wants to go back to her business with a lot of enthusiasm to make it grow.  
 
That is why she is seeking a loan that will allow her to buy more hens and increase egg production to respond to her customers' demands for eggs and do maintenance on the shed. This way, her sales will increase considerably and her business will come back and she can get ahead. In addition, Catalina hopes to have more income so her son can have a better quality of life and access to a better education.  

Catalina dreams of having a great business where she can use the capacity she can to get it ahead and offer her son a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy hens and to fix her shed.

loans.name: Keburana Group

texts.fr:
Annociate  fait partie du groupe Keburana   et  habite à  Gitega. C’est une femme célibataire de  26 ans. 
Elle a  2 enfants âgés de 6 à 8 ans, dont 1 étudie
 
Elle fait le commerce de  riz, de haricot et de l’huile de palme  depuis  2 ans. 

Elle est à  son sixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de haricot et d’huile de palme à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle puis construire une maison, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Annociate is a member of the Keburana group and lives in Gitega. She is 26 years old and single. She has two children, aged 6 and 8, one of whom goes to school. She has sold rice, beans and palm oil for the last two years. This is her sixth loan from Turame. With the KIVA funds she is requesting, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans and palm oil to resell in order to increase her income. 
In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land to build a home, and also to oversee her children's education.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio es un hombre de 36 años de edad, soltero, con una hija de 13 años y su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno.
Él es emprendedor, constante, trabajador y responsable. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad de ‘Palcoco’ ubicada aproximadamente a 30 kilómetros de la ciudad. 
Claudio es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y lo combina con español según sus necesidades de comercio. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno, él realiza la compra de vacas para criarlas engordarlas y venderlas, también junta a vacas y toros con el fin de producir terneros, los terneros se venden al mercado para ser criados y obtener carne. Su vida la comparte con su hija, porque su esposa los abandonó, su hija estudia en la escuela y juntos se hacen cargo del negocio. Su casa cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz porque el área es poblada. Su sueño es tener otro negocio; una ferretería. El desea realizar la compra de ganado para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar con los gastos escolares de su hija.
Es por esos motivos que Claudio solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno y con los beneficios ayudar con los gastos escolares de su hija.
texts.en:
Claudio is a 36 year old man, single, with a 13-year-old daughter and his business is selling cattle.

He is an entrepreneur, persevering, hard-working and responsible. He does his work in the community of "Palcoco," located approximately 30 kilometers from the city.

Claudio is tanned, has short black hair, is short-statured, his maternal language is Aymara and he combines it with Spanish according to the business needs. His business is selling cattle. He purchases the cattle to raise them, fatten them, and sell them. Also, he puts cows and bulls together to produce calves. The calves are sold in the market to be raised and get meat. He shares his life with his daughter because his wife left them. His daughter is a student in the school and together they take care of the business. His house has water and electricity because the area is populated.  

His dream is to have another business - a hardware store.  He wants to purchase the cattle to increase his income and help with his daughter's school expenses.

For these reasons, Claudio asks for a loan to purchase cattle and with the profits help with his daughter's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and, with the profits, help with his daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Matilde Del Carmen

texts.es:
30 años de experiencia son los que posee la señora Matilde en el mundo de las confecciones una veterana que batallo mil batallas contra las dificultades que presento esta profesión en años anteriores. 
57 años de edad, dos hijos, una actitud emprendedora, carismática, sonriente y servicial son las características que la destacan, tiene un taller de confección en su hogar por el cual lucha otra pelea buscando legalizar sus documentos y que sea de su propiedad. 
Matilde quiere solicitar un crédito con el cual realiza algunas reformas a su taller haciéndolo más agradable para trabajar y comprar insumos como telas, e hilos para fabricar sus prendas.
texts.en:
Thirty years of experience are what Matilde has in the world of dressmaking, a veteran who has fought a thousand battles against the difficulties that this profession has had in past years. 

She is 57 years old and has 2 children.  An enterprising attitude, charisma, smiling and helpful are the characteristics that stand out about her.  She has a dressmaking shop in her home for which she fights another battle to legalize the documents so that it is her property.

Matilde wants to ask for a loan with which she will make some changes to her workshop, making it better to work in and to purchase some supplies such as fabric and thread to make her clothing.

loans.use: to make some changes to her workshop, purchase fabric and thread.  Matilde is a 57-year-old woman who seeks to legalize the documents for her home.

loans.name: Maria Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Medellin desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Maria y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Maria desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a humble and hard-working woman who has spent a large part of her life caring for her children. She lives in the municipality of Medellín where she works spectacularly in the kitchen since her business is preparing food to go such as tamales, sausages, and empanadas among others. 

She sells these foods primarily to the neighbors in the area who know Maria's flavorings and know that they will always get delicious foods that are well-made. 

Maria wants to increase her food sales and wants to work in a more comfortable way, so she asks for a loan to purchase some kitchen utensils and purchase supplies to continue making her recipes. 

This loan will allow her to get her business ahead to have the income necessary that will give her the opportunity to continue sustaining her family.

loans.use: to purchase some kitchen utensils and purchase some supplies to continue making her recipes.

loans.name: Yessica Andrea

texts.es:
Yessica inicio la venta de variedades específicamente accesorios para celulares hace años atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga, busco esta actividad como un alternativa de generar dinero. Vive en el municipio de Marinilla con su bebe de tres meses.

Yessica se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos y es por este motivo que necesita un crédito que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta, solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido como fundas y baterías para celular.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén y sabe que esta pro buen camino.
texts.en:
Yessica began selling a variety of things, specifically cellphone accessories, some years ago. She learned this business thanks to a friend; she looked for this work as an alternative to generate money. She lives in the municipality of Marinilla with her 3-month-old baby.

Yessica finds herself needing to increase her sale volume and for this reason she needs a loan that will help her to improve the variety of products that she displays and offers daily to her customers and to people door-to-door. She asks for a loan to purchase a variety of stock such as covers and batteries for cellphones. 

Her primary dream is to be able to become the owner of a shop and she knows that she is on the right path.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cellphone accessories to improve her business.

loans.name: Inguvu Group

texts.fr:
Barnabé fait partie du groupe Inguvu  et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 26 ans et est marié à Violette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant  de 1 mois. 

Il fait le commerce de bananes et de poules  depuis 3 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Barnabé, age 26, is a member of Inguvu Group who lives in Gitega. He's married to Violette, a farmer. Together they have one one-month-old child.

Barnabé has been selling bananas and chicken for the past three years. This is is first loan with Kiva's partner, Turame.

He will use it to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to resell, in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa a 49 ans et mère de famille. Elle achète des habits (activité qu’elle exerce) au marché de Hédzranawoé et revend de façon ambulante à ses différents clients depuis un moment. Ce cinquiéme prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 02 bals de friperie. Elle espère pouvoir satisfaire toutes les couches et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Kossiwa, age 49, is the mother of a family. She buys clothes at the market in Hédzranawoé, and she resells them as a traveling saleswoman to her various customers. She's been running this business for a while now.

She's seeking her fifth loan, which will enable her to buy two bales of secondhand clothing. She hopes to be able to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita works hard to support her family. Erlita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc.

Erlita has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Erlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is aged 27, married to a farmer and blessed with four children. She has managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost two years and earns a net income on this business amounting to 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) daily. 

Due to her insufficient funds, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable production. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable production.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married with one child in school. Mary Jane works very hard to provide for the family.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata works hard to support her family. Fortunata is married and has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Fortunata has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Fortunata would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a 44-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. She is from Leyte, Philippines. Yolanda is engaged in a hog-raising business. For more than 13 years now, this business has supported Yolanda in meeting the needs of her family. Yolanda is now asking for a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. With this loan, she will be able to raise healthy pigs which she can sell to the market in a few months. In the future, Yolanda hopes to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 34 years old and married with a year-old baby daughter. For the past seven years, she and her husband have run a fishing business to earn an income. Vicky and her husband catch and sell fish in their community of Palompon, Leyte.  

Vicky is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy fishing nets, nylon, and fishing weights. She will use her loan to buy materials to help her increase her catch. In the future, Vicky would like to expand her fishing business enough to support the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, nylon, and fishing weights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional fabric to make outfits for sale.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 23 years old and married with three children. Her oldest child is seven and her youngest is three. She is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. For the past five years, Melissa has worked fishing. She sells fresh fish to the households of nearby community. 

Melissa is requesting a loan to buy a pump boat engine and fishing net. Her loan will help her improve her catch and gain more earnings. Melissa hopes that someday she can expand her fishing business and also send her children to school for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a pump boat engine and fishing net

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 53-year-old widow from Palompon, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari business (variety store) where she sells various goods and commodities to the people in her community. Vilma usually earns 2,700 PHP per month. 

Vilma is requesting a loan to buy stocks to sell such as milk, coffee, soft drinks, beer, shampoo, detergent, and bath soap. Vilma hopes to expand her business and make it a success so she can support her youngest child who is 12 years old.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, soft drinks, beer, shampoo, detergent, and bath soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm needs such as water spinach and spinach seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for the vegetables

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 35 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 12 and 5 years, all of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been working in a business for 5 years. 

After getting her loan, she would like to buy more maize and beans for farming. The profits from the business will be reinvested and used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jolita

texts.en:
Jolita is 41 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. For the past three years, she has been farming sugarcane. Jolita has borrowed four previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Jolita is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kimoun

texts.en:
Kimoun, aged 57, living in a rural village of Ponhea Krek district, has six children. She and her husband are farmers who grow cassava to make a living. To supplement their income, she also works as a hair-dresser in the village. She has been in this business for seven years. She can earn about $15 per day to support the family’s needs.   

Kimoun is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to pay her daughter’s school fee. She hopes her daughter will have a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s school fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Payel Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
The self-help group named Payel Mahila Samuha is being led by Lakhi (the lady who is standing with her hand raised). It comprises distinctive and hardworking women members who hail from Birniya, a small village in the Deoghar district of Jharkhand. These members, who run various small businesses, have collectively approached MESP (Micrograam’s field partner) for a loan of INR 45,000. 

Lakhi has livestock and her husband is a building contractor. He has been doing this business for the last 10 years. Lakhi has two sons and a daughter. One son is working as a teacher’s assistant and the other two children are studying. The family income is not sufficient to meet the family expenses, so Lakhi planned to take a loan from Kiva to invest in her husband’s business, which will help her to increase her family's monthly income. 

The rest of the members of the group need the amount to improve their livelihoods. All of these members have been running their own businesses for a long time now. The loan that they have asked for will help them in increasing their family incomes and will also help them in planning a better future for their children. This will help them save their income and gear themselves up in case of emergencies. If the assistance they asked for is provided to them, it surely will change their lives.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's business.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is married and has three adult children. She is from Dulag, Leyte. She operates a printing and photocopying business, which she has been doing for more than five years. This business has provided Nelita the income she needs for her family's sustenance. 

Nelita requested a loan, which she will use to repair her computers. With this loan, she will be able to cater to more customers in her printing and photocopying shop. In the future, Nelita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to repair her computers

loans.name: Fructosa

texts.en:
Fructosa is a 61-year-old woman from Dulag, Leyte. She is married and still supporting three young grandchildren ages 2, 6 and 7. Fructosa's husband is a fisherman while she attends to her sari-sari (variety) store business. 

Her store has been her livelihood for 20 years. In it she sells basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries and rice. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, gasoline, canned goods, noodles, coffee and soft drinks. Fructosa hopes that with an additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business and save for her golden years.

loans.use: to buy rice, gasoline, canned goods, noodles, coffee and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jeliadel

texts.en:
Jeliadel is a 27-year-old woman who is married to Mixer, a 30-year-old man. They are blessed with a son and a daughter, namely Darnel, 2 years old and Venesa, just a month old. Jeliadel is a housewife while her husband, Mixer, is a private employee. 

Beside taking care of her family, Jeliadel also has a canteen business in a school. She has been running the business since 2012, selling snacks, cakes and "Salome" (meatballs). She has now stopped for a while for a break after giving birth to her daughter, but soon she will continue this business. 

Previously, Jeliadel and Mixer had a business of chicken breeding but the chickens died due to a virus that spread at that time, and they did not have money to restart the business. Recently, some people have offered Jeliadel to build a chicken stall and breed chickens for them. Then they will pay her for leasing the stall and raising chickens. 

Jeliadel received their offer but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she has applied for an individual loan from TLM of IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be used for building a chicken stall to be leased to the people.

loans.use: to purchase the materials to build a chicken stall

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 30-year-old woman who is married to Bildad, a 40-year-old man. They are endowed with two daughters namely Yunetri, 9 years old, a fourth grade elementary student, and Yusolfin, 7 years old, a second grade student of elementary school. Nora’s husband, Bildad, is an employee at a local newspaper company.
