To strengthen the family income, Nora has a "bemo" (a small truck used to transport people) business. When she started the business in 2012, she owned only one bemo. As the business developed with steady income of about IDR 200,000 per day, she was able to buy one more bemo in 2013. Now, she has two bemos and employs two drivers and a conductor (the one who collects money from the passengers). With these two bemos, her business income increased to IDR 400,000 - 500,000 per day. 

But the maintenance cost for these vehicles is high. Recently, one of the bemo’s engines needed to be repaired. In order to do so, she applied for an individual loan from TLM amounting IDR 10,000,000. This loan will be used to pay the bemo repair cost and other maintenance costs.

loans.use: to pay the bemo maintenance costs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old and married. She has eight children, two of whom are in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives with her husband and two-year-old son in the village Aknaghbyur in Tavush region. After graduating school, Karine got married very early. Since then she is doing farming with her husband, who simultaneously works as a contractual military man and on weekends he comes home. 

On her farm Karine has two piglets, 45 chickens and 15 ducks. Karine sells a lot of eggs from her farm and also pork. She has some income from her nice fruit garden as well, which gives perfect harvest of persimmon and fig. On her plot of land she cultivates corn which serves as a fodder for her pigs. As she says she is happy with her family and farming which fulfills all her day. 

Karine is asking for this loan in order to purchase animal fodder for her farm cattle. She will also repair her cattle barn, which will provide her cattle with warmth and safety during the winter.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for her farm cattle and repair her cattle barn.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 42 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Wilma has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Wilma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries.

loans.name: Venny

texts.en:
Venny is 55 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in Prey Veng province. To earn a living, Venny grows rice on a one-hectare plot and her husband is a district consultant. She has been a farmer for ages and she earns about 9 USD per day. Venny appears in this picture with her husband.

Venny is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor’s degree in finance and banking. This will be her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. In the future, Venny hopes that her daughter will get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter

location.town: Prey Veng province, Presh Sdach district

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 37 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 19 and 5 years; all of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been working for 8 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and maize for farming. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and maize for farming.

loans.name: Flocerfina

texts.en:
Flocerfina, 61, is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has four grown children. 

Flocerfina operates a sari-sari, or variety store, where she sells basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries and rice. She has been operating a sari-sari store for almost five years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks for the store like rice, seasonings, soft drinks and beverages. These will  attract more customers and create higher income. Flocerfina hopes that with an additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store like rice, seasonings, soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Abeid

texts.en:
Abeid, who is in his early 30s, is married and has two children, one son and one daughter, who are still going to school.  

He has been running a business of selling charcoal for seven years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be one of his loans which he has taken for some years from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on increasing his charcoal stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is doing fine with the loans. He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a TV set, a deck, a cupboard for clothes and covered household expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customers' demands. 

Abeid will make sure that he pays back his loan according to his schedule.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 30 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Priscilla works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines She has been in this business for three years. 

Priscilla requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future Priscilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 55 years old, married and has five children.  

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Vicenta has been pig fattening for 36 years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Vicenta requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a dried coconut meat sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming coconuts.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to  pay laborers' salaries for her dried coconut meat business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is 28 years old and she lives in Vanadzor City of Lori region. Ending her first Kiva loan, she hurries to ask for a second one. Astghik has higher pedagogical education and she is a specialist of Russian Language and Literature. For four years already, she has worked at one of the city’s schools as a teacher. She also has a group of pupils who come after school to her house where she helps to prepare their lessons. These are mainly pupils of elementary classes. 

Astghik is a very respected and beloved pedagogue among her colleagues and pupils as well. Astghik is married and she has two children. Her husband works at the fire rescue center as a rescuer. 

Astghik is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to attend computer teaching courses and she also wants to furnish the room where she gives her private courses at her house.

loans.use: to attend computer teaching courses and also to furnish the room where she gives her private courses

loans.name: Viotesima

texts.en:
Viotesima is 53 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is in school. Viotesima works very hard to provide for them.

She earns a living by selling spices in the Philippines. Viotesima has been in this business for ten years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more spices to sell in her food stall.
 
In the future Viotesima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Licet Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Liceth, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y sus tres hijos.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas como almuerzos y desayunos desde hace aproximadamente 5 años en su casa con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió al lado de su madre quien le enseño todo lo necesario para sus exquisitas recetas.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas, realizar adecuaciones locativas, comprar insumos para sus preparaciones y comprar utensilios de cocina.

Con este préstamo su negocio podrá tener esa fuerza y solidez que siempre ha querido.

Es una mujer que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
She is Licet, a woman of character and good will.  She has the desire to progress and get ahead with her husband and their three children.

She decided to start her business of preparing and selling food like breakfasts and lunches approximately five years ago.  She does this at her house with enthusiasm and drive .  She learned this trade at her mother’s side.  Her mother taught her everything she needed to know to prepare her exquisite recipes.

She now wishes to give her business a small boost.  That is the reason that she needs a loan to buy chairs and tables, to make adjustments to her place, to buy supplies for food preparation, and to buy kitchen utensils.

With this loan her business will be able to be strong and solid, which is what she has always wanted.  She is a woman who takes on challenges and faces them with courage.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables, to make adjustments to her place, to buy supplies for food preparation, and to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Claudia Mariel

texts.es:
Claudia Mariel es una joven estudiante de Arquitectura, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Claudia tengo 17 años, nací y  vivo en la ciudad de santo domingo con mis padres y mi hermana. Mi mama es maestra y mi papa actualmente está desempleado.
Acabo de iniciar mis estudios de arquitectura en la Universidad Nacional Pedro Henríquez Ureña (UNPHU). Escogí esa carrera porque que ese ha sido mi sueño desde niña.  Me apasiona todo lo relacionado a crear y diseñar.
Estoy solicitando el préstamo porque mis padres no tienen los recursos necesarios para pagarme mis estudios, ya que en estos momentos quien cubre todos los gastos de la casa es mi madre, porque mi padre tiene mucho tiempo desempleado.  En caso de no ser aprobado este préstamo tendré que suspender el cuatrimestre que estoy cursando y todos los demás que me faltan.
Mis metas académicas es primero graduarme con honores y ser una arquitecta reconocida y que con mis logros, producto de mi buen trabajo pueda devolverle a mis padres todo lo que han hecho por mí, dándole mejor calidad de vida a ellos y a mis hermanos
texts.en:
Claudia Mariel is studying architecture.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to cover college expenses.  Here is her story:

"My name is Claudia and I am 17-years old.  I was born in the city of Santo Domingo and still live there with my parents and sister.  My mother is a teacher and my father is currently unemployed.  I just started studying architecture at Pedro Henriquez Ureña National University (UNPHU).  I chose architecture because I've wanted to be an architect for as long as I can remember and I'm fascinated by everything connected to building and design.  I'm applying for a loan because my parents can't afford my college expenses.  My father has been unemployed for some time and my mother has to support all of us.  If I don't receive this loan, I won't be able to continue my studies.  My academic goals are, one, to graduate with honors and, two, to become a successful architect.  I hope to be successful enough professionally to repay my parents for everything that they have done for me and my brothers and sisters.".

loans.use: to cover college costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for improvements that will make her home safer.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 69 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Juanita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

Juanita has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling peanuts.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Emma is married and she lives with her husband who is a pedagogue. Emma has vocational education and for many years she worked at different companies as an accountant. Now also she does this work. With her husband, Emma is also engaged in farming; in their farm they have a cow, a calf, a heifer, two piglets, six lambs, eight sheep and 40 chickens. Emma says that she likes both her occupations and she enjoys the care of her farm cattle as much as her office work in accountancy. Being very active and a hard-working person, Emma is always in action and her recent feelings of weakness worry her very much.

She is asking for a loan of 110,000 Armenian drams in order to undergo a medical examination and find out the problem that causes her pains and unusual feelings.

loans.use: to undergo a medical examination to find out her health problem

loans.name: Neber Manuel

texts.es:
Neber tiene gran experiencia en el área de los alimentos gracias a la experiencia obtenida con su padre, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia salsamentaría-restaurante que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para comprar surtido de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos y poder venderlos a sus clientes.
El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en: Neber has a great amount of experience in the field of foods thanks to the experience he gained with his father. Some time ago he started his own deli restaurant that up to now has generated very good results. He has always preferred to work independently. He works every day from 8 am until 8 pm. Right now he needs some help to buy an assortment of supplies and ingredients to make his food and be able to sell them to his customers. The loan will allow him to work in better conditions and guarantee the quality of his offerings. His main dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for his restaurant.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is  27 years old, married, has two children, one of whom attends school. She sells clothes,which she has been doing for five years. 

Chantal requested a loan, which she will use to buy towels, trousers, and shirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase towels, trousers, and shirts to sel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material like sand and additives to make cinder blocks.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is 33 years old and married with three children who are in school, Cindy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Cindy has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Cindy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Kadogo

texts.en:
Kadogo, who is in his late 30s is married with four children. Three of them are in school and one is still small.  He has been running a business selling clothes for one year now. 

This will be Kadogo's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to sell chips, bought a bajaji for a transportation business and has now opened a big clothes shop.  He has paid back all his loans successfully. 

He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a TV set, a deck, a dining table and covered his household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase his clothes stock to sell.  

He dreams of building his own house and sending his children to good schools.

Kadogo will make sure that he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase his clothes stock for sale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 65-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Dulag, Leyte. She earns a living through her food vending. She sells home cooked foods to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. 

Juliana is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, sugar, cooking oil and seasonings, milk and others. With these, she will be able to cook and sell more to her customers thus augmenting her profit and income. 

Juliana aspires for a better life ahead.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, sugar, cooking oil and seasonings, milk and others

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
65-year-old Rosalina is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has four grown children. Rosalina runs a sari-sari or variety store, where she sells basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasonings and toiletries. In addition to this, she is also engages in a gasoline retail business. She has been operating a sari-sari store for more than 10 years. To continue her livelihood activity, Rosalina is asking for a loan to buy more stock like  biscuits, seasonings, canned goods and rice. 

 Rosalina hopes that she will expand her business and  be able to alleviate her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock  like  biscuits, seasonings, canned goods and rice

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 36 years old. She is married, with five children between the ages of 15 and 6 years; all of them go to school. She is a tailor, and has been working in a business for six years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for tailoring

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

Lina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Leticia Isabel

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Leticia es que ahora su hogar podrá tener unos ingresos extra.

Ella prepara y vende comidas en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de, insumos y materia prima.

Con estos elementos ella podrá capitalizar su negocio y obtener los recursos que siempre ha soñado.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.

Apoya a una mader emprendedora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Thanks to Leticia's grit and determination, her family has the extra income they need to get by.

Leticia operates a food business in Medellín that she started to generate another source of income for her family.  She says that her husband and children are her motivation for working hard, every day, to carry on the business.  Leticia will use this loan to buy the supplies she need to continue making the food she sells.

For the future, Leticia hopes to open a neighborhood restaurant.  

Please help this enterprising woman with your loans!

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a 64-year-old married woman, and a mother of four grown up children from Dulag, Leyte. She wants to open a sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods like food and cooking ingredients. She also wants to raise pigs for additional income.

As of now, Marcelina needs capital for this. She asks for a loan from CEVI to buy stock for her store, like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, and piglets to raise. This loan will enable her to earn an income to meet their needs for food and to pay their bills.

Marcelina aspires for a better life ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 55-year-old fish vendor from the town of Dulag in Leyte. She is married with a 12-year-old dependent. Virginia has been selling fish for 34 years now. This is the work that she knows best, and was instrumental in providing for her two other children when they were younger. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and piglets to raise for additional income. 

She hope that she can continue to manage her business well so she can save and give her child a good education. In the future, she dreams of having a more abundant life.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell and piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stocks of beer, add new chairs and open a kitchen selling roast meat.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 50 year old married woman and a mother of four children from Dulag, Leyte. 

Marivic runs a sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. For more than 3 years now, this business has supported Marivic in meeting her daily needs.

As of now, Marivic hopes of making her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, coffee, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, detergents, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is a 62-year-old resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has five grown children. Leonora operates a sari-sari, or variety store, where she sells basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, and toiletries. She has been operating a sari-sari store for a quite a few years now.

To be able to improve her earnings, Liliosa is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise like sugar, seasonings, soft drinks and soap. These will help augment her income, and she will be able to set aside some savings to purchase a pedicab.

In the future, Liliosa hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like sugar, seasonings, soft drinks and soap

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk lives in the village Zovaber of Gegharkunik region. He is 55 years old and he has vocational education. For 20 years, Hayk worked at the rest-house in Sevan city; now he works at his village municipality. Hayk’s wife is unemployed and together with Hyak, she is engaged in farming. Hayk’s farm is a very rich one: 3 cows, 3 calves, a heifer, 7 lambs, 7 sheep and 36 chickens. All his farm products such as milk, a great range of dairy-products (macun, cheese and curd), meat, and eggs are sold from his house. Hayk says the cheese that his wife makes is very popular and is in great demand. 

Now this loan will greatly help Hayk to expand his herd;  he will buy one more cow, and also fodder for his farm cattle, which he is starting to store as the cold season grows closer and closer day by day.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is age 33. She is married, with four children between the ages of 14 and 3 years; three of them go to school. 

She sells food stuffs, and has been running in a business for six years. 

With the loan requested, she would like to buy more maize and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans

loans.name: Hamest

texts.en:
Hamest is 50 years old and she lives with her school-aged son in the village Ddamashen of Gegharkunik region.  Hamest now works at the school as a cleaner and simultaneously she runs her farm. In her farm she takes care of 2 bulls, a cow, 2 piglets and 10 chickens. Hamest says that this will be her first loan and she hopes that it will bring with it more income and stability for her family. The main farm product that she sells from her farm is milk, and sometimes also meat and eggs.

She will be greatly happy to have this loan from Kiva which she plans to use on the purchase of one cow for her farm, and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow and also animal fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 33 years old and has four children.  She is married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

 Leonila requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. She has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Kanchaiym

texts.ru: Канчайым успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам за финансирование. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Канчайым есть 1 корова, 1 теленок и 1 лошадь. Канчайым по прежнему работает в школе учителем, несмотря на то, что она на пенсии. Ежемесячная прибыль Канчайым составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения поголовья скота, а именно покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Канчайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Kanchaiym successfully paid back her previous loan, which she used as intended. She is very thankful to Kiva and all investors for their financial support. She currently has one cow, one calf and one horse. As before, she is working as a schoolteacher, despite being on a pension. Her monthly income is 9,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Kanchaiym has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock, specifically to purchase sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals for her animals sales business.

loans.name: Oimniso

texts.ru: Оимнисо скромная, но талантливая женщина из южного района Джиликуль. Ей 51 год. Она обладает ремеслом шитья и вот уже на протяжении 33 лет занимается шитьем таджикских женских платьев. Оимнисо замужем, является матерью шестерых детей. Ее детям по 20, 17, 14, 11, 7 и 4 года. Как видите у нее большая семья и чтобы обспечивать такую большую семью работают муж Оимнисо, она сама и ее старший сын, который находится сейчас в России на заработках. Они ведут скромную жизнь и их заработок едва хватает на семейные расходы. В связи с этим Оимнисо хотела бы расширить свою швейную деятельность, чтобы увеличить получаемый доход. Она обратилась за кредитом из-за финансового недостатка. Оимнисо на сумму кредита собирается купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, а также другие необходимые швейные принадлежности. В будущем за счет прибыли с деятельности Оимнисо планирует женить сына.
texts.en: Oimniso is a modest, but talented woman from the southern district of Jilikul. She is 51 years old. She is skilled in sewing and has been involved in sewing Tajik women's dresses for 33 years. Oimniso is married and a mother of six children. Her children are 20, 17, 14, 11, 7 and 4 years old. As you can see, she has a big family, and Oimniso's husband, Oimniso and her oldest son, who now works in Russia, all work to provide for such a big family. They live a modest life, and their income is barely enough to cover the family's expenses. Due to this, Oimniso wants to expand her sewing business in order to increase her income. She requested this loan due to a lack in finances. Oimniso is planning to use this loan to buy a new, modern sewing machine and also other necessary sewing accessories. In the future, Oimniso plans to use the profit from her business to marry off her son.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a widow with five grown children, from Dulag, Leyte. For eight years now, she has been engaged in cooking different dishes to sell to the people in her community. She usually cooks fish, sautéed vegetables, meat stew and noodles for an income. It has been quite a challenge. She has to do all of this to provide for herself, but she works hard and perseveres. 

She is asking for a loan to buy seasoning, vegetables, fish, meat, and piglets to raise and feed.  She hopes that she can continue to expand her business, save, and live abundantly in the future.

loans.use: to buy seasoning, vegetables, fish, meat, and piglets to raise and feed.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28-year-old single man, the sole breadwinner for another five members of his family. He has specialized in manufacturing construction stones since 2010. His business needs updated machines to expand and develop it in a way so that one day he can stop being an employee in a dairy products factory, which he got employed in during 2013 to cover his family's increasing needs.

Mohamad is well known in his region, with a very good reputation. Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary machines to develop and expand his business.

He is very anxious about this loan, and looking forward to expanding his business properly.

loans.use: To buy the necessary machines to develop and expand his business

loans.name: Shoirakhon

texts.ru: Шоирахон молодая и энергичная женщина. Ей 22 года. Она замужем и воспитывает 2 детей. Она занимается предоставлением услуги швеи уже более 2 лет. Она шьёт как национальные, так и европейские стили женской одежды. Шоирахон предоставляет свои услуги дома. Она справляется со своим бизнесом одна. Она работает упорно, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Она очень хочет, чтобы ее дети получили хорошее образование и поступили в университет после окончания школы. Шоирахон обратилась в ИМОН за займом для того, чтобы купить ткани. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки ткани, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shoirakhon is a young and energetic woman. She is 22 years old. She is married and raising 2 children. She has been involved in providing seamstress services for over 2 years already. She sews national and European styles of women's clothing. Shoirakhon provides her services at home. She runs her business by herself. She works diligently to earn money and provide her children with all of the necessities. She really wants her children to obtain a good education and go to a university after finishing school. Shoirakhon requested a loan from IMON to buy fabrics. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to buy fabrics in order to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 34 years old. He is from Dulag, Leyte, in the Philippines. He is married with one son who is 5 years old. 

Virgilio works as an Electrician. However, he also sells fish and raises hogs for a living. He has been doing this for ten years now. 

He is asking for a loan to buy feed for his hogs, more piglets to raise, and fresh fish to sell. This will contribute to the progress of his business. His income will be used for his son's schooling and to provide a healthy diet for his family.

In the future, Virgilio hopes to have a bigger barn and earn more for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs, more piglets, and fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Niery

texts.en:
Niery is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Niery works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like chips, canned goods, etc.

Niery has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like chips, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 49 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc. Elsie has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Elsie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like coffee, bread, sugar, etc.

Manuela has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 24 years, and also earns an income from food vending and raising livestock.

Manuela aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like coffee, bread, sugar, etc

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 52 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rebecca has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anadalia

texts.en:
Anadalia is 32 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Anadalia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Anadalia has been in this business for five years.

In the future Anadalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in hay for animals.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 58 years old, married, and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Victoria requested her eighteenth loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo, chips, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, etc. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo, chips, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 60-year-old married woman, and a mother of three grown up children from Dulag, Leyte. Delia is engaged in retail store business. She sells various goods like food and cooking ingredients. For the past 20 years, her business has been profitable and sustainable.

However, Delia wants to expand her store, so she has decided to take a loan from CEVI to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, and others. This loan will enable her to augment her stock and attract more buyers in her store. Delia dreams of a more successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Marco Enrique

texts.es:
Marco es un joven muy estudioso y trabajador, actualmente se desempeña como Asistente de Residente de Obra en su ciudad natal, Chiclayo. También está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Civil en la Universidad. Marco sabe que trabajar todo el día y estudiar es un poco cansado, pero es un reto que él lo asume con mucho entusiasmo porque más adelante quiere convertirse en un exitoso profesional.
Marco está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pagar su ciclo académico, con esto seguirá estudiando con total normalidad y más adelante, cuando se gradúe podrá emprender su propio negocio Inmobiliario.
texts.en:
Marco is a smart, hard-working young man.  He is working as an apprentice on a building site in Chiclayo, the city where he was born and raised, and studying civil engineering at a local university.  Working a full-time job and studying for a degree at the same time is a challenge, but a challenge that Marco has happily taken on because he knows that his efforts will pay off when he graduates.
Marco is grateful to Kiva lenders because their loans have allowed him to pay his university expenses and continue his studies.  When he graduates, he'll be able to start his own company, buying and renovating properties.

loans.use: to cover university expenses.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина — из Берегово. Она — социальный работник, воспитатель у детей-сирот. Живет в собственном трехкомнатном доме. Так как семья стала больше — у Ирины с мужем не было своих детей и они взяли трех детей сирот — появилась необходимость и в дополнительной жилплощади.  Когда Ирина взяла детей на воспитание, они с мужем сделали евроремонт в доме. После окончания работ буря снесла крышу с дома, стены и потолок промокли, штукатурка поотпадала — нужно было все делать заново, плюс устанавливать новую крышу. 
Сейчас Ирина очень хочет, чтобы у каждого из их детей была своя комната, потому что дети растут и нуждаются в личном пространстве и спокойной обстановке. Для расширения дома и пристройки дополнительных комнат нужны финансовые средства. Полученные от КИВА средства в размере 40 000 гривен Ирина с мужем вложат в этот проект.
texts.en:
Irina is from Beregovo. She is a social worker, educator for orphaned children. She lives in her own three-room house. Because her family became bigger - Irina and her husband did not have their own children and took in three orphans - a need for a larger living area arose. When Irina adopted the children, she and her husband did a Euro-repair at home. After the work was done, a storm tore off a roof from their home, walls and ceiling got wet, plaster fell off, and everything had to redone from scratch plus a new roof had to be installed.

Now Irina really wants for each of their children to have their own room because the children are growing up and need their space and calm atmosphere. Financial means are necessary to expand the house and building additional rooms. Irina and her husband will invest the 40 000 hryvnia loan obtained from Kiva into this project.

loans.use: to make additions to her house, so that 3 orphan kids she adopted would have their own rooms

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
Wennie is a 28-year-old, married woman and a mother of two children, from Dulag, Leyte. She is engaged in retail sales of clothing, perfumes, curtains, slippers, and other items. She also earns an additional income from her hog-raising business. 

Wennie is asking for a loan to buy piglets and animal feed, and additional stocks, like slippers, clothes, curtains, and other items. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. 

In the future, Wennie hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed, and additional stocks, like slippers, clothes, curtains, and other items.

loans.name: Yenny Paola

texts.es:
Yenny, de 24 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables
texts.en:
Yenny, 24, has a very clear idea of what she wants in life.  She's determined to finish school so she can get ahead and have a good life.  She's an enterprising and very disciplined woman.  

She works selling a variety of merchandise, including clothing and accessories such as wallets and cosmetics.  She started this business to get the resources she needs to support herself and her studies.

Yenny's requesting a loan to buy a wide supply of merchandise to have inventory available to sell to her customers.

She hopes to be able to make progress as an entrepreneur and earn a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy wallets and accessories

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. Rosalia is married and has a fish-selling business in the Philippines. Rosalia has been in this business for 4 years now.

She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional crates of fish to sell from her stall.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional crates of fish to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Rodne

texts.en:
Rodne is 32 years old, from Dulag, Leyte. He is a father to two children, ages one and three. 

For a long time now, Rodne has been buying and selling pigs intended for lechon (roasted young pig). Lechon is one of Filipinos' favorite foods, but it is also an expensive one. This business usually earns him PHP 3,000 per month. 

Rodne is asking for a loan, so he can buy more pigs for lechon, especially during peak season when the orders for this are high. He hopes that, with this loan, he can meet the orders as a supplier for his customers, thus earning a better income for his family. 

In the future, Rodne hopes to expand his business to meet his children's needs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for roasting.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Flora has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Flora has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Yaovi jeune homme de 35ans, vit avec sa femme revendeuse et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 08 et 5ans et vont tous à l'école. Yaovi est revendeur de profession. il exerce comme activité la vente des batteries et diverses pièces détachées auto dans la zone portuaire. Son premier crédit l'aidera à acheter plus de marchandises. Yaovi avec le profit espère ouvrir une boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Yaovi is a young man aged 35 who lives with his wife, a trader, and their two children in Lomé. The children are aged eight and five and are both in school.

Yaovi is a trader by profession and sells batteries and spare automobile parts in the port area. His first loan will help him buy more stock.

With his profits, Yaovi hopes to open a shop and provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy batteries and various spare parts.

loans.name: Ayabavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits alimentaires à domicile depuis 2010, Ayabavi âgée de 34ans fait son second crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son activité afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. A l'avenir, Ayabavi désire agrandir son activité en vendant en gros et assurer l'auto suffisance alimentaire de la famille(Mariée, elle n'a pas encore d'enfant en charge).
texts.en:
Ayabavi is 34 years old and has been selling food products from her home since 2010. This is her second WAGES loan to help her strengthen her business in order to satisfy her customers.

In the future, Ayabavi hopes to expand her business by selling wholesale and ensure that her family can be self-sufficient in terms of food (she is married but has no children yet).

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Belencita

texts.en:
Belencita is a 53-year-old, married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Belencita is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings, bread and biscuits. This loan will really help Belencita to increase her stocks. 

Belencita dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings, bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, spices, soap, shampoo, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, spices, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old and married with three children, one of whom in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Norma has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 28ans, pour subvenir à ses besoins a décidé de vendre des baffe et CD dans sa boutique.Il est à son troisième crédit et cela pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Il souhaite fonder une famille à l'avenir et devenir grossiste. Abraham a une ancienneté de 03ans dans l'activité.
texts.en:
Abraham is a young man aged 28. In order to earn a living he sells speakers and CDs in his shop.

He is requesting his third loan to buy goods so that he can respond to customer demand.

In the future, Abraham would like to start a family and become a wholesaler. He has been in this business for three years.

loans.use: to buy speakers and CDs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal, welding rods and other materials.

loans.name: Jessen

texts.en: Jessen is 26 years old. She has three children ages 1, 5, and 8 years old. For a year now, Jessen sells gasoline along the highway near her home. Gasoline retail is usually sold with the use of empty Pepsi and Coca Cola bottles due to its accurate measurement on a per liter basis. Jessen is asking for a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. She hope that she can earn better by having the means to store more in her place. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and find a better business location to increase business profitability for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Nancita

texts.en:
Nancita is a 51-year-old married woman, and a mother of 11 children from Leyte, Philippines. She makes a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. Nancita sells goods like food and cooking ingredients. This has been her source of income for some time now. 

Nancita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits, bread and chips, and condiments. With this, she will be able to augment her inventories, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.  In the future, Nancita hopes to make her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits, bread and chips.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 49 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling personal collection and Tupperware products in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Elsa has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business selling personal collection and Tupperware products for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling used clothes. Elsa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda Magali

texts.es: Esmeralda es madre soltera , ella tiene 36 años de edad y sus hijo 11 años y se encuentra estudiando, Esmeralda vive en el campo con su s padres y su hijo y por ende se dedica a la crianza de animales, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para  tenerlos en chanchera que le presta su madre, lo que Esmeralda aspira es mejorar su negocio y incrementar las ganancias que este le deje y  seguir luchando por el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a single mother. She is 36 years old and her child, who is 11 years old, is in school.  Esmeralda lives in the countryside with her parents and son. She raises animals.

She will use this loan to purchase pigs to keep them in a pigpen that her mother is lending her.

Esmeralda aspires to improve her business and increase her earnings from it so she can continue striving for the well-being of her child.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for his business

loans.name: El Zarsal Group

texts.es:
María, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, y reside en una aldea que pertenece al Municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a realizar actividades agrícolas con su familia, lleva 10 años de cultivar café. Esta producción que cosecha la vende a intermediarios en la misma zona. Ha solicitado otro préstamo a la institución siendo el quinto ciclo, y es por 12,000 Lempiras. Este préstamo es en forma grupal y lo va invertir en fertilizantes, limpieza de la finca y en siembra de mas plantas de café para mejorar la cosecha y sus ingresos. Su idea a futuro es comprar un terreno para ampliar el cultivo de café.
El grupo se llama El Zarsal, integrado por tres personas, que se dedican a la agricultura y residen en la misma zona. Han solicitado un préstamo grupal por 32,000 lempiras para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de café, en limpieza y fertilización. En la foto se identifica María del Carmen a la Izquierda, Adrián y a la derecha esta María Lidia.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in a village that belongs to the Municipality of Gracias, Lempira. She has always worked in agriculture with her family and has grown coffee for 10 years. She sells the harvest to middlemen from her area. She has requested another loan from the institution, this being her fifth loan, for 12,000 HNL. This is part of a group loan and she will invest it in fertilizer, cleaning her farm and planting more coffee plants to improve her harvest and profits. Her plan for the future is to buy a plot of land to expand her coffee growing.

The group is called "El Zarsal" and is made up of three people. They all work in agriculture and live in the same area. They have requested a group loan for 32,000 HNL to maintain their coffee crops and fertilize them. In the photo María del Carmen is to the left, then Adrián and to the right is María Lidia.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer, cleaning her plantation and planting more coffee plants.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
Habil is 40 years old. He lives in Fuzuli region near the war zone with his family, but his family members have been IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city for over 22 years. Habil is married and has two children. One of his children is a 15-year-old boy who goes to eighth class of school, the other child is a 13-year-old and she goes to sixth class. His wife is a housewife. 

Habil has been in the animal breeding business and loves his job. He sells milk and milky products (yogurt, cheese and etc.), which Habil and his wife make. Now Habil wants to buy more cows. Therefore he needs a loan in amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is thankful for this loan from the Kiva organization and lenders. In the future, Habil wants to build a new stall for cows to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Real Sociedad Group

texts.es:
Real Sociedad, grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socias exitosas en su vida laboral, es coordinado por la señora Josefa, quien tiene la edad de veintitrés años, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, quienes han sido motivo de su superación, se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas. 
Compra al por mayor y vende al detalle, y en alguno de los casos sirve como intermediadora entre el productor y el demandante que prefiere el producto al por mayor, también ofrece productos al detalle en el mercado de la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate y cajillas de mamón, con el crédito anterior logro cubrir la demanda que tenia de sus productos ofrecidos. 
Otra de los integrantes es la señora Angelita, quien tiene la edad de 36 años y comercializa frutas y verduras en el mercado de la municipalidad, la señora Julia de 45 años, quien ofrece el servicio de comida desde hace veintiún años en el mercado más populoso de la capital, y la señora Juana quien tiene la edad de 34 años y se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad.
texts.en:
Real Sociedad, a solidarity group made up of four members who are successful in their work, is coordinated by Josefa, 23.  She's married and the mother of two children who are the motivation for her self-improvement.

Josefa earns a living buying and selling crops.  She buys wholesale and sells retail, sometimes serving as an intermediary between the producer and a customer who prefers to buy wholesale.  She also sells products retail in the town market.

She's requesting the loan to buy a crop of avocado and crates of papaya.  With the previous loan, she managed to cover the demand for the products she sells.

The other members are Angelita, 36, who sells fruits and vegetables in the town market; Julia, 45, who has sold food for 21 years in the biggest market in the capital; and Juana, 34, who buys and sells crops in the town market.

loans.use: to buy avocado and papaya

loans.name: Edo

texts.fr: Revendeuse d'oignons et produits d'alimentation générale au marché, madame Edo âgée de 39ans est mariée et mère de famille. Il s'approvisionne à Lomé et se fait aidée par 01 personne. N'arrivant pas à répondre aux besoins des clients à cause du manque de fonds, elle demande un premier prêt pour acheter des marchandises. Elle désire exposer ses marchandises dans une boutique et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Edo is 39 years old and has a family. She sells onions and general produce at the market.

Edo buys her supplies in Lomé with the assistance of one other person. As she cannot meet the needs of her customers due to a lack of funds, Edo is requesting a first loan to buy supplies.

Edo would like to sell her produce from a shop and help her family thrive.

loans.use: to buy onions and general produce.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Francisca is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has six children.The oldest is 21 while the youngest is 6. Francisca is a chainsaw operator. She charges a certain fee after the services are rendered. A chainsaw is a tool used to cut tress. She has been in this business for more than five years. Aside from that, Francisca engages in a food-vending business. She sells homemade meals. 

Francisca is planning to open up a sari-sari (variety) store. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like soap, rice, toiletries and beverages. These could be a start for her livelihood to prosper, thus providing her family with nutritious food and good living conditions.

Francisca hopes that she can expand her businesses to be able to continue to send her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soap, rice, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a farmer from Leyte, Philippines. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than four years now. She grows vegetables and rice.

Gemma is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these, she will be able to grow healthier crops, thus allowing her to increase her harvest. In the future, Gemma hopes to make her business a success. Moreover she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia is 40 years old and has six children. She is married, and two of their children are still in school.

Abundia is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. 

She has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Abundia has been farming rice for 5 years now. She has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to help sustain her business.

In the future, Abundia would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Suglo Nbori Buni - Chaalam Group

texts.en:
Samata is 40 years old, married, and has seven children. She is a hard-working woman from Chaalam in the Northern region of Ghana.  Samata is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last three years. The name of the group is Suglo Nbori Buni - Chaalam. Samata earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana and Planet Finance on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and non-local markets.

Samata and her group requested a loan for 2,800 GHS. Samata will use her portion to buy four bags of shea nuts for processing. Samata aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her children with food and educational materials.

Samata is pictured first on the right among members standing.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is a married woman, and mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. Julie wanted to earn a living through a hog raising business. With that, she joined CEVI to borrow a loan to buy materials to make a pigpen like plywood, galvanized iron, nails, hardwood and others. This will allow her to improve her hog raising business. In the future, Julie dreams of making her business a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials like plywood, galvanized iron, nails, hardwood etc. to make a pigpen.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 34 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She is a cash crop farmer and also keeps poultry and has been in this business for 14 years.
 
She will be using this loan to buy more stock of chickens for rearing and selling. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her farming business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and poulty.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She farms rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from running a general store and raising poultry. 

Gloria is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Priya Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Fulkumari, Premlata, Mangli, Rekha, and Ranthi live in the rural part of Bandhdih, Dumka district, Jharkhand, and they have formed a group, “Priya Mahila Samuha”, to help each other improve their livelihoods. Each one has their own aspirations that they hope to realize. They want to educate their children and improve their standard of living, for which they are ready to work hard and do what it takes to uplift their families. 

Fulkumari is the leader of the group (hand raised). She lives with her husband and their four children. Fulkumari and her husband are engaged in agriculture activities on the cultivatable land that they have. They grow vegetables and sell them in the weekly market or to the agents. 

Fulkumari is requesting a loan to purchase better seeds and fertilizer to improve their yield. The other members are also requesting a loan to improve their small businesses, as these women need sufficient capital that they will invest in their respective endeavors. Your loan will help five hardworking and deserving families take a big step towards improving their livelihoods and lives.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 38-year-old Ugandan, married to Harriet, and they have five children ages 15, 13, 10, 7 and 5. He is a businessman in Karuguza and he has operated a retail shop, which sells general merchandise since 2008.

He has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to buy general merchandise for his shop to earn more profits, but he faces challenges of competition from other business people who do the same business. He hopes with the loan boost, he will out compete his rivals by buying a variety of the products needed by the customers. He is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy cartons of water, soap, salt, sugar and other retail items to sell.

loans.name: Dathiva

texts.en:
Dathiva is 32 years old. She is married with 4 children, aged between 5 and 14 years of age, all of whom go to school. 

Dathiva sells drinks common to the area, and has been working in her business for 6 years. With her loan she would like to buy more sorghum to make a local specialty drink. 

The profits from her business will be used to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to make a local specialty drink for sale.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Ethel is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has three children. The oldest child is 6, while the youngest is 1 year old respectively. 

Ethel runs a variety store, and sells various basic commodities such as canned goods, soap, sugar, eggs, vegetables, and beverages. She has been operating a  variety store for more than five years now. Because of the scarcity of capital, Ethel is asking for a loan to buy additional varieties of merchandise such as soap, shampoo, beverages, canned goods, and seasonings. These could help Ethel improve her sales and create higher earnings.

Ethel hopes that someday she will expand her variety store business and eventually will create a greater impact on the whole family, not only to prosper, but also to nourish and provide her children with quality education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to  buy additional varieties of merchandise such as soap, shampoo, beverages, canned goods, and seasonings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farming goods such as fertilizers and buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 38 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 19 and 6 years; all of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been running the business for the past six years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Agnes. She is a 39-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Agnes and her husband have been blessed with two children. 

For four years, Agnes has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. 

In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Agnes, however, is taking this a little step further. She is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a farmer from Dulag, Leyte. A 36-year-old married mother of three children, Zenaida has been growing rice on her farm for more than four years now in partnership with her husband. 

Zenaida is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm, purchases that will help her improve productivity. In the future, she hopes to make her enterprise both successful and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to support his land, chickens and chicken feed, and to look for resources to feed his 6 children.

loans.name: Genesta

texts.en: Genesta is 48 years old. She is married with four children aged between 23 and 5 years; all of them go to school. She sells sorghum and has been running the business for five years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, aged 62, is married with three children aged between 21 and 15 years old; all of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been selling in a business for six years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice, cooking oil, and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio junto con su esposa trabajan en un sueño compartido tener su propia vivienda, para vivir junto con sus dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad, Julio con su esposa se dedican a la comercialización de medicamentos, tienen todos los avales legales para realizar estas actividades. 
Buscando alcanzar el sueño tan ambicioso y no tocar los pocos fondos que con tanto esfuerzo han ahorrado para su hogar que para el son su mayor tesoro, quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar surtido en general y así poder ir pagando pro cuotas que es más cómodos para ellos y claro con las ventas esperan beneficios para seguir aumentando sus ahorros y poder algún día comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Julio and his wife work toward the shared dream of having their own home where they can live with their two children, ages 3 and 6.  They work selling medicine and have all the legal guarantees to carry out this work.

Looking to realize his ambitious dream and not touch the small amount of funds they have saved with so much effort for their household, which is his greatest treasure, he wants to request a loan to buy a variety of inventory.  That way he can keep on making his payments, which is more convenient for them.

With his sales he expects profits to keep on increasing his savings so one day he can buy his house.

loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Oscar Dario

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven campesino de 33 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día desea iniciar con un negocio de producción de plantas aromáticas, actividad que realizara todos los días y las cosechas que recolecte serán vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementaria los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de su hijo de 1 año. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros), con esto podrá iniciar con este negocio.

Oscar, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young farmer of 33 years of age who is hardworking and humble. As a child he learnt how to take care of all the farm duties thanks to his parents' teachings. This has allowed him to make progress and now he would like to start his own business growing aromatic plants, which is something he already does on a daily basis. The crops he harvests are collected and then sold in the town market place. He also works as a day labourer on different farms in the region which supplements his income that is dedicated to the wellbeing of his one year old son.

With the financial support from this loan Oscar will buy agricultural supplies in bulk (compost, pesticides, fertiliser and other items) with which he will be able to start his own business.

With his enterprising spirit, strength and tenancity, Oscar wants to continue striving to achieve his dream to have his own farm where he can grow a great variety of products and improve the profitability of his business. This will guarantee him a stable financial situation so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in bulk (compost, pesticides, fertiliser and other items) so that he can start his own business

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 24 years old and a single woman. The man shown in the photo is Asia’s brother who is a driver by trade and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. Her brother is the only earner of the family. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Asia has applied for a loan of Rs 45,000 for her brother. He wants to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Asia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her brother and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 37-year-old married woman. She is motivated to provide her family with a better standard of living. The man shown in this photo is her husband. Along with her husband, she has been dealing in the business of animal selling for 15 years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Nasreen needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of three children. Some time ago, her husband (also shown in the photo) started up a van driving business. Her husband owns one van and needs some financial help. He will use the loan amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van. 

Therefore, Salma has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is thankful to Kashf for previous loans and she is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standard will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as seeds, plague-control products, and fertilizers to be able to prepare her crops.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав — из Дрогобыча. Держит киоск, торгует посудой и сувенирами. Более того, предоставляет также услуги транспортных перевозок. Ярослав с женой, двумя детьми и матерью живет в собственном двухэтажном доме. В доме на втором этаже нет ванной комнаты. 
Ярослав давно планировал сделать ванную на втором этаже, но все время находились другие  первоочередные финансовые вопросы, которые нужно было решать. В этот раз Ярослав решил не откладывать больше задуманное и вложить 40 000 гривен в ремонт ванной комнаты до рождения третьего ребенка, которого они с женой ждут в ближайшие месяцы. Это поможет сделать жизнь жены и новорожденного малыша уютнее и комфортнее.
texts.en: Yaroslav is from Drogobych. He runs a kiosk, where he sells dishware and souvenirs. In addition to it, he provides transportation services. Yaroslav, his wife, two children and mother live in their own two-story house. The second floor of the house does not have a bathroom. Yaroslav has been planning to build a bathroom on the second floor for a long time, but priority always went to other financial concerns that had to be resolved. This time, Yaroslav decided not to put off his goals anymore and invest 40 000 hryvnia into repairing the bathroom prior to the birth of his third child, whom his wife and he are expecting in the coming months. This would make his wife's and new baby's lives more convenient and comfortable.

loans.use: to build a bathroom on the second floor of his house

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Salina, a mother of four from Kapsowar, a remote town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past five years of her life farming. She sells milk, poultry, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business to make ends meet.
