Salina is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows, she has named one of them “Koroi”. Milking “Koroi” makes Salina very proud, and she feels fulfilled.

Dairy farming being a very profitable business venture, Salina wants to take full advantage. She would like to expand her dairy business, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to grow with. She is requesting a loan which she will use to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. Salina has planted Napier grass, so feeding the cows will never be a challenge. She also owns an expansive piece of land, and the excess space will be productively used once she acquires the additional dairy cow. 

The 'exotic' cow she will buy will produce between 10 and 15 litres of milk per day, and this will translate to more income and profits. The profits from milk selling will allow Salina to grow her business further, by starting to package milk and by processing it into other dairy products, such as cream, yoghurt, and cheese. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. She projects that she will be able to start a biogas plant at her farm, which will save her money in fuel costs.

With your loan, all that Salina dreams of is a secure future for her children. Salina awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en:
Nosheen is a 26-year-old married woman. She has three children; two of them are school-going. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. After she married, she felt that she should help her husband to improve their financial condition. She has been running a business of livestock sales and purchase for four years with the help of her husband.

Nosheen sells the livestock in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay her family’s expenses. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals for resale. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more animals

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 31-year-old married woman. She runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, and after sewing she sells it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy a new sewing machine, a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. Yasmin has a good credit history, and this will be her seventh loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 39 years old and is a very enthusiastic person. She has six children. She wants to provide her children with a good standard of living. She has been successfully running a small general store for 10 years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, she needs to maintain a stock of various goods to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juice and other goods. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juice

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 54-year-old married woman. She has five children. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household. Therefore she started her business of tailoring. She is a very talented lady and has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community.

 At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase a new sewing machine and more reels of thread with packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Zubaida's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and more reels of thread with packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru: Анварчон честный и жизнерадостный молодой человек. Он родился в 1995 году. Анварчон учится в Таджикском Государственном Металлургическом Университете. Он студент 2 курса. Анварчон живет с родителями. В свободное время от занятий он помогает своим родителям по домохозяйству. Он очень начитанный молодой человек. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Anvarjon is an honest and happy young man. He was born in 1995. Anvarjon attends the Tajikistan State Metallurgic University. He is a second-year student there. Anvarjon lives with his parents. In his time free from school work, he helps his parents with the household. He is a very well-read young person. He is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Rose, a mother of four from Kapsowar, a remote village in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past four years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business, to make ends meet. Rose is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed one of them Kipara, meaning "no feathers on the head." 

Rose wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 25,000, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Rose will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Rose is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Rose dreams of a secure future for her children. Rose awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional poiltry

loans.name: Arturo Abraham

texts.es:
Arturo es un joven emprendedor al que le gusta leer en sus momentos libres y trabaja en atención al público en una prestigiosa empresa de su ciudad natal, Ica. Está estudiando una carrera profesional para poder tener mayores oportunidades laborales y así sacar adelante a su familia, es una persona muy emprendedora e innovadora.
Debido a los grandes deseos que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Arturo va a utilizar el crédito para poder hacer mejoras en su vivienda como reforzar las paredes. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad y quiere que ellos sepan que esta ayuda le dará mayor seguridad a su familia ya que en esa zona hay temblores con frecuencia y así con estas remodelaciones su casa estará más asegurada y gozarán de bienestar.
texts.en:
Arturo is a young entrepreneur who likes to read in his free time and works in customer service for a prestigious company in his home town, Ica.  He is a very enterprising and innovative person who is studying to obtain a professional degree so that he can have better employment opportunities and raise his family.

Thanks to his great desire to improve his family's quality of life, Arturo will utilise this loan to make improvements to his home, such as reinforcing the walls. 

Arturo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity and he wants them to know that this loan will give his family more security since there are many earth tremors in the area where they live. After remodeling their home, his family will feel safer and enjoy a greater sense of well being.

loans.use: to reinforce the walls of his home for greater security

loans.name: Mercedes Benilda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene  41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 17 y de 15 años de edad, uno estudia en universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de trabajo salir adelante, ella es maestra en una escuela de infantes del Estado pero en su casa ella tiene  un pequeño negocio, vende helados, colas, jugos y varios bocadillos de picar, entre otras cosas, abre su negocio todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan cuando ella está en su trabajo, lleva en este negocio por más de 4 años y desde que está recibiendo los créditos se le ha hecho más fácil poder surtir su local. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio, va a comprar helados, jugos, colas y bocadillos. Lleva 6 años en Grupo De Crédito, le gusta por la ayuda que le  dan los créditos en su negocio. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 communal bank meets every 15 days in the district of Jaramijo. This place is known for its coast and beautiful beaches. The majority of its inhabitants are very hardworking and have occupations related to the sea.

This is where Mercedes lives. She is 41 years old, married and has two children ages 17 and 15. Her oldest son is in university and the other one is in high school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mercedes is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead in life. She is a public school teacher and also has a small business at home, where she sells ice cream, soft drinks, juice and snacks, among other things. She opens her business every day and her children help her when she is at work. She has had this business for more than 4 years and since she started receiving the loans, it has become easier to stock it.

She will use this loan to stock her business. She will buy ice cream, juice, soft drinks and snacks. She has been part of the communal bank for 6 years. She likes it because of the help that the loans provide to her business. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy ice cream, juice, soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a married mother of three children, and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market, and has been in this business for six years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy flour, cooking oil, beans, peas, green bananas, and charcoal.  

She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality. In the future, she would like to start providing outside catering.

She has her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, beans, peas, green bananas, and charcoal.

loans.name: Alya

texts.en: Alya is a 61-year-old widow woman from Lebanon. She lives on her own and takes responsibility of satisfying her needs by working in producing homemade food. She has 31 years of experience working in this domain and produces very tasty and appetizing provisions. Today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase products needed to carry on with producing the required provisions. Alya is very optimistic and wishes to keep on pleasing herself financially and ethically.

loans.use: to purchase needed products

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 65-year-old pensioner woman from the district of Gardabani. She lives alone and earns a living from her pension only. According to this above mentioned situation, Lali lives in poverty, as this income is hardly enough for covering even basic needs. She has a great desire to be involved in her own business and start trading at the local market. 

She has requested loans, but all of the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her poor living conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Lali applied to MFO Credo for the credit. Her request was approved in the framework of the start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Lali will purchase stock of food products, like lemons, fish and canned products and will sell from a counter at the local market. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase her income. Lali's income will double, and then she will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To start selling products from a counter at the local market

loans.name: Luis Rafael

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como jornalero en otras fincas y es la cría y venta de cerdos y pollos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos pollos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Luis is a man who works as a loving father and farmer. Since his income is insufficient to cover household expenses, he began a business that he runs in his spare time after his work as a day laborer on other farms. He breeds and sells pigs and broiler chickens in order to improve his family’s living conditions. 

As head of the family, Luis is responsible for all household expenses and he does not have much capital left to invest in his business. Consequently he needs a loan to purchase pigs, broiler chickens and feed so that he can improve his sales and promote his business. By having more pigs to sell, he will energize his small business and make it more attractive to customers.

His principal dream is to be able to generate a good income so that he won’t see his family with any unmet needs since that is something he faced and that affected him greatly. That is why he works tirelessly for his children and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and broiler chickens to improve his business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Hello there! The above picture presents to you Susan, who lives in Eldoret area of Kenya, also known as the Home of Champions because of producing so many elite runners who have broken so many world records. Susan is the mother of one lovely daughter and has been doing farming for the past two years. Through dairy farming and poultry keeping, she has been able to produce milk and eggs. Susan is a very dedicated farmer who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every bit of farming because, through farming, she is able to take care of her family’s needs and wants. Although she experiences challenges in farming, her attitude keeps her going. Enjoying what she does, she has even nicknamed her cow “lovii.” Susan is seeking a 40,000 KES loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forages. This assists the animal in digestion and prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food. With the loan, she would be able to increase her milk productivity and also increase her income levels, hence reducing the poverty level that is currently facing her. Susan’s biggest dream is to get out of this poverty level, and this loan will be a stepping stone toward improving the living standards of her family and increasing her income level.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Maria Melwida

texts.en:
Maria Melwida is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in retail sale of processed foods like hot dogs and sausage. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Maria Melwida is asking for a loan to buy more processed foods like hot dogs, sausage and others. With this, she will be able to sell more to her customers, thus augmenting her sales and income. Maria Melwida hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more processed foods like hot dogs, sausage and others

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married with six children and two go to school. She has additional family members. She is a poultry farmer and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy vaccines, poultry feeds, and serving utensils. She also generates additional income from rental houses. She works on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasons. She is aspiring to build more poultry rooms. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utilities.

loans.use: To buy vaccines, poultry feeds, and serving utensils

loans.name: Nelly Marlene

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene  52 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores y el menor de 16 años de edad el cual estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ellos. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Nelly para gana lo suyo y con estos ayudarle a  su marido a solventar  los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes  cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores de alta mar ya que es allí cuando tienen mucho dinero para comprar sus cosas, les vende a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual comenzó con el primer crédito pop lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y que su negocio siga adelante.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 loan group meets every day in the Jaramijo canton, a place which is known for its beautiful beaches which bathe the coasts of this lovely place. The majority of the canton's people are very hardworking and work in jobs connected to the sea. 

In this place lives Nelly. She is 52 years of age and lives with her partner with whom she has three children. Two are now adults and the youngest is 16 years of age, studies at high school and lives with them. Her husband is a fisherman.

To make a living and help her husband meet the household costs, Nelly runs a business selling all types of clothing from door to door and also from her home where her customers come when they need a particular item. Nelly takes advantage of the times when the fishermen arrive from the high seas since this is when they have a lot of money to buy from her. She sells on credit and collects payments weekly. She has been doing this job for 14 years, having started it with her very first credit which she is very thankful for.

This loan will go towards buying all types of clothing. Nelly has been with her loan group from the beginning and she likes being with them because this is how she started her business. Her dream is to have good health and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dining room set for his family.

loans.name: Yassmine

texts.en: Yassmine is a 29-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. Her father is the main income source of the family and she cooperates with him in collaboration with her siblings to be able to pay everyday’s expenditure. She has worked as a hairdresser for the past 10 years. She works from her home where she receives her customers to please their needs by providing them with her talented services. With her youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase hairdressing supplies. In the future, she plans to open a salon where she will better welcome her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is a 24-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. She works very hard in cooperation with her husband, who works in the Lebanese army to pay the heavy life expenses. She has worked since 2002, making exceptional designs on chocolates for special occasions. Presently, she is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy needed products with the intention of creating more designs that are very pleasing to the customer’s eye so as to augment her sales and hence her income.

loans.use: to buy needed products to make exceptional designs on chocolates for special occasions.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is 39 years old, married, and has five children, some of whom attend school. She operates a grocery store, which she has been doing for two years, selling dairy and daily products. 

Faten requested a loan from Vitas s.a.l , which she will use to increase her store’s inventory with the aim of increasing her sales and hence her income. In the future, she wants to expand her business by adding more items in her shop.

loans.use: to increase her grocery store’s inventory

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David sells livestock and has been running this business for five years now. He is 54 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with three children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of sheep and goats to rear and later sell them at a profit. He will use the anticipated profits to open a butchery.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats.

loans.name: Eloisa Cristina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Eloísa, tiene  50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos estudian en universidad, dos de ellos  aún viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Eloisa para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de artículos de bazar, helados, colas, cosas de picar, entre otros productos. Trabaja todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan con sus ventas, antes ella vendía ropa pero dejo de hacerlo porque tuvo varios problemas con el negocio y por esta razón  instalo este pequeño bazar en su casa el cual le está dando buenos beneficios que le sirven para salir adelante. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica al comercio ya sea con la venta de ropa y ahora en su bazar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar artículos de bazar. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 10 años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 credit group meets every two weeks in the cantón of Jaramijo.  This area is known for the beautiful beaches that lap the coasts of this lovely place.  The majority of residents there are very hardworking and work in jobs related to the sea.

Eloísa lives in this area.  She is 50 years old and married.  She has three children with her husband, all of whom are adults.  One of them is a university student, and two of them still live with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

In order to earn something and be able to help with the household expenses, Eloísa works selling knickknacks, ice cream treats, soda, and snacks, among other items.  She works every day and her children help her with her sales.  Previously, she sold clothing but she left that line of work because she had a number of problems with the business.  For this reason, she set up this small shop in her home, and she is getting a lot of benefits that help her to get ahead.  She has more than ten years in retail sales, between selling clothing and now in her variety shop.

She is going to use this loan to buy items for her variety shop.  She has been in this credit group for ten years now and she likes it because she was able to start her business thanks to her first loan.  Her dream is to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her variety store.

loans.name: Carmen Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 10 y 6 años y el menor de 2 meses de nacido, los mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Carmen  tiene una tienda de víveres en casa de la mamá que es donde ellos viven, allí vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, lleva 3 años con su negocio el cual comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo y que con el paso de los días ha ido mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, entre otros víveres para ganar más clientela. Lleva 3 años en el  Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 credit group meets every two weeks in the cantón of Jaramijo.  This area is known for the beautiful beaches that lap the coasts of this lovely place.  The majority of residents there are very hardworking and work in jobs related to the sea.

Carmen lives in this area.  She is 29 years old and is married.  She has three children with her husband, ages 10, 6, and the youngest is just two months.  The older children are in school.  Her husband works as a fisherman.

Carmen has a grocery store in her mother’s home, where they live.  She sells basic necessities there, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, and meats, among other items.  She works every day from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. and sometimes even later.  She has had this business for three years.  She started it with the first loan that she received from the group, and with the passage of time she has gone on improving it with the help of her loans.

She is going to use this loan to stock her store better.  She is going to buy rice and sugar, among other grocery items in order to win more customers.  She has been in the credit group for three years and she likes it because it is how she started her business.  Her dream is to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar, among other groceries.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 51-year-old Lebanese widow. She lives with her only child.

Amal states that she works resolutely to provide her child with the bare minimum needs of life. Since last year she has worked making scrumptious homemade foods to sell.

Amal is applying for an 810,000 LBP loan through Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy more ingredients to continue production. In the future she plans to apply for additional Kiva loans to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya is a 24-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. Her husband is a painter and she started in 2009 to work as a female hairdresser in order to help him with the household expenses. Today, she is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to renew her hairdressing tools and supplies to provide her customers with better services. In the future, Aya wishes to further enlarge her salon by borrowing more Kiva loans.

loans.use: to renew her hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinforce the columns and walls and to paint her house.

loans.name: Armela

texts.en:
Armela is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Palompon, Leyte. She earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place.

Armela is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, condiments, and others. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more. 

In the future, Armela hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, condiments, and others.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris vive a 9 km del centro de la ciudad de Cochabamba, junto a sus papás y  hermanos. Ella nos comenta que su papá comenzó recientemente un negocio de fabricación de rockolas y su mamá tiene trabajos eventuales para cocinar en eventos sociales pero actualmente se encuentra delicada de salud por lo que necesita muchos cuidados y medicamentos.

Iris estudió la carrera de Contaduría Pública en la universidad estatal, pero no pudo concluirla ya que tuvo que empezar a trabajar para ayudar económicamente a su familia. Ahora ella solicita un crédito educativo para culminar sus estudios y así obtener su titulación. Su sueño desde niña es el de realizar una maestría ya que considera que al estar bien preparada, podrá optar a un mejor puesto de trabajo y de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia dándoles estabilidad económica y tener su propia casa.
 
Iris de antemano agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento, así como a ella se le están otorgando ahora.
texts.en:
Iris lives 9 km from downtown Cochabamba with her parents and siblings. She says her father recently started a business manufacturing jukeboxes and her mother works sporadically catering social events. However she currently has some health problems, so she needs a lot of care and medicine.

Iris started to study Public Accounting at the public university but wasn't able to finish because she had to start working in order to help her family financially. Now she is requesting a student loan in order to finish school and get her degree. Ever since she was little her dream has been to earn a master's degree, because she feels that if she is well prepared she will be able to access a better job that will allow her to continue helping her family, give them financial stability, and have her own house.
 
Iris wants to thank in advance all of the people who use their financial resources to help others like her and who are generating new opportunities for growth.

loans.use: to pay for her accounting studies.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, who is a 34-year-old married woman, lives in the Ikalto district. She has an artisan husband and the only source of income for the family is his salary. Nino wasn’t able to get an education and so she has no university degree, which is one of the main reasons for her unemployment. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Nino wants to start a business in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of her family. A loan of GEL 5,000 will be a great support to this motivated woman and her family, enabling her to purchase cement, sand and armature wire for bottling poles. The business will be profitable, she thinks, as the demand is high for this kind of concrete pole.

The income from this activity will help Nino to do her great bit for the family's welfare. Nino and her husband rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and armature wire for bottling poles.

loans.name: Mavlyudahon

texts.ru: Мавлюдахон, 35 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Мавлюдахон в качестве основного дохода занимается предоставлением массажных услуг в салоне красоты. Данным видом деятельности она занимается с 2012 года, уже наработала постоянную клиентуру и хочет расширить свою деятельность. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 30,000 сом (KGS). Мавлюдахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку вакуумного массажного аппарата. Эта покупка позволит увеличить спектр предоставляемых Мавлюдахон услуг, а следовательно и количество клиентов. Доходы от кредита Мавлюдахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своей деятельности, она хочет накопить средства на образование ее детей.
texts.en:
Mavlyudahon is 35 years old, married, and has three children. As a main source of income, Mavlyudahon offers massage sevices in a beauty salon. She has been involved in this type of activity since 2012, has already built up regular customers and wants to expand her work. Her monthly income amounts to an average of 30,000 som (KGS). Mavlyudahon applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a vacuum massage device. This purchase will increase Mavlyudahon's range of offered services, and hence also the number of customers.

Mavlyudahon plans to invest income from the loan in further developing her activities. She wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a vacuum massage device in order to be more competitive and increase the number of clients.
